notification_title: NYC Emergency Management Cold Weather Alert (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 12/14/16 at 3:00 PM. The New York City Emergency Management Department urges New Yorkers to prepare for upcoming extreme cold weather.  An arctic blast and strong winds will bring bitterly cold weather to the New York City area Thursday through Saturday, 12/15 - 12/17. With temperatures below freezing, wind chill values as low as zero degrees, and wind gusts as high as 40 mph, New Yorkers are encouraged to stay indoors as much as possible. When outdoors, be sure to wear dry, warm clothing and cover exposed skin.     New Yorkers are advised to check on their neighbors, friends, and relatives, especially the elderly and those with disabilities, and access and functional needs during periods of extreme cold. People most likely to be exposed to dangerous cold include those who lack shelter, work outdoors and/or live in homes with malfunctioning or inadequate heat. Seniors, infants, people with chronic cardiovascular or lung conditions, people using alcohol or drugs, and people with cognitive i

notification_title: Update: Two Alarm Fire - 1st Avenue & East 30th Street (MN)
email_body: Notification issued 12/14/16 at 12:33 PM. Emergency personnel are on the scene of a two alarm fire located at 1st Avenue and East 30th Street in Manhattan. Expect smoke, traffic delays, and a presence of emergency personnel and vehicles in the area. The NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene advises avoiding smoke exposure from structural fires by closing windows while indoors and reducing outdoor activity where smoke is present. People with heart or breathing conditions such as asthma may be more sensitive and should seek immediate medical attention if they experience a worsening of their condition, shortness of breath, or chest pains. notification_title: Three Alarm Fire - 3rd Avenue and East 38th Street (MN)
email_body: Notification issued 11/30/16 at 12:50 AM. Emergency personnel are on the scene of a three alarm fire located at 38th Street and 3rd Avenue in Manhattan. Expect smoke, traffic delays, and a presence of emergency personnel and vehicles in the area. The NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene advises avoiding smoke exposure from structural fires by closing windows while indoors and reducing outdoor activity where smoke is present. People with heart or breathing conditions such as asthma may be more sensitive and should seek immediate medical attention if they experience a worsening of their condition, shortness of breath, or chest pains.    To view this message in American Sign Language (ASL), Arabic, Bengali, Chinese, French, Haitian Creole, Italian, Korean, Polish, Russian, Spanish, Urdu, or Yiddish, please visit: http://on.nyc.gov/1kdbhe2.

The parade will begin at 9:00 AM and proceed on the following route:     Start  Central Park West and West 77th Street   South down Central Park West to Columbus Circle   South through the east side of Columbus Circle to West 59th Street   East on West 59th Street to 6th Avenue   South on 6th Avenue to West 34th Street   End - West on West 34th Street to 7th Avenue     Additional road closures will be in place in the area of the parade route in midtown Manhattan until 2:00 PM. For more details, please see the attached map: http://i.imgur.com/Gdx3sL2.jpg

Notification issued 11/22/16 at 6:45 PM. Due to balloon inflation for the 2016 Macys Thanksgiving Day Parade, the following road closures will be in effect tomorrow, 11/23:    Beginning at 9:30 AM:   West 81st Street and West 77th Street from Central Park West to Columbus Avenue  Beginning at 1:00 PM:   West 79th Street between Columbus Avenue and Amsterdam Avenue   Beginning at 3:00 PM:   West 81st Street to West 77th Street between Columbus Avenue and Amsterdam Avenue   West 76th Street between Columbus Avenue and Central Park West  Beginning at 10:00 PM:   West 81st Street and West 77th Street from Central Park West to Columbus Avenue   Central Park West from West 59th Street to West 86th Street    The balloon inflation event can be viewed by pedestrians from 3:00 PM until 10:00 PM on West 81st Street and West 77th Street from Central Park West to Columbus Avenue. Pedestrians can enter the viewing near the intersection of Columbus Avenue and West 79th Street.

notification_title: Coastal Flood Statement (Southern QN, BK, SI)
email_body: Notification issued 11/19/16 at 5:42 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Coastal Flood Statement for Southern Queens from 10:00 AM  1:00 PM on 11/19. The affected areas include the New York City Ocean Front west of Fire Island Inlet and South Shore of Staten Island. Tidal departures between 1 and 1.5 feet above normal are expected.    During a Coastal Flood Statement, minor flooding of the most vulnerable shore roads and/or properties is possible. Coastal residents should be alert for later statements and take action to protect property.    For more information, please visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

notification_title: Planned Road Closure & Diversion - Houston Street Overpass at FDR Drive (MN)
email_body: Notification issued 11/18/16 at 3:00 PM. Due to the New York City Department of Transportation's rehabilitation of the Houston Street Overpass at FDR Drive in Manhattan, there will be closures on the FDR Drive and adjacent streets tomorrow, Saturday, November 19, from 12:01 AM until 12:00 PM. Motorists traveling northbound on FDR Drive will be directed to exit the roadway at Exit 5 for Houston Street. Southbound FDR Drive will have one lane open. Motorists traveling southbound on the FDR Drive to destinations south of Houston Street should take the recommended detour onto Exit 7. Pedestrians and cyclists will be unable to access East River Park via the pedestrian ramps near Houston Street. For additional info: i.imgur.com/PUoWwt8.jpg

notification_title: Planned Closure - Trans-Manhattan Expressway Connector Ramp (MN/BX)
email_body: Notification issued on 11/11/2016 at 3:20 PM. The NYC Department of Transportation is continuing interim rehabilitation of the Trans-Manhattan Expressway Connector Ramp. This work will require a 53-hour continuous full closure of the Manhattan-bound (southbound) roadway linking the George Washington Bridge to the Harlem River Drive from 12:00 AM on Saturday, 11/12 to 5:00 AM on Monday, 11/14. One travel lane will be available to northbound motorists in the southbound roadway with access to the Amsterdam Avenue exit and the George Washington Bridge. For more information, please visit http://i.imgur.com/bAvNxPd.jpg.

Notification issued 11/11/16 at 11:15 AM. New York City is experiencing intermittent wind gusts in excess of 40 MPH. During periods of high winds, residents should use caution when walking or driving high profile vehicles. Winds at these speeds can cause flying debris, turn unsecured objects into projectiles, and cause power outages. To prepare, charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1. For the latest weather information, please visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

notification_title: Missing Vulnerable Adult - Laverne Wilson - Tracey (F/B/70)
email_body: Alert issued 10/31/16 at 6:35 PM. A Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert has been issued for Laverne Wilson Tracey, a 70-year-old black female from Hempstead, New York. She has dementia and may be in need of medical attention. Description: 5'2' tall, 140lbs, with gray hair and brown eyes. Wearing blue jeans, a light blue shirt, red jacket and light blue sneakers. Last Seen: Mason Street in Hempstead, New York approximately at 9:45 AM on October 31. Photo: http://bit.ly/2dWkRnD. If you see the missing person, please call Hempstead Village Police Department at (516) 573 - 7347 or call 9-1-1. To view this message in American Sign Language (ASL), Arabic, Bengali, Chinese, French, Haitian Creole, Italian, Korean, Polish, Russian, Spanish, Urdu, or Yiddish, please visit: http://on.nyc.gov/1UYt0TX.

notification_title: Possible Natural Gas Odor  Glenwood Rd btwn Rockaway Pkwy and Williams Ave (BK)
email_body: Notification issued 10/31/16 at 3:00 PM.  On Tuesday, 11/1, National Grid will be performing gas system construction work on Glenwood Road between Rockaway Parkway and Williams Avenue, Brooklyn.  This work will begin at approximately 7:00 AM and continue until 11:00 PM.  During this period of time, elevated natural gas odor may be experienced throughout the localized area.  Please report natural gas emergencies to 9-1-1 if they occur.

notification_title: Traffic Delays - Hugh L Carey Tunnel (BK/MN)
email_body: Notification issued 10/30/16 at 6:55 PM. Due to a motor vehicle collision, expect extensive traffic delays in both directions near the Hugh L Carey (formerly Brooklyn Battery) Tunnel. Consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time.

Notification issued 10/30/16 at 5:08 PM. New York City is experiencing intermittent wind gusts in excess of 40 MPH. During periods of high winds, residents should use caution when walking or driving high profile vehicles. Winds at these speeds can cause flying debris, turn unsecured objects into projectiles, and cause power outages. To prepare, charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1.     For the latest weather information, please visit www.weather.gov/nyc.
Notification issued 10/30/16 at 4:50 PM. Following a prior closure, all lanes of the Grand Central Parkway have reopened in Queens. Expect residual delays.

Notification issued 10/30/16 at 4:15 PM. Due to the NYPD investigation of a suspicious package, all lanes of the Grand Central Parkway are closed in both directions from the Cross Island Parkway to Little Neck Parkway in Queens. Consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time.

notification_title: Update: Six Alarm Fire - West 29th Street and 5th Avenue (MN)
email_body: Notification issued 10/30/16 at 9:15 AM. Emergency personnel are on the scene of what is now a six alarm fire located at West 29th Street and 5th Avenue in Manhattan. Expect smoke, traffic delays, possible road closures, and a presence of emergency personnel and vehicles in the area. The NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene advises avoiding smoke exposure from structural fires by closing windows while indoors and reducing outdoor activity where smoke is present. People with heart or breathing conditions such as asthma may be more sensitive and should seek immediate medical attention if they experience a worsening of their condition, shortness of breath, or chest pains.    To view this message in American Sign Language (ASL), Arabic, Bengali, Chinese, French, Haitian Creole, Italian, Korean, Polish, Russian, Spanish, Urdu, or Yiddish, please visit: http://on.nyc.gov/1kdbhe2.

Last seen wearing a navy hooded sweater, blue jeans, and a gray hat.    Last Seen: Amsterdam Avenue and 92nd Street on 10/28 at 1600 hours. notification_title: National Guard Exercise - Resorts World Casino (QN)
email_body: Notification issued 10/24/16 at 5:30 PM. The New York National Guard will be conducting a full-scale exercise tomorrow, 10/25, and Thursday, 10/27, at the Resort Worlds Casino at Rockaway Boulevard and 114th Street in Queens. The exercise is scheduled to occur from approximately 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM and will consist of emergency personnel utilizing personal protective equipment, including full hazmat suits. This is only an exercise.

Notification issued 10/24/16 at 10:18 AM. Con Edison is responding to a power outage in the Middle Village section of Queens, including parts of ZIP codes 11378 and 11379. Report power outages to Con Edison at 1-800-752-6633, or if you have a speech or hearing impairment, report outages to 1-800-642-2308. Please see http://www.coned.com/ for more information.    If you are affected by the outage, turn off all appliances, avoid downed and hanging power lines, and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you are having a life threatening medical emergency and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1. Silver Alert issued 10/19/16 at 3:00 PM.    A Silver Alert has been issued for the disappearance of Anthony Brown, a 67-year-old Black male from the Springfield Gardens section of Queens. notification_title: Commercial High Rise Fire - West 52nd Street and 6th Avenue (MN)
email_body: Notification issued 10/13/16 at 6:45 AM. Emergency personnel are on the scene of a commercial high rise fire located at West 52nd Street and 6th Avenue in Manhattan. Expect smoke, traffic delays, and a presence of emergency personnel and vehicles in the area. The NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene advises avoiding smoke exposure from structural fires by closing windows while indoors and reducing outdoor activity where smoke is present. People with heart or breathing conditions such as asthma may be more sensitive and should seek immediate medical attention if they experience a worsening of their condition, shortness of breath, or chest pains.  To view this message in American Sign Language (ASL), Arabic, Bengali, Chinese, French, Haitian Creole, Italian, Korean, Polish, Russian, Spanish, Urdu, or Yiddish, please visit: http://on.nyc.gov/1kdbhe2.

Expect smoke, traffic delays, and a presence of emergency personnel and vehicles in the area. The NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene advises avoiding smoke exposure from structural fires by closing windows while indoors and reducing outdoor activity where smoke is present. People with heart or breathing conditions such as asthma may be more sensitive and should seek immediate medical attention if they experience a worsening of their condition, shortness of breath, or chest pains. Notification issued 9/30/16 at 7:43 AM. New York City is experiencing intermittent wind gusts in excess of 40 MPH. During periods of high winds, residents should use caution when walking or driving high profile vehicles. Winds at these speeds can cause flying debris, turn unsecured objects into projectiles, and cause power outages.     To prepare, charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors.     If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1. For the latest weather information, please visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

Tidal departures of 1 1/2 - 2 feet above normal levels are expected. During a Coastal Flood Advisory, minor flooding of the most vulnerable shore roads and/or properties is possible. Coastal residents should be alert for later statements and take action to protect property. For more information, please visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

Notification issued 9/20/16 at 3:00 PM. Weather permitting, the NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene will spray adulticide to key mosquito breeding locations in residential areas of Brooklyn on Wednesday, 9/21, between the hours of 10:00 PM and 6:00 AM the following morning, 9/22. Adulticide will be sprayed from a truck in parts of the following ZIP codes: 11203, 11210, 11212, 11213, 11225, 11226, 12229, 11233, 11234, 11235, and 11236. Spraying is intended to reduce the number of mosquitoes and the risk of Zika and West Nile viruses.    In case of inclement weather, application will be delayed until Thursday, 9/22, during the same hours.    For more details, http://on.nyc.gov/2bqbNVN, http://i.imgur.com/7L8KBqM.jpg, or call 3-1-1. notification_title: Possible Natural Gas Odor - East 103rd St & Flatlands Ave (BK)
email_body: Notification issued 9/19/16 at 3:00 PM. Due to National Grid performing gas system work, a natural gas odor may be present in the vicinity of East 103 Street and Flatlands Avenue in Brooklyn. The work is scheduled to take place tomorrow, 9/20, from approximately 9:00 AM to 3:00 PM. Please report natural gas emergencies to 9-1-1 if they occur.

Notification issued 9:50 AM. The National Weather Service has issued a Flood Advisory for Queens until 11:30 AM. Periods of heavy rain may result in flooding and/or overflowing of poor drainage and low-lying areas. Do not drive your vehicle into areas where water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. Move to higher ground. For more information, please visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

notification_title: Update: Police Activity - Jamaica Avenue and Crescent Street (BK)
email_body: Notification issued 9/19/16 at 9:35 AM. Following the prior disruption, the J Line has resumed normal service in both directions. Additionally, police activity has cleared in the area of Jamaica Avenue and Crescent Street in Brooklyn.

notification_title: Police Activity - Jamaica Avenue and Crescent Street (BK)
email_body: Notification issued 9/19/16 at 8:41 AM. Due to police activity, expect emergency personnel and traffic delays in the area of Jamaica Avenue and Crescent Street in Brooklyn. The J Line is bypassing Cypress Hills in both directions. Consider alternate routes.

Alert issued 9/19/16 at 8:00 AM. ALERT: The following individual is wanted in regards to the Chelsea explosion: Ahmad Khan Rahami, 28 year old male. If seen, call 9-1-1. See image: http://i.imgur.com/KsHys4k.jpg

notification_title: Mass Transit Restoration - Amtrak and New Jersey Transit Trains (MN/NJ)
email_body: Notification issued 9/19/16 at 5:35 AM. Following a prior suspension due to police activity in Elizabeth, NJ, New Jersey Transit and Amtrak Trains have resumed service in and out of Penn Station (MN). Expect residual delays.

Notification issued 9/19/16 at 2:00 AM. Below is a traffic and transit update regarding the explosion that occurred in Chelsea on Saturday night:    -1 Train service has resumed making normal stops at 23rd Street and 28th Street in Manhattan  -E and F Trains have resumed making normal stops at 23rd Street in Manhattan  -Northbound traffic on 6th Avenue has reopened at 14th Street  -Southbound traffic on 7th Avenue has reopened at 34th Street  -All crosstown traffic (eastbound and westbound) has reopened from West 14th Street to West 23rd Street between 5th Avenue and 8th Avenue  -West 23rd Street remains closed between 6th Avenue and 7th Avenue     For additional information, please visit: www.mta.info

notification_title: Mass Transit Disruption - Amtrak and NJT Trains (MN/NJ)
email_body: Notification issued 9/18/16 at 11:36 PM. Due to police activity in Elizabeth, NJ, all New Jersey bound Amtrak and New Jersey Transit trains are being held in Penn Station (MN). Consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time. For more information, please visit: http://bit.ly/19MQNDC.

Notification issued 9/18/16 at 8:50 PM. Following the transit disruption as a result of the Chelsea explosion, 1 Train service has resumed making normal stops at 23rd Street and 28th Street in Manhattan. Customers should utilize the entrance at the southeast corner of 23rd Street and 7th Avenue as the entrance on the northeast corner remains closed.     All other previously reported road closures and transit disruptions remain in effect.    For updates, visit www.mta.info.

notification_title: United Nations General Assembly - Travel Advisory (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 9/18/16 at 7:50 PM. Due to the United Nations General Assembly expect significant traffic delays throughout Manhattan from September 19 - September 23. Anticipate traffic disruptions, various street closures, and an increased presence of emergency personnel. Use of public transportation is highly encouraged during this period.    For more information, please visit http://on.nyc.gov/2cno79o.

notification_title: Resident Support Center - West 23rd Street & 7th Avenue (MN)
email_body: Notification issued 9/18/16 at 6:45 PM. In support of the explosion in Chelsea, NYC will open a Resident Service Center which will be located inside of the NYC Emergency Management vehicle located on the northeast corner of West 23rd Street and 7th Avenue in Manhattan. Assistance will be available until 9 PM today, 9/18, and again from 8 AM to 9 PM tomorrow, 9/19, and Tuesday, 9/20, for those affected.    To view a picture of the NYC Emergency Management vehicle, please visit http://bit.ly/2cUCK3l.

Notification issued 9/18/16 at 5:06 PM. Update: Due to ongoing emergency operations as a result of last night's explosion in the neighborhood of Chelsea in Manhattan, the following traffic restrictions and transit disruptions remain in place:    - West 23rd Street remains closed between 5th Avenue and 7th Avenue  - 6th Avenue remains closed between West 14th Street and West 25th Street  - NYCT E, F, and 1 Trains are bypassing 23rd Street and 28th Street stations in both directions  - MTA M5, M7 Northbound, M23, and X10, X17, X27, X28, and X1 Manhattan-bound buses are detoured around the area    Please visit www.mta.info for updates.

Notification issued 9/18/16 at 4:25 PM. NYPD controlled detonation activity will occur today near Rodmans Neck in The Bronx. The activity is scheduled to take place between approximately 4:30 PM and 6:30 PM. The effects of this routine activity may be heard in nearby neighborhoods.
Notification issued 9/18/16 at 2:00 PM. The prior flooding issue at Pre-K site PK812 has been resolved. Starting tomorrow, 9/19, staff and students will return to 411 46th Street in Brooklyn.

Notification issued 9/18/16 at 11:48 AM. Update: Due to ongoing emergency operations as a result of last night's explosion in the neighborhood of Chelsea in Manhattan, the following traffic restrictions and transit disruptions remain in place:    - West 23rd Street is closed in both directions between 5th and 7th Avenues  - Northbound traffic is restricted on 6th Avenue at 14th Street  - Southbound traffic is restricted on 7th Avenue at 34th Street  - All cross-town (eastbound and westbound) traffic is restricted from West 14th Street to West 32nd street between 5th Avenue and 8th Avenue  - NYCT E, F, 1, and 2 Trains are bypassing 23rd Street and 28th Street stations in both directions  - MTA M5, M7 Northbound, M23, and X10, X17, X27, X28, and X1 Manhattan-bound buses are detoured around the area    Please visit www.mta.info for updates.    Residents are being allowed access to the area with a police escort only. If you require access to the affected areas, please bring identification for proof of residence o

Notification issued 9/18/16 at 3:40 AM. Due to the earlier explosion in Chelsea, crosstown traffic eastbound and westbound is closed from West 14th Street to West 32nd Street, from 5th Avenue to 8th Avenue in Manhattan. These closures are in effect until further notice.
Alert issued 9/18/16 at 2:40 AM. UPDATE: The suspicious device on West 27th Street in Chelsea has been safely removed by the NYPD Bomb Squad.

Alert issued 9/18/16 at 12:34 AM. ALERT: NYPD is requesting residents on West 27th Street between 6th Avenue and 7th Avenue in Manhattan to stay away from windows facing 27th Street until they clear a suspicious package.

Notification issued 9/17/16 at 11:10 PM. Due to an explosion at West 23rd Street between 6th Avenue and 7th Avenue, the following subway lines are impacted:    The F Line is suspended between Delancey Street (MN) and 21st Street/Queensbridge (QN).    Selected E service will operate via the R Line to Whitehall Street to be turned back north.    The 1 Line is suspended between South Ferry and 34th Street in both directions.    The 2 Line is suspended between 34th Street and Chambers Street (MN) in both directions.    Selected southbound 1 and 2 service will be turned at 34th Street.    The following street closures to vehicular and pedestrian traffic are in effect:    Northbound traffic on 6th Avenue at 14th Street, southbound traffic on 7th Avenue at 34th Street, and 23rd Street is closed in both directions between 5th Avenue and 7th Avenue.    There are no impacts to Penn Station, Amtrak, LIRR or NJT service.    Please avoid the area.

email_body: Notification issued 9/17/16 at 9:38 PM. Due to an explosion at 23rd Street between 6th and 7th Avenues in Manhattan, expect train service delays/cancellations, street closures, and traffic delays in the vicinity. Consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time.

Report power outages to Con Edison at 1-800-752-6633, or if you have a speech or hearing impairment, report outages to 1-800-642-2308. Please see http://www.coned.com/ for more information. Notification issued 9/14/16 at 5:45 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Severe Thunderstorm Warning for Manhattan, Brooklyn and Queens until 6:30 PM. Strong winds & heavy rain is expected. For more info, visit www.weather.gov/nyc. During a severe thunderstorm, be prepared to potentially lose power. Charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, & turn refrigerators/freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances & keep refrigerator/freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you lose power & have a disability or access needs or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) & need immediate assistance, dial 9-1-1. notification_title: Three Alarm Fire - Greene & Broome Streets (MN)
email_body: Notification issued 9/13/16 at 9:07 PM. Emergency personnel are on the scene of a three alarm fire located at Greene and Broome Streets (MN). Expect smoke, traffic delays, and a presence of emergency personnel and vehicles in the area. The NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene advises avoiding smoke exposure from structural fires by closing windows while indoors and reducing outdoor activity where smoke is present. People with heart or breathing conditions such as asthma may be more sensitive and should seek immediate medical attention if they experience a worsening of their condition, shortness of breath, or chest pains.    To view this message in American Sign Language (ASL), Arabic, Bengali, Chinese, French, Haitian Creole, Italian, Korean, Polish, Russian, Spanish, Urdu, or Yiddish, please visit: http://on.nyc.gov/1kdbhe2.

notification_title: Missing Vulnerable Adult - Mohammad Saleem M/A/29 (CW)
email_body: Alert issued 9/13/16 at 3:00 PM.  The Nassau County Police Department has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for the disappearance of Mohammad Saleem, a 29-year-old mute and deaf Indian male with Down syndrome.  He is from New Cassel, New York, and may be in need of medical attention.    The missing was last seen 9/13 at approximately 7:00 AM in the area of Elderberry Lane in the New Cassel section of New York.  He may be traveling towards Jamaica, Queens.    He is described at 4'8' tall, 98 lbs with black hair, brown eyes and was last seen wearing a black t-shirt with blue jeans.    A photo is attached: http://imgur.com/RhY7xaX.jpg.    If you see the missing person, please call Nassau County Police Department at  (516) 573-7347 or call 9-1-1.    To view this message in American Sign Language (ASL), Arabic, Bengali, Chinese, French, Haitian Creole, Italian, Korean, Polish, Russian, Spanish, Urdu, or Yiddish, please visit: http://on.nyc.gov/1UYt0TX.

Adulticide will be sprayed from a truck in parts of the following ZIP codes: 10461, 10465, 10466, 10469, 10475, 10454, 10455, 10459, 10472, 10473, 10474, 10302, 10310, 10314, 10309 and 10312. Spraying is intended to reduce the number of mosquitoes and the risk of Zika and West Nile viruses.    In case of inclement weather, application will be delayed until Thursday, 9/15, during the same hours. To find the nearest cooling center and hours of operation, call 311 or visit www.nyc.gov/beattheheat.    For more information, please visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

Due to life threatening rip currents from Post-Tropical Cyclone Hermine, NYC Parks will close all City beaches to swimming, bathing, and surfing on Wednesday, 9/7. Outdoor pools will be accessible as weather permits. For more information: www.nyc.gov/parks, http://on.nyc.gov/2bOtMqd, or call 3-1-1.

Notification issued 9/6/16 at 9:00 AM. The National Weather Service has issued a Coastal Flood Statement for Staten Island from 11:00 AM to 2:00 PM today, 9/6. The affected area includes the low lying coastal areas around Staten Island. Tidal departures of 1.5 to 2.0 feet above astronomical tides are expected.    During a coastal flood event, minor flooding of the most vulnerable shore roads and/or adjacent properties is possible due to the height of the storm tide.    For more information, please visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

Notification issued 9/6/16 at 8:20 AM. New York City is experiencing intermittent wind gusts in excess of 40 MPH. During periods of high winds, residents should use caution when walking or driving high profile vehicles. Winds at these speeds can cause flying debris, turn unsecured objects into projectiles, and cause power outages.     To prepare, charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors.     If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1. For the latest weather information, please visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

Notification issued 9/4/16 at 7:00 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Tropical Storm Warning for New York City until further notice. New Yorkers should take actions ahead of the storm to prepare for high winds, minor-to-moderate coastal flooding, rain, life-threatening rip tides, and high surf.  The National Weather Service is currently forecasting sustained winds of 20-30 mph with the potential for gusts up to 50 mph for the NYC area beginning as early as Sunday, and possibly extending through Tuesday evening. High winds can bring down trees and power lines and can turn unsecured objects into dangerous projectiles. When winds reach tropical storm levels, NYC area bridges may implement speed and vehicle restrictions. New Yorkers should expect potential restrictions Sunday evening through Tuesday. Due to life-threatening rip tides, NYC beaches are closed to swimming, surfing, and bathing on Monday, September 5, 2016. Prepare for flooding: If you live in a flood-susceptible area, keep sandbags, plywo

notification_title: Three Alarm Fire - Lafayette Avenue and Marcus Garvey Boulevard (BK)
email_body: Notification issued 9/3/16 at 10:39 PM. Emergency personnel are on the scene of a three alarm fire located at Lafayette Avenue and Marcus Garvey Boulevard in Brooklyn. Expect smoke, traffic delays, and a presence of emergency personnel and vehicles in the area. The NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene advises avoiding smoke exposure from structural fires by closing windows while indoors and reducing outdoor activity where smoke is present. People with heart or breathing conditions such as asthma may be more sensitive and should seek immediate medical attention if they experience a worsening of their condition, shortness of breath, or chest pains. When winds reach tropical storm levels, NYC area bridges may implement speed and vehicle restrictions. New Yorkers should expect potential restrictions Sunday evening through Tuesday. notification_title: Tropical Storm Watch and Storm Surge Watch - 9/2 (CW)
email_body: Alert issued 9/2/16 at 12:25 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Tropical Storm Watch for New York City. A Tropical Storm Watch is issued 48 hours in advance of the possible onset of tropical-storm-force winds, which include sustained wind speeds of 39mph-74mph.     The National Weather Service has also issued a Storm Surge Watch for coastal areas of New York City until further notice. The combination of strong winds, dangerous storm surge and high tide may cause normally dry areas to be flooded by rising waters moving inland from the shoreline within the next 48 hours.    During a Tropical Storm Watch and a Storm Surge Watch, prepare your home and review your plan for evacuation in case a Hurricane or Tropical Storm Warning is issued. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1.    For the latest weather information, visit www.weather.gov/nyc.    For additional information and to find your evacuatio

notification_title: NYC Emergency Management Monitors Hurricane Hermine (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 9/1/16 at 5:25 PM. The New York City Emergency Management Department is closely monitoring Hurricane Hermine and the possible effects the storm may have on the City as it moves towards the north. The storm is expected to be near the Florida coast tonight or early tomorrow morning before making its way up the east coast.     While there is significant uncertainty in the track, instensity, and speed of the storm, possible impacts to the City include strong rip currents, high surf, coastal flooding, heavy rain, and strong winds.     For the latest weather information, visit www.weather.gov/nyc. For more information and preparedness tips, visit http://on.nyc.gov/2bHDCsg.

Notification issued 8/13/16 at 8:53 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Severe Thunderstorm Watch for New York City until 1:00 AM Sunday. Strong winds and heavy rain are possible.     A Severe Thunderstorm Watch means conditions are favorable for severe thunderstorms to occur in and close to the watch area. Persons within these areas should be on the lookout for threatening weather conditions and listen for later statements and possible warnings. Exercise caution when walking, driving, or biking.     Winds at these speeds can cause flying debris, turn unsecured objects into projectiles, and cause power outages. To prepare, charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaini

Alert issued 8/13/16 at 10:45 AM. Con Edison is asking customers in some Brooklyn neighborhoods to conserve energy while company crews work to repair equipment problems. Con Edison has also reduced voltage by 5 percent in those areas as a precaution to protect equipment and maintain service as repairs are made.    The area includes the following neighborhoods: Sheepshead Bay, Marine Park, Gerritsen Beach, Midwood, Flatbush, and East Flatbush.    Company crews are working now to repair the problem. Con Edison has asked customers in these areas not to use energy-intensive appliances such as washers, dryers, microwaves and, if not needed for health or medical reasons, air conditioners, until the equipment problems are resolved.    Customers can report outages and check service restoration status at www.coned.com or by calling 1-800-75-CONED (1-800-752-6633). For more energy tips, visit www.coned.com. notification_title: 3 Alarm Fire - East 235 Street & Carpenter Avenue (BX)
email_body: Notification issued 8/9/16 at 12:55 PM. Emergency personnel are on the scene of a three alarm fire located at East 235 Street and Carpenter Avenue in The Bronx. Expect smoke, traffic delays, and a presence of emergency personnel and vehicles in the area. The NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene advises avoiding smoke exposure from structural fires by closing windows while indoors and reducing outdoor activity where smoke is present. People with heart or breathing conditions such as asthma may be more sensitive and should seek immediate medical attention if they experience a worsening of their condition, shortness of breath, or chest pains. email_body: Notification issued 8/7/16 at 12:00 PM. Weather permitting, the NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene will aerially apply larvicide to key mosquito breeding areas in non-residential areas (mainly marshes and other large wetlands) between 6 AM and 7 PM on Monday 8/8, Tuesday 8/9, and Wednesday 8/10, to reduce the number of mosquitoes and the risk of Zika and West Nile viruses. A helicopter will be used for this event. The larviciding will be conducted in parts of the following ZIP codes in the Bronx, Staten Island, Brooklyn and Queens: 10303, 10311, 10314, 10306, 10308, 10309, 10312, 10305, 10310, 11229, 11234, 11239, 11362, 11363, 11354, 11356, 11357, 11691, 11629, 11413, 11422, 11355, 11365, 10464, 10475, and 10465.      In case of inclement weather, the larviciding will be rescheduled to occur from 6AM - 7PM on August 9th, 10th, and 11th.    For details, go to http://on.nyc.gov/1rGzdLi, http://bit.ly/2bbZ7ji, http://i.imgur.com/CJuUdjf.jpg or call 3-1-1.    To view this message in American Sign Langua

notification_title: Planned Road Closures - Summer Streets Series - 8/6, 8/13, 8/20 (MN)
email_body: Notification issued 8/5/16 at 3:00 PM. Due to the Summer Streets series, various street closures will be in effect in Manhattan from 7:00 AM to 1:00 PM August 6th, August 13th, and August 20th.      For more information please go to: http://on.nyc.gov/1jPOgNG.

notification_title: Planned Mass Transit Closure - PATH Train Weekend Service Disruptions - 8/9 - 12/19 (MN)
email_body: Notification issued 8/5/16 at 3:00 PM. Due to federally mandated safety and service upgrades, all PATH train stations in Manhattan  will be closed on the weekends beginning August 6 through December 19, 2016. The closure will begin on Saturdays at 12:10 AM until Mondays at 5:00 AM.    PATH weekend shuttle bus service will be available for pick - up and drop - off at various locations. For service to New Jersey, take a NYC Subway train to the World Train Center or use the free weekend shuttle bus service that operates between the World Trade Center and 29th Street.     For more information and a map of shuttle bus service locations please visit: http://i.imgur.com/DrmTkAu.png.

Notification issued 8/5/16 at 12:35 PM. Emergency personnel are on the scene of a transformer fire located at Centre Street and White Street in Manhattan. Expect smoke, traffic delays, and a presence of emergency personnel and vehicles in the area. The NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene advises avoiding smoke exposure from structural fires by closing windows while indoors and reducing outdoor activity where smoke is present. People with heart or breathing conditions such as asthma may be more sensitive and should seek immediate medical attention if they experience a worsening of their condition, shortness of breath, or chest pains.    To view this message in American Sign Language (ASL), Arabic, Bengali, Chinese, French, Haitian Creole, Italian, Korean, Polish, Russian, Spanish, Urdu, or Yiddish, please visit: http://on.nyc.gov/1kdbhe2.

email_body: Notification issued 8/4/16 at 4:44 AM. Emergency personnel continue to operate on scene of what is now a five alarm fire at 37th Street at Queens Boulevard in Queens. Expect smoke and a presence of emergency personnel and vehicles in the area. For local traffic, there are extensive delays on all Manhattan-bound lanes of Queens Boulevard at 39th Street (QN).  Consider alternate routes and allow additional travel time.The NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene advises avoiding smoke exposure from structural fires by closing windows while indoors and reducing outdoor activity where smoke is present. People with heart or breathing conditions such as asthma may be more sensitive and should seek immediate medical attention if they experience a worsening of their condition, shortness of breath, or chest pains.

Silver Alert issued 8/4/16 at 4:00 PM.    The NYPD has issued a Silver Alert for the disappearance of Lloyd Garcia, a 73-year-old Hispanic male of the Jamaica section of Queens.    The missing was last seen on 8/2 at approximately 8:00 AM in the area of Sean Bell Way and 95th Avenue(QN).    He is described as 5'9', 170 lbs., with gray hair, brown eyes, thin build and a beard. He was last seen wearing a dark green t - shirt, gray jeans and black boots.      A photo is attached: http://i.imgur.com/k4ueLSm.jpg.    Anyone with information in regards to this incident is asked to call the NYPD's Crime Stoppers Hotline at 1-800-577-TIPS (8477) or for Spanish, 1-888-57-PISTA (74782). Notification issued 8/3/16 at 9:00 AM. Weather permitting, the NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene will spray adulticide to key mosquito breeding locations in residential areas on Thursday, 8/4, between the hours of 10:00 PM and 6:00 AM the following morning, 8/5. notification_title: Flash Flood Warning (BK, QN, MN, BX)
email_body: Alert issued 7/31/16 at 9:40 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Flash Flood Warning for Brooklyn, Queens, Manhattan, and the Bronx until 12:30 AM. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage areas and low lying spots. Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. Move to higher ground.    For the latest information, visit: http://www.weather.gov/nyc.    If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1.    Residential oil tanks in flooded basements may leak or rupture. If you suspect an oil spill in your home, call the NYSDEC Spill Hotline at (800) 457-7362. For more information on home heating oil spills, visit http://www.dec.ny.gov/chemical/8428.html#response or call 311.    To view this message in American Sign Language

Do not drive your vehicle into areas where water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. Move to higher ground.    For more information, please visit www.weather.gov/nyc

For more information, please visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

notification_title: LIRR Suspension  - All Service Between Penn, Atlantic, & Jamaica (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 7/25/16 at 7:00 PM. Due to weather-related signal problems, all Long Island Railroad service between Penn Station, Atlantic Terminal, and Jamaica is suspended in both directions. NYC Transit is cross-honoring at Jamaica (Sutphin - Archer) for service to Penn. Notification issued 7/25/16 at 5:16 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Severe Thunderstorm Warning for New York City until 5:45 PM. Strong winds & heavy rain is expected. For more info, visit www.weather.gov/nyc. During a severe thunderstorm, be prepared to potentially lose power. Charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, & turn refrigerators/freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances & keep refrigerator/freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you lose power & have a disability or access needs or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) & need immediate assistance, dial 9-1-1. Alert issued 7/25/16 at 5:07 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Flash Flood Warning for Queens, Brooklyn, and Staten Island until 8:00 PM. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage areas and low lying spots. Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. Move to higher ground.    For the latest information, visit: http://www.weather.gov/nyc.    If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1.    Residential oil tanks in flooded basements may leak or rupture. If you suspect an oil spill in your home, call the NYSDEC Spill Hotline at (800) 457-7362. For more information on home heating oil spills, visit http://www.dec.ny.gov/chemical/8428.html#response or call 311.    To view this message in American Sign Language (ASL), A

Notification issued 7/25/16 at 12:50 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Severe Thunderstorm Watch for NYC until 8:00 PM tonight. Strong winds and heavy rain are possible.     A Severe Thunderstorm Watch means conditions are favorable for severe thunderstorms to occur in and close to the watch area. Persons within these areas should be on the lookout for threatening weather conditions and listen for later statements and possible warnings. Exercise caution when walking, driving, or biking.     Winds at these speeds can cause flying debris, turn unsecured objects into projectiles, and cause power outages. To prepare, charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equip

notification_title: Mosquito Larviciding - July 26-July 28 (SI, BK, QN, BX)
email_body: Notification issued 7/25/16 at 12:00 PM. Weather permitting, the NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene will aerially apply larvicide to key mosquito breeding locations in non-residential areas (mainly marshes and other large wetlands) between 6:00 AM and 7:00 PM on Tuesday 7/26, Wednesday 7/27, and Thursday 7/28, to reduce the number of mosquitoes and the risk of Zika and West Nile viruses. A helicopter will be used for this event. The larviciding will be conducted in parts of the following ZIP codes in Staten Island, Brooklyn, Queens and The Bronx: 10303, 10305, 10306, 10308, 10309, 10310, 10311, 10312, 10314, 10464, 10465, 10475, 11229, 11234, 11239, 11354, 11355, 11356, 11357, 11362, 11363, 11413, 11422, 11691, and 11692.    In case of inclement weather, the larviciding will be rescheduled to occur 6:00 AM - 7:00 PM on Friday 7/29, Saturday 7/30, and Sunday 7/31.    For more details, go to http://on.nyc.gov/1rGzdLi, http://i.imgur.com/U9vUOlm.jpg, or call 3-1-1.    To view this message in American Si

Notification 7/24/16 at 3:00 PM. Opening fire hydrants without spray caps is illegal, wasteful and dangerous. Illegally opened hydrants can lower water pressure and put lives at risk if there is a fire. Children can also be at risk, because the powerful force of an open hydrant without a spray cap can cause serious injury. New Yorkers should call 3-1-1 to report open hydrants. Hydrants can be opened legally with a City-approved spray cap which can be obtained by an adult, 18 or over, free of charge, at local firehouses.

Alert issued 7/23/16 at 11:35 PM. Con Edison is asking customers in sections of Riverdale and Washington Heights to conserve energy while company crews work to repair equipment problems. Con Edison has also reduced voltage by 8 percent in those areas as a precaution to protect equipment and maintain service as repairs are made. Company crews are working now to repair the problem. Con Edison has asked customers in these areas not to use energy-intensive appliances such as washers, dryers, microwaves and, if not needed for health or medical reasons, air conditioners, until the equipment problems are resolved.     Customers can report outages and check service restoration status at www.coned.com or by calling 1-800-75-CONED (1-800-752-6633). For more energy tips, visit www.coned.com.

notification_title: Missing Vulnerable Alert - Dwight Rowe M/B/24 (CW)
email_body: Alert issued 7/19/16 at 3:38 PM.    The Suffolk County Police Department has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for the disappearance of Dwight Rowe, a 24-year-old, Black male with autism from North Amityville, NY.      He is described as 5'2', 183  lbs., with black hair and brown eyes. He was last seen wearing a black t-shirt with an orange tank top underneath, camouflage colored shorts, slippers and was carrying a lunchbox .    The missing was last seen at his home on Silverpine Drive in North Amityville at approximately 7:00 AM today,  Tuesday July 19, 2016.    Photo of missing can be seen here: http://i.imgur.com/pOcBpNY.png    If seen, please call Suffolk County Police Department at (631) 852-6000 or 911. Silver Alert issued 7/19/16 at 3:40 AM.  The NYPD has issued a Silver Alert for the disappearance of James Watson, a 94-year-old Black male from the Unionport area of the Bronx.    The missing is in need of medical attention as he is legally blind, hearing impaired, suffers from dementia and Alzheimer's disease.    He was last seen on 7/18 at approximately 5:00 PM in the area of W Kingsbridge Road and Sedgwick Avenue (BX).    The missing is described as 5'4', 130 lbs., with gray hair.  He was last seen wearing a yellow shirt, blue jeans and black baseball hat with a World War II insignia.    A photo is attached: http://i.imgur.com/f3P1hlc.jpg    Anyone with information in regards to this incident is asked to call the NYPD's Crime Stoppers Hotline at 1-800-577-TIPS (8477) or for Spanish, 1-888-57-PISTA (74782). The public can also submit their tips by logging onto the Crime stoppers website at WWW.NYPDCRIMESTOPPERS.COM or by texting their tips to 274637 (CRIMES) then enter TIP577. All calls are strictly confid

Notification issued 7/18/16 at 12:20 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Severe Thunderstorm Watch for New York City until 8:00 PM. Strong winds and heavy rain are possible.     A Severe Thunderstorm Watch means conditions are favorable for severe thunderstorms to occur in and close to the watch area. Persons within these areas should be on the lookout for threatening weather conditions and listen for later statements and possible warnings. Exercise caution when walking, driving, or biking.     Winds at these speeds can cause flying debris, turn unsecured objects into projectiles, and cause power outages. To prepare, charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equ

email_body: Alert issued 7/15/16 at 3:45 PM.    The Yonkers City Police Department has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for the disappearance of Joseph Sutera, a 62-year-old, white male from the Yonkers, NY.  He also suffers from schizophrenia and may be suicidal, needing medical attention. Be advised, he is mentally unstable and could be a danger to himself or others. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch means conditions are favorable for severe thunderstorms to occur in and close to the watch area. Persons within these areas should be on the lookout for threatening weather conditions and listen for later statements and possible warnings. Exercise caution when walking, driving, or biking.     Winds at these speeds can cause flying debris, turn unsecured objects into projectiles, and cause power outages. To prepare, charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equi

email_body: Notification issued 7/7/16 at 9:08 AM. Emergency personnel are on the scene of a three alarm fire located at West 42nd Street and 11th Avenue in Manhattan. Expect smoke, traffic delays, and a presence of emergency personnel and vehicles in the area. The NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene advises avoiding smoke exposure from structural fires by closing windows while indoors and reducing outdoor activity where smoke is present. People with heart or breathing conditions such as asthma may be more sensitive and should seek immediate medical attention if they experience a worsening of their condition, shortness of breath, or chest pains. notification_title: Mosquito Larviciding - July 7 - 9 (SI, BK, QN, BX)
email_body: Notification issued 7/6/16 at 12:00 PM. Weather permitting, the NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene will aerially apply larvicide to key mosquito breeding areas in non-residential areas (mainly marshes and other large wetlands) between 6:00 AM and 7:00 PM on Thursday 7/7, Friday 7/8, and Saturday 7/9, to reduce the number of mosquitoes and the risk of Zika and West Nile viruses. A helicopter will be used for this event. The larviciding will be conducted in parts of the following ZIP codes in Staten Island, Brooklyn, Queens and The Bronx: 10303, 10305, 10306, 10308, 10309, 10310, 10311, 10312, 10314, 10464, 10465, 10475, 11229, 11234, 11239, 11354, 11355, 11365, 11357, 11362, 11363, 11365, 11413, 11422, 11691, & 11692.    In case of inclement weather, the larviciding will be rescheduled to occur from 6:00 AM - 7:00 PM on July 8th, 9th, and 10th.     For more details, go to http://on.nyc.gov/1rGzdLi, http://i.imgur.com/IsZ1AG6.png, or call 3-1-1.    To view this message in American Sign Language (ASL),

Notification issued 7/1/16 at 9:18 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Severe Thunderstorm Warning for Queens until 10:00 PM and an extension of the already issued Severe Thunderstorm Warning for The Bronx and Manhattan until 10 PM. Strong winds and heavy rain are expected.    Info: http://www.weather.gov/nyc.    During a severe thunderstorm, be prepared to potentially lose power. Charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by the outage, turn off all appliances, avoid downed and hanging power lines, and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1. Alert issued 7/1/16 at 2:00 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Tornado Watch for the New York City area until 10:00 PM. A Tornado Watch indicates that conditions are favorable for a tornado to form. A tornado has not yet developed or been reported.    A Tornado Watch means conditions are favorable for a tornado to occur in and close to the watch area. Persons within these areas should be on the lookout for threatening weather conditions and listen for later statements and possible warnings. Exercise caution when walking, driving, or biking.     Tornadoes can cause flying debris, turn unsecured objects into projectiles, and cause power outages. To prepare, charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you lose power and have a disability or

DATE CORRECTION: Notification issued 6/23/16 at 10:17 AM. Weather permitting, the NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene will aerially apply larvicide to key mosquito breeding areas in non-residential areas (mainly marshes and other large wetlands) between 6 AM and 7 PM on Friday  6/24, Saturday 6/25, and Sunday  6/26, to reduce the number of mosquitoes and the risk of Zika and West Nile viruses. A helicopter will be used for this event. The larviciding will be conducted in parts of the following ZIP codes in Staten Island, Brooklyn, Queens and The Bronx: 10303, 10305, 10306, 10308, 10309, 10310, 10311, 10312, 10314, 10464, 10465, 10475, 11229, 11234, 11239, 11354, 11355, 11356, 11357, 11362, 11363, 11365, 11413, 11422, 11691, & 11692.    In case of inclement weather, the larviciding will be rescheduled to occur from 6AM - 7PM on June 25, 26, and 27th.    For more details, go to http://www1.nyc.gov/site/doh/health/health-topics/west-nile-virus-spray.page or  http://i.imgur.com/BbqvIKt.jpg, or call 3-1-1.

notification_title: Silver Alert - Doris J. Dunbar F/B/76 (CW)
email_body: Silver Alert issued 6/14/16 at 9:10 PM.  The NYPD has issued a Silver Alert for the disappearance of Doris J. Dunbar, a 76-year-old Black female with dementia.    Ms. Dunbar was last seen 6/14 at approximately 11:05 AM in the Citadel Rehab & Nursing Center, located at 3400 Cannon Place (BX).  However, she may have traveled to one of the NYCHA Marcy Houses, located 552 Marcy Avenue (BK).    Ms. Dunbar is described as 5'4', 120 lbs., with gray hair and brown eyes. She was last seen wearing a black hat, brown hooded sweatshirt, pink sweatpants and black sneakers.  Ms. Dunbar does not have identification and may be in need of medical attention.    A photo is attached here: http://i.imgur.com/LqkmBrJ.png    If seen, please call 9-1-1    To view this message in American Sign Language (ASL), Arabic, Bengali, Chinese, French, Haitian Creole, Italian, Korean, Polish, Russian, Spanish, Urdu, or Yiddish, please visit: http://on.nyc.gov/1ZlUYf1..

Notification issued 6/12/16 at 12:15 PM. New York City is experiencing intermittent wind gusts in excess of 40 MPH. During periods of high winds, residents should use caution when walking or driving high profile vehicles. Winds at these speeds can cause flying debris, turn unsecured objects into projectiles, and cause power outages.     To prepare, charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors.     If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1. For the latest weather information, please visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

notification_title: Mosquito Larviciding - June 9 -11th (SI, BK, QN, BX)
email_body: Notification issued 6/8/16 at 3:00 PM. Weather permitting, the NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene will aerially apply larvicide to key mosquito breeding areas in non-residential areas (mainly marshes and other large wetlands) between 6 AM and 7 PM on Thursday 6/9, Friday 6/10, and Saturday 6/11, to reduce the number of mosquitoes and the risk of Zika and West Nile viruses. A helicopter will be used for this event. The larviciding will be conducted in parts of the following ZIP codes in Staten Island, Brooklyn, Queens and The Bronx: 10303, 10305, 10306, 10308, 10309, 10310, 10311, 10312, 10314, 10464, 10465, 10475, 11229, 11234, 11239, 11354, 11355, 11356, 11357, 11362, 11363, 11365, 11413, 11422, 11691, & 11692.    In case of inclement weather, the larviciding will be rescheduled to occur from 6AM - 7PM on June 10, 11, and 12th.     For more details, go to http://www1.nyc.gov/site/doh/health/health-topics/west-nile-virus-spray.page, http://i.imgur.com/KNDRO02.png, or call 3-1-1.    To view this messa

Charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, & turn refrigerators/freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances & keep refrigerator/freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. Notification 6/5/16 at 3:20 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Severe Thunderstorm Watch for NYC until 10:00 PM on 6/5. Dangerous lightning, heavy rain, and strong winds are possible. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch means conditions are favorable for severe thunderstorms to occur in an close to the watch area. Persons within these areas should be on the lookout for threatening weather conditions and listen for later statements and possible warnings. Exercise caution when walking, driving, or biking.      The safest place to be during a thunderstorm is indoors as dangerous lightning can occur.      Do not use the telephone, electrical appliances, showers, sinks, or any object, machine, or device connected to the buildings electrical wiring or plumbing systems. If lightning strikes the building, the current will likely flow through the electrical wiring or water pipes and you could receive a fatal shock.     If you are caught outside during a thunderstorm:  - Stay away from tall, isolated trees or other

Notification issued 6/5/16 at 9:00 AM. The National Weather Service has issued a Coastal Flood Advisory for Brooklyn, Southern Queens, and Staten Island from 8:00 PM to 11:00 PM today, 6/5. The affected area includes the South Shore Bays of Long Island, and the tidally affected portions of Northeastern New Jersey and Lower New York Harbor. Tidal departures of 0.5 feet above astronomical tides are expected.    During a Coastal Flood Advisory, minor flooding of the most vulnerable shore roads and/or properties is possible due to the height of storm tide or wave splash-over. Coastal residents should be alert for later statements and take action to protect property.    For more information, please visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

notification_title: Severe Weather - The Governors Ball Cancellation (MN)

email_body: Notification issued 6/4/16 at 6:30 PM. New York City Emergency Management has issued a Weather Advisory for Sunday, June 5, 2016. According to the National Weather Service, heavy rain and thunderstorms are expected for the New York City area on Sunday. The heaviest period of rain and thunderstorms is expected Sunday afternoon and evening, with isolated downpours, small hail, damaging wind gusts, and flash flooding possible. New Yorkers are advised to stay indoors during periods of severe weather.    The National Weather Service has advised of the possibility of wind gusts in excess of 30 MPH. During periods of high winds, residents should use caution when walking or driving high profile vehicles. Winds at high speeds can cause flying debris, turn unsecured objects into projectiles, and cause power outages. To prepare, charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all app

notification_title: Fleet Week 2016 - Various Demonstrations - Hudson, Citi Field, Intrepid Pier (MN/QN)
email_body: Notification issued 5/29/16 at 3:00 PM. In conjunction with Fleet Week 2016, various military flyover activities will take place tomorrow, May 30th.     At 12:00 PM, The U.S. Navy will conduct a flyover involving four FA - 18's east up the Hudson past the Intrepid, to support the Intrepid Memorial Day Ceremony.    At approximately 12:55 PM, U.S. Navy Leap Frogs will conduct a parachute jump into Citi Field in Queens, prior to the NY Mets Game.     At approximately 1:00 PM, the U.S. Navy will conduct a flyover involving four FA - 18's prior to the NY Mets Game at Citi Field.    At 1:30 PM, The U.S Coast Guard will conduct a search & rescue demonstration over the water in the vicinity of Pier 86 - The Intrepid Air & Space Museum in Manhattan. Weather permitting, the demonstration will consist of one swimmer exiting a U.S. Coast Guard helicopter to perform a rescue demonstration.     For more info, please visit www.fleetweeknewyork.com. Notification issued 5/27/16 at 3:05 PM. On Saturday, May 28, the Breitling Jet Team will conduct a photo mission beginning at 5:00 PM over various parts of NYC. The aircraft will travel westbound from Long Island over the water near the south shores of Queens and Brooklyn before turning and navigating north over the Verrazano Bridge, continuing up the east side of the Hudson River to the Tappan Zee Bridge. From there, the aircraft will turn around and travel southbound over the west side of the Hudson River to the Verrazano Bridge, before traveling northbound up the east side of the Hudson River to finish their route. During this operation, the aircraft will fly at an altitude of approximately 1,500 - 2,000 feet. The rain date for the event is scheduled for Sunday, May 29, at 5:00 PM. A photo of the aircraft is available at http://bit.ly/25jxIRO.

notification_title: Planned Road Closure & Diversion - Houston Street Overpass at FDR Drive (MN)
email_body: Notification issued 5/20/16 at 12:00 PM. Due to the New York City Department of Transportation's rehabilitation of the Houston Street Overpass at FDR Drive in Manhattan, there will be a diversion of all northbound FDR Drive traffic under Houston Street beginning tomorrow, May 21, at 12:01 AM and continuing through Monday, May 23, at 5:00 AM. Motorists traveling northbound on FDR Drive will be directed to proceed on the adjacent ramp.  Motorists will be unable to enter or exit the northbound FDR Drive at Exit 5 (Houston Street). The pedestrian ramps that provide access to East River Park near Houston Street will be closed. Consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time. http://imgur.com/a/SHIxa.

email_body: Notification issued 5/17/16 at 7:30 PM. Emergency personnel are on the scene of a three alarm fire located at East 118th Street and Park Avenue in Manhattan. Expect smoke, traffic delays, and a presence of emergency personnel and vehicles in the area. The NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene advises avoiding smoke exposure from structural fires by closing windows while indoors and reducing outdoor activity where smoke is present. People with heart or breathing conditions such as asthma may be more sensitive and should seek immediate medical attention if they experience a worsening of their condition, shortness of breath, or chest pains. Notification issued 5/16/16 at 1:12 PM. New York City is experiencing intermittent wind gusts in excess of 40 MPH. During periods of high winds, residents should use caution when walking or driving high profile vehicles. Winds at these speeds can cause flying debris, turn unsecured objects into projectiles, and cause power outages. To prepare, charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1. For the latest weather information, please visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

For more infomation, see the following link: https://inws.ncep.noaa.gov/a/a.php?i=2889537

notification_title: West Nile Virus Aerial Larviciding 5/12-5/14 (SI, BK, QN, BX)
email_body: Notification issued 5/12/16 at 4:30 PM. Weather permitting, the NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene will aerially apply larvicide to key mosquito breeding areas in non-residential areas (mainly marshes and other large wetlands) between 6 AM and 7 PM on Thursday 5/12, Friday 5/13, and Saturday 5/14, to reduce the number of mosquitoes and the risk of Zika and West Nile viruses. A helicopter will be used for this event. The spraying will be conducted in parts of the following ZIP codes in Staten Island, Brooklyn, Queens and The Bronx: 10464, 10465, 10475, 11229, 11234, 11239, 11103, 11105, 11370, 11377, 11378, 11379, 11385, 11416, 11418, 11421, 10303, 10305, 10306, 10308, 10309, 10311, 10312, and 10314. For more details, go to http://www1.nyc.gov/site/doh/health/health-topics/west-nile-virus-spray.page, http://i.imgur.com/IfY1UaU.png or call 3-1-1.

Notification issued 5/8/16 at 4:00 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Coastal Flood Statement for Southern Queens for tonight, 5/8, from 9:00 PM - 11:00 PM. The affected areas include the south shore bays of Nassau and Queens counties. Tidal departures of 0.5-1.5 feet above normal are expected.     During a coastal flood event, minor flooding of the most vulnerable shore roads and/or adjacent properties is possible due to the height of the storm tide, wave splash-over and/or effects of the full moon.    For more information, please visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

Notification issued 5/8/16 at 3:00 PM. The US Department of Homeland Security, in coordination with the MTA NYCT, will begin a study called Underground Transport Restoration on Monday, May 9. The airflow study will be conducted over a five-day window from May 9-13, 2016 in multiple subway stations in Midtown Manhattan and will consist of a single, 20-minute release period of a non-toxic, odorless gas beginning at 11:00 AM each day. During this release period, researchers will disperse low concentrations of harmless gas and particle tracers and then use these tracers to conduct sampling over a four-hour window after release.  Data from the study will help first responders to better understand how airborne contaminants can travel through the system and enable them to develop emergency responses based on the results. The processes and equipment used in this study pose no health risks to the public.  For more information, please visit: https://www.dhs.gov/publication/environmental-assessment-proposed-nyc-subway

notification_title: Three Alarm Fire - Voorhies Ave & Dooley St (BK)
email_body: Notification issued 5/2/16 at 2:04 AM. Emergency personnel are on the scene of a three alarm fire located at Voorhies Avenue and Dooley Street in Brooklyn. Expect smoke, traffic delays, and a presence of emergency personnel and vehicles in the area. The NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene advises avoiding smoke exposure from structural fires by closing windows while indoors and reducing outdoor activity where smoke is present. People with heart or breathing conditions such as asthma may be more sensitive and should seek immediate medical attention if they experience a worsening of their condition, shortness of breath, or chest pains. Notification issued 4/30/16 at 3:00 PM. Multiple street closures will be in effect citywide on Sunday, May 1, 2016 from 2:00 AM to 6:00 PM, in support of the 2015 TD Five Boro Bike Tour, including a full closure of the lower level of the Staten Island bound Verrazano-Narrows Bridge. The upper level of the Verrazano Bridge will remain open in both directions throughout the event.  In addition, traffic exiting the Hugh L. Carey Tunnel (Brooklyn-Battery Tunnel) will be diverted to Hamilton Avenue between 9:00 AM and 3:30 PM. The ramp to the FDR Drive from the Robert F. Kennedy Bridge will be closed between 7:45 AM and 12:00 PM, with all Manhattan bound traffic exiting at 125th Street. For more information, please visit http://www.nycbikemaps.com/maps/five-boro-bike-tour-map/.

Alert issued 4/22/16 at 9:25 PM. The New York State Department of Criminal Justice has issued a Missing Child Alert in regard to the disappearance of Shyia Andrews, a 11-year-old black female, from Queens, NY. She is described as being 5'3' tall and 108lbs with black hair and hazel eyes. She was last seen with her non-custodial mother, Saraleathia Mckenzie,leaving her residence on Jewel Avenue in Queens at 8:30 AM on April 22. Shyia was last seen wearing torn blue jeans, a black and gray jacket, and black Jordan sneakers. She also has waist length braids in her hair.  They may travel to New Jersey. A photo of the missing is available at http://on.ny.gov/1Sig4cr. If you see Shyia Andrews, please call 9-1-1.

Notification issued 4/21/16 at 11:25 AM. The National Weather Service has issued a Red Flag Warning for New York City and surrounding areas due to conditions favorable for rapid fire spread. The warning is in effect today, 4/21, to 6:00 PM.    A Red Flag Warning is issued when a combination of strong winds and dry conditions create a significantly elevated fire growth potential. Todays winds speeds will be 10-15 MPH with gusts up to 25 MPH and a relative humidity of mid to upper 20s. Exercise caution when using outdoor gas and charcoal grills. In addition, smokers should never carelessly discard cigarettes. Immediately report a brush fire to 9-1-1.    For the latest information please visit: http://www.weather.gov/nyc.

notification_title: Red Flag Warning - Increased Risk of Brush Fires 4/19/16 (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 4/19/16 at 9:40 AM. The National Weather Service has issued a Red Flag Warning for New York City and surrounding areas due to conditions favorable for rapid fire spread. The warning is in effect today, 4/19, from 12:00 PM to 8:00 PM.    A Red Flag Warning is issued when a combination of strong winds and dry conditions create a significantly elevated fire growth potential. Todays winds speeds will be 10-20 MPH with gusts up to 25 MPH and a relative humidity of mid to upper 20s. Exercise caution when using outdoor gas and charcoal grills. In addition, smokers should never carelessly discard cigarettes. Immediately report a brush fire to 9-1-1.    For the latest information please visit: http://www.weather.gov/nyc.

Notification issued 4/7/16 at 8:12 AM. The National Weather Service has issued a Wind Advisory for Brooklyn and Queens. The advisory is in effect today, 4/7, from 11:00 AM to 8:00 PM. The advisory has been issued for sustained winds of 30-40 MPH possible gusts of 50 MPH.     During periods of high winds, residents should use caution when walking or driving high profile vehicles. Winds at these speeds can cause flying debris, turn unsecured objects into projectiles, and cause power outages. To prepare, charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1.     For the latest weather information visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

email_body: Notification issued 3/30/16 at 3:09 AM. Emergency personnel continue to operate on scene of what is now a six alarm fire located at Dekalb Avenue and Knickerbocker Avenue in the Brooklyn. Expect smoke, traffic delays, road closures, and a presence of emergency personnel and vehicles in the area. The NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene advises avoiding smoke exposure from structural fires by closing windows while indoors and reducing outdoor activity where smoke is present. People with heart or breathing conditions such as asthma may be more sensitive and should seek immediate medical attention if they experience a worsening of their condition, shortness of breath, or chest pains.

Notification issued 3/29/16 at 10:24 PM. Emergency personnel are on the scene of a three alarm fire located at Dekalb Avenue and Knickerbocker Avenue in Brooklyn. Expect smoke, traffic delays, and a presence of emergency personnel and vehicles in the area. Notification issued 3/29/16 at 8:30 PM. Con Edison is responding to a power outage in the Baychester section of The Bronx, including parts of ZIP code 10469. To report a loss of electric service, contact Con Edison at 1-800-752-6633. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances, avoid downed and hanging power lines, and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you are having a life threatening medical emergency and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1. Report power outages to Con Edison at 1-800-752-6633 or, if you have a speech or hearing impairment, report outages to 1-800-642-2308. To view this message in American Sign Language (ASL) with audio and subtitles, please visit: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9FrinpULu74.

Notification issued 3/28/16 at 2:40 PM. Due to policy activity, expect traffic delays and the presence of emergency personnel in the area of Broadway and West 45th Street in Manhattan. Use alternate routes.

Notification issued 3/28/16 at 12:00 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Wind Advisory for NYC which is in effect from 5:00 PM 3/28 to 6:00 PM on Tuesday, 3/29. The advisory has been issued for sustained winds of 20-30 MPH with gusts up to 50 MPH possible. During periods of high winds, residents should use caution when walking or driving high profile vehicles. Winds at these speeds can cause flying debris, turn unsecured objects into projectiles, and cause power outages. To prepare, charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1. For the latest weather information visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

notification_title: Planned Closure - Hunter's Point Avenue Bridge (QN)
email_body: Notification issued 3/27/16 at 3:00 PM. As part of the emergency restoration from Superstorm Sandy damage, the NYC Department of Transportation will fully close the Hunter's Point Avenue Bridge over Newtown Creek on five consecutive days from Monday, March 28th, through Friday, April 1st. The closures will take place from 9:00 AM to 3:00 PM each day and affect vehicular, pedestrian, and bicycle traffic. Detour signs will be posted to assist motorists around the closure.    For detour information, please visit: http://i.imgur.com/L8Zhepb.jpg.
