notification_title: Travel Advisory & Alternate Side Parking Suspension (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 3/20/16 at 7:35 PM. New Yorkers are reminded that a travel advisory is in effect from Sunday evening through Monday morning, March 21, and Alternate Side Parking is suspended on Monday. According to forecasts, snow is expected to begin around 9:00 PM, Sunday, and will end by daybreak Monday, with the a chance of lingering snow showers through the morning commute. A total snow accumulation of two to four inches is anticipated. Nighttime temperatures Sunday are expected to be around freezing. New Yorkers are asked to exercise caution and be prepared for slippery roads. As nighttime temperatures drop to below freezing, untreated surfaces can cause slick conditions. Please allow for extra travel time during your commutes.    ASL: http://bit.ly/11wDLan    For more information, please visit www.weather.gov/nyc.
Notification issued 3/20/16 at 2:32 AM. Following an earlier suspension, the 2 and 3 train have resumed service and are temporarily bypassing 135th Street. Expect residual delays.

Notification issued 3/20/16 at 12:38 AM. Due to a customer injury, 3 train service is suspended between 148th Street and 96th Street in both directions in Manhattan. The 2 train is currently running on the 5 line. Consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time.

Notification issued 03/19/16 at 3:00 PM. Numerous rolling street closures will be in effect throughout Manhattan from 7:30 AM to 1:00 PM on Sunday, 03/20/16, in support of the 2016 New York Road Runners' NYC Half Marathon. Consider use of public transportation during this event. For more information, please visit http://www.nyrr.org/races-and-events/2016/united-airlines-nyc-half or see the route map at http://i.imgur.com/lAdEmQd.png.

notification_title: Mayor De Blasio Issues Travel Advisory (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 3/18/16 at 9:23 PM. Mayor De Blasio has issued a travel advisory for Sunday, March 20, 2016. According to forecasts, snow may develop during the day on Sunday, with the potential for two to four inches of accumulation through early Monday morning. Daytime temperatures Sunday are expected to be in the mid-30s and will drop to near freezing Sunday night. New Yorkers are asked to exercise caution and be prepared for slippery roads. As nighttime temperatures drop to below freezing, untreated surfaces can cause slick conditions. Please allow for extra travel time during your commutes.    ASL: http://bit.ly/11wC2C0    For more information, please visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

Notification issued 3/18/16 at 4:09 PM. New York City is experiencing intermittent wind gusts in excess of 40 MPH. During periods of high winds, residents should use caution when walking or driving high profile vehicles. Winds at these speeds can cause flying debris, turn unsecured objects into projectiles, and cause power outages. To prepare, charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1. For the latest weather information, please visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

Notification issued 3/14/16 at 9:00 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Coastal Flood Statement for Brooklyn and Staten Island which is in effect tonight from 1:00 AM to 3:00 AM, March 15th, 2016. The affected area includes the south shore back bays of Brooklyn and Staten Island. Tidal departures of 1 to 2 feet above normal are expected.    During a coastal flood event, minor flooding of the most vulnerable shore roads and/or adjacent properties is possible due to the height of the storm tide, wave splash-over, and/or effects of the full moon.    For the latest information please visit: www.weather.gov/nyc.

email_body: Alert issued 3/12/16 at 6:41 PM. The previously issued AMBER Alert for Ariel Revello has been canceled.

notification_title: AMBER Alert - Ariel Revello M/H/7 (Trumbull, CT)
email_body: AMBER Alert issued 3/12/16 at 12:25 PM.    The NY State Police has issued an AMBER Alert for the abduction of Ariel Revello, a 7-year-old Hispanic male from Connecticut. The child may be in imminent danger.    He is described as being 4' 8' tall and 75lbs with brown hair and brown eyes. He was last seen at approximately 4:40 AM on 3/12 wearing gray and blue pajamas, gray sweatshirt, olive green puffy jacket and blue croc shoes.     He was reportedly abducted in the area of Trumbull, CT, by the suspect, Rodolfo Revello, a 43-year-old bald Hispanic male with brown eyes. He is approximately 5'9' tall and 190lbs.    They may be operating a white Ford transit van with CT license plate number C040379. The suspect is believed to be heading to the New York City area, specifically The Bronx.    A photo of the child is available at http://i.imgur.com/XxcyjAL.jpg. If you see Ariel or Rodolfo, call the Trumbull Police Department at (866) NYS-AMBER or call 9-1-1.   For updates: http://amber.ny.gov.

notification_title: Missing Child Alert - Kelly Rivera-Pillco F/W/10 (CW)
email_body: Alert issued 3/7/16 at 10:58 PM. The New York State Department of Criminal Justice has issued a Missing Child Alert in regard to the disappearance of Kelly Rivera-Pillco, a 10-year-old white female, from Spring Valley, NY. She is described as being 5'2' tall and 118lbs with black hair and brown eyes. She was last seen at the corner of Bethune Boulevard and Ben Wild Road in Spring Valley, NY at approximately 8:15 AM on March 7, 2016. She was wearing a black jacket, a white long sleeve shirt, a blue overall type skirt and brown UGG boots with white trim. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/5CU5eAV.jpg?1. If you see Kelly Rivera-Pillco, please call the Spring Valley Village Police Department at (845) 356-7400, or call 9-1-1.

Notification issued 3/6/16 at 3:00 PM. Beginning tomorrow, Monday, March 7, 2016, the Manhattan-bound (north) tube of the Queens Midtown Tunnel will be closed during weeknights for approximately 18 months to accommodate Superstorm Sandy restoration work. One lane will remain open in each direction in the other tube during these periods. Closures will take place between 10:30 p.m. and 5:30 a.m., Monday through Thursday. On Fridays, the closures will take place from 11 p.m. to 8 a.m. Saturday. Traffic enforcement agents and signage will help direct motorists, who should allow extra time and may wish to use an alternate route if possible. Info: http://bit.ly/1XXYtXO.

notification_title: Three Alarm Fire - Blake Avenue & Fountain Avenue (BK)
email_body: Notification issued 3/6/16 at 1:38 AM. Emergency personnel are on the scene of a three alarm fire located at Blake Avenue and Fountain Avenue in Brooklyn. Expect smoke, traffic delays, and a presence of emergency personnel and vehicles in the area. The NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene advises avoiding smoke exposure from structural fires by closing windows while indoors and reducing outdoor activity where smoke is present. People with heart or breathing conditions such as asthma may be more sensitive and should seek immediate medical attention if they experience a worsening of their condition, shortness of breath, or chest pains.

notification_title: Planned Closure - Grand Street Bridge - March 5, 12 & 19 (BK/QN)
email_body: Notification issued 3/4/16 at 3:00 PM. The NYC Department of Transportation Division of Bridges will close the Grand Street Bridge over Newtown Creek during the day on three Saturdays for repairs. The bridge will be closed to vehicles in both directions between 7:00 a.m. and 3:00 p.m. on March 5, 12, and 19. Variable message signs will be installed to alert motorists. Metropolitan Avenue may be used as an alternative route. The bridge will remain open to pedestrians and cyclists, but cyclists may be required to dismount and follow the directions of the work crews. Variable message signs will be installed to alert motorists. For more information, please visit http://i.imgur.com/RGpdlnL.jpg.

From 10:00 PM on Friday, March 4, through 6:00 AM on Saturday, March 5, the New York City Department of Health and Mental Hygiene, in conjunction with multiple agencies, will conduct an Environmental Sampling Exercise beginning at NYC Public Health Laboratory at 455 First Avenue in Manhattan, then continuing at Grand Central Terminal, Manhattan. Environmental Sampling Teams will be in personal protective equipment, including full hazmat suits. Expect a heightened presence of emergency personnel in the area. No biological material is being released and there is no danger to the public. This is only a drill.

Notification issued 3/2/16 at 3:10 AM. The National Weather Service is forecasting intermittent wind gusts of 40-50 MPH for NYC between 6:00 - 9:00 AM. During periods of high winds, residents should use caution when walking or driving high profile vehicles. Winds at these speeds can cause flying debris, turn unsecured objects into projectiles, and cause power outages. To prepare, charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1. For the latest weather information, please visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

Notification issued 2/24/16 at 10:30 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Severe Thunderstorm Warning for NYC until 11:30 PM. Strong winds and heavy rain are expected.     Info: http://www.weather.gov/nyc.     During a severe thunderstorm, be prepared to potentially lose power. Charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by the outage, turn off all appliances, avoid downed and hanging power lines, and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1. Notification issued 2/24/16 at 7:50 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Severe Thunderstorm Watch for NYC until 2:00 AM on 2/25. Strong winds and heavy rain are possible.    A Severe Thunderstorm Watch means conditions are favorable for severe thunderstorms to occur in and close to the watch area. Persons within these areas should be on the lookout for threatening weather conditions and listen for later statements and possible warnings. Exercise caution when walking, driving, or biking.     Winds at these speeds can cause flying debris, turn unsecured objects into projectiles, and cause power outages. To prepare, charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. notification_title: Staten Island Ferry & Railway - Service Changes and Suspension (SI)
email_body: Notification issued 2/24/16 at 6:13 PM. Due to NYPD activity, Staten Island Ferry's St. George Terminal will be closed to passengers until further notice. All outbound service from St. George is suspended. Service out of Whitehall is operating on a normal schedule, but passengers will be exiting via the lower level in St. George.    Staten Island Railway service is suspended between St. George & Tompkinsville in both directions. Please consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time. www.mta.info.

Notification issued 2/24/16 at 3:30 PM.  The NYC Department of Transportation will be closing the Metropolitan Avenue Bridge over English Kills in the early morning on 5 days, February 25 - February 27, February 29, and March 1, 2016, to continue the rehabilitation of the bridge from damage due to Superstorm Sandy.     The full closure will take place Thursday and Friday from 12:01 AM to 5:00 AM, Saturday from 1:00 AM to 6:00 AM, and Monday and Tuesday from 12:01 AM to 5:00 AM. The closures impact vehicular, pedestrian and bicycle traffic including the Q54 Metropolitan Avenue bus. Detour signs will be posted to assist motorists around the closure and there will be Traffic Control Agents posted each night from 11:30 PM until 6:30 AM.     For more information please visit www.facebook.com/MetroSandyBridge or http://i.imgur.com/TpPtNFF.jpg.

Notification issued 2/24/16 at 10:00 AM. The U.S. Department of Homeland Securitys Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA), in coordination with state, local, tribal, and territorial emergency managers and state broadcasters associations, will conduct a test of the Emergency Alert System (EAS) in New York City today, February 24, at 2:20 pm.      The EAS test is made available to radio, broadcast and cable television systems is and scheduled to last approximately one minute. The test will verify the delivery and broadcast, and assess the readiness for distribution of a national-level test message. The message of the test will be similar to the regular monthly test message of EAS, normally heard and seen by the public: This is a national test of the Emergency Alert System. This is only a test.    More information on the Public Alert and Warning System and Wireless Emergency Alerts (WEA) is available at www.fema.gov/ipaws or www.ready.gov/alerts.

Notification issued 2/23/16 at 5:00 PM.  Tomorrow, February 24, a media production will include a simulated explosion with fireball effect on private property in the vicinity of North Henry Street between Greenpoint Avenue and Norman Avenue in Brooklyn. The stunt can occur up to six times during the hours of 6:00 PM to 10:00 PM. NYPD and FDNY will be on site.

Notification issued 2/23/16 at 4:10 PM. New York City is experiencing intermittent wind gusts in excess of 40 MPH. During periods of high winds, residents should use caution when walking or driving high profile vehicles. Winds at these speeds can cause flying debris, turn unsecured objects into projectiles, and cause power outages. To prepare, charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1. For the latest weather information, please visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

Notification issued 2/23/16 at 12:30 PM. The National Weather Service has issued the following Coastal Flood Statement for Manhattan, Brooklyn, Staten Island and Southern Queens. High tides tonight, 2/23, 8:00 PM - 11:00 PM. Tidal departures are expected to be 1.5 to 2 feet above normal.     During a Coastal Flood event, minor flooding of the most vulnerable shore roads and/or adjacent properties is possible due to the height of storm tide, wave splashover and/or effects of the full moon.       For more information, visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

notification_title: Three Alarm Fire - Andrews Avenue South and West Burnside Avenue (BX)
email_body: Notification issued 2/23/16 at 2:58 AM. Emergency personnel are on the scene of a three alarm fire located at Andrews Avenue South and West Burnside Avenue, in the Bronx. Expect smoke, traffic delays, and a presence of emergency personnel and vehicles in the area. The NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene advises avoiding smoke exposure from structural fires by closing windows while indoors and reducing outdoor activity where smoke is present. People with heart or breathing conditions such as asthma may be more sensitive and should seek immediate medical attention if they experience a worsening of their condition, shortness of breath, or chest pains.

Notification issued 2/22/16 at 3:00 PM. Weather permitting, NYC Parks and an independent contractor will conduct an aerial survey of the deer population over various parks in Staten Island today, 2/22/16, from 5:00 PM - midnight and tomorrow morning, 2/23/16, from 4:00 AM  8:00 AM. The areas will include the following zip codes: 10301, 10302, 10303, 10304, 10305, 10306, 10307, 10308, 10309, 10310, 10311, 10312, and 10314. The survey will consist of one (1) single-engine aircraft utilizing an infrared camera to measure the temperature difference between the deer and the surrounding environment. The aircraft will conduct the survey at an altitude of approximately 1,000 feet.

notification_title: Traffic Delays - FDR Drive near 96th Street (MN)
email_body: Notification issued on 2/22/16 at 2:00 AM. Due to downed light poles, expect extensive traffic delays in both directions on the FDR Drive near 96th Street in Manhattan. Consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time.

The activity, consisting of one low-flying single-engine aircraft, will now take place this evening until approximately 3:00 AM (2/22).

notification_title: Planned Full & Partial Overnight Closures of the Battery Park Underpass 2/22 - 4/1 (MN)
email_body: Notification issued 2/21/16 at 3:00 PM. To facilitate the installation of mineral-insulated cable, overnight full closures of the Battery Park Underpass in Manhattan will be in effect Mondays to Saturdays beginning February 22 through April 1, 2016. On Monday through Thursday nights, the South Tube (West Street to FDR Drive) will close at 10:00 p.m. and the North Tube (FDR Drive to West Street) will close at 1:00 a.m. the following morning.  Both tubes will reopen at 5:00 a.m. On Saturday mornings, either the North Tube or the South Tube will be closed from 1:00 a.m. to 8:00 a.m. Variable message signs are in place to alert motorists. For more information, please visit: http://i.imgur.com/uIdG5Wu.png.

Notification issued 2/14/16 at 8:00 PM. NYC Emergency Management has issued a Travel Advisory for Monday, February 15 and Tuesday, February 16.     The National Weather Service has issued a Winter Weather Advisory for the NYC area on 2/15 from 1:00PM to midnight. A total of 1-4' of snow, a trace of ice, and 1.25'-1.5' of rain are predicted through the event. Light snow is expected to begin Monday morning and is forecast to transition to freezing rain Monday evening. Freezing rain is then expected to change over around midnight to rain only, which will continue throughout the day on Tuesday, resulting in minor coastal flooding during high tide cycles. Sustained winds of 20-25mph and gusts up to 30-40mph are also possible Tuesday.     New Yorkers are advised to exercise caution when driving, walking, or biking, and allow for additional travel time as roads may be slippery and visibilities may be low.     NYC residents living in coastal areas expected to receive minor coastal flooding should take action to prote

Notification issued 2/12/16 at 6:40 PM. Winds are forecast to gust up to 45 mph in the New York City area beginning tomorrow, Saturday, February 13th and continuing through the evening of Sunday, February 14th. Department of Buildings advises property owners, crane operators & contractors to take precautionary measures in preparation for the high winds. All cranes must be secured.     In addition, the Department has required all crane operations to cease on Saturday. A limited resumption of crane activity may be allowed on Sunday, depending on wind speeds. Crane operators are required to closely monitor weather conditions beginning Friday afternoon.    The Department will be performing random spot-check inspections of construction sites around the City. If sites are not secured, the Department will take immediate enforcement action -- issuing violations and Stop Work Orders, where necessary.     Winds may reach higher speeds than forecast in certain areas of the City. Property owners must consider the safety

Notification issued 2/12/16 at 4:23 PM. Temperatures continue to drop to dangerously cold levels with life-threatening wind chills through the weekend. New Yorkers are urged to limit their time outdoors and report heat and hot water conditions to property managers & 3-1-1. Remember to keep your pets safe, and check in on vulnerable friends, relatives and neighbors, including the elderly and people with disabilities and access and functional needs.     For more information: http://on.nyc.gov/1TdyZoB

notification_title: NYC Emergency Management Cold Weather Alert (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 2/10/16 at 6:05 PM. New York City Emergency Management urges New Yorkers to prepare for extremely cold temperatures Thursday night, February 11 through Monday, February 15. High temperatures Thursday will be at or below freezing. Temperatures drop to the teens Thursday night, with wind chill values in the single digits. Daytime temperatures are forecast to stay below freezing Friday, and continue to drop Friday night into Saturday, with temperatures in the teens and wind chill values near zero. Saturday night temperatures drop to single digits, and wind chill values are expected to plummet to as low as 15 degrees below zero. Wind chill values are expected to remain below zero through Sunday morning, slightly increasing to single digits Sunday night through early Monday morning. Temperatures should begin to moderate Monday afternoon, with highs expected to be around freezing through Monday night.     New Yorkers are advised to check on their neighbors, friends, and relatives, especially the

Silver Alert issued 2/10/16 at 12:13 AM. A Silver Alert has been issued for Felix Rivera, a 79-year-old Hispanic male with schizophrenia and dementia, from the area of 6th Street and 8th Avenue in Brooklyn.    Description: 6'0' tall and 160lbs with a white beard; wearing black jeans, a white sweater, a black coat, a black baseball cap, and gray sneakers.    Last Seen: New York Methodist Hospital in Brooklyn at approximately 11:00 PM on 2/8.    Photo: http://i.imgur.com/yJv5AjA.png?1.    If you see Felix Rivera, please call 9-1-1.

Notification issued 2/9/16 at 8:15 PM. Mayor de Blasio has issued a travel advisory for Wednesday, February 10, and reminds New Yorkers to remain alert and aware of cold temperatures and slippery conditions.    The National Weather Service has issued a Winter Weather Advisory from 6:00 PM tonight through noon on Wednesday for an expected 2-4 inches of snow. Light snow is expected to begin this evening and will continue through tomorrow morning, with the heaviest snow falling overnight. With overnight temperatures at or below freezing, and daytime temperatures in the high 30s, the potential exists for slick road conditions and limited visibilities.    Please exercise caution when driving, walking, or biking, and allow for extra travel time during the morning and evening commutes.    For more information, please visit: http://on.nyc.gov/1PjNViB.

The Coastal Flood Advisory is in effect from 8PM to midnight tonight, with tides expected to be 1.5 feet to 2.5 feet above normal, and from 7AM to 12PM tomorrow, 2/10, for tides of 1-2 feet above normal.    During a Coastal Flood Advisory, minor flooding of the most vulnerable shore roads and/or properties is possible. Coastal residents should be alert for later statements and take action to protect property.    For more information, visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

notification_title: Mass Transit Disruption - NJ Transit & Amtrak Delays (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 2/8/16 at 8:25 PM. Due to a trespasser strike in Elizabeth, NJ, customers should expect extensive delays in both directions on Northeast Corridor service for both NJ Transit and Amtrak. Notification issued 2/8/16 at 7:10 PM. Correction - The previously reported Coastal Flood Warning for the southern shores of Queens is in effect until 11PM tonight, and from 7AM - 11 AM tomorrow, 2/9.    For more information, visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

Notification issued 2/8/16 at 6:00 PM. The National Weather Service has issued the following coastal flood products for high tides tonight, 2/8, and tomorrow morning, 2/9. Tidal departures are expected to be 2 to 2.5 feet above normal.     South Queens: Coastal Flood Warning in effect 2/8 from 7PM-11PM and 2/9 from 7AM-11PM for areas along southern shores.    Brooklyn: Coastal Flood Warning in effect until 11 PM tonight, and 2/9 from 7AM-11AM for areas along southern shores.    During a Coastal Flood Warning, widespread moderate flooding is expected, resulting in beach erosion and flooding of vulnerable shore roads and/or properties. Coastal residents in the warned area should be alert for rising water and take appropriate action to protect life and property.    Bronx: Coastal Flood Advisory in effect 2/9 from 9AM-1PM for areas along Long Island Sound.    Staten Island: Coastal Flood Advisory in effect until 11PM tonight, and 2/9 from 7AM-10AM for areas along Newark Bay, The Kills, & tidally affected portions

Notification issued 2/8/16 at 9:53 AM. The National Weather Service has issued a Coastal Flood Warning for The Bronx until 1pm this afternoon. The affected area includes the New York coasts of the western Long Island Sound. Coastal residents in the warned area should be alert for rising water and take appropriate action to protect life and property. For more information, visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

Notification issued at 2/7/16 at 11:26 PM. With prolonged light to moderate snow expected Monday through Wednesday, NYC Emergency Management asks New Yorkers to exercise caution and allow for extra travel time when commuting during this period. The National Weather Service has issued a Winter Weather Advisory from 3:00 AM through 6:00 PM Monday and is predicting accumulations of 2-4' of snow. Be prepared for limited visibility and dangerously slick road conditions, as below freezing temperatures can create black ice. For more information, including safety tips, please visit on.nyc.gov/1PvrVyV.

Notification issued at 2/5/16 at 6:30 PM. With temperatures expected to drop below freezing Friday evening, melted snow can turn to ice/black ice causing dangerously slick driving conditions. New Yorkers should exercise caution when traveling tonight, Friday, February 5 and tomorrow, Saturday, February 6. The National Weather Service forecasts nighttime temperatures Friday to be below freezing, with wind chill values between 20 and 30 degrees. Temperatures Saturday will increase to the low 40s. Allow for extra travel time and be prepared for slippery road conditions.      For more information and safety tips, please see the following press release: on.nyc.gov/1SybnMV

notification_title: NYC Emergency Management Issues Travel Advisory (CW)
email_body: Notification issued at 2/4/16 at 7:48 PM. The New York City Emergency Management Department today issued a travel advisory for Friday, February 5, 2016. The National Weather Service has issued a Winter Weather Advisory from 1:00 AM through 10:00 AM Friday. Rain is expected to begin around 7:00 PM Thursday and will change over to snow around 3:00 AM Friday. Snow will continue through the early morning commute and will taper off around 10:00 AM. A total snow accumulation of 2-4 inches is predicted, with the heaviest snow expected to fall between 3:00 AM and 9:00 AM Friday. Temperatures Thursday night are forecast to be at or below freezing. Daytime temperatures Friday will be in the low 40s, but nighttime temperatures will drop to the high 20s, creating the potential for slick road conditions. New Yorkers are asked to exercise caution and be prepared for limited visibility and slippery road conditions. Please allow for extra travel time during the morning and evening commutes.     For more information and safet

Notification issued 2/3/16 at 9:25 PM. New York City is experiencing intermittent wind gusts in excess of 40 MPH. During periods of high winds, residents should use caution when walking or driving high profile vehicles. Winds at these speeds can cause flying debris, turn unsecured objects into projectiles, and cause power outages. To prepare, charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1. For the latest weather information, please visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

notification_title: Three Alarm Fire - West 100th St & Broadway (MN)
email_body: Notification issued 2/2/16 at 11:18 AM. Emergency personnel are on the scene of a three alarm fire located near West 100th Street and Broadway in Manhattan. Expect smoke, traffic delays, and a presence of emergency personnel and vehicles in the area. The NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene advises avoiding smoke exposure from structural fires by closing windows while indoors and reducing outdoor activity where smoke is present. People with heart or breathing conditions such as asthma may be more sensitive and should seek immediate medical attention if they experience a worsening of their condition, shortness of breath, or chest pains.

She is described as being 5'6' and 120 lbs, with black hair and brown eyes. Ms. Devonish was last seen at approximately 9:12 AM on 2/1 wearing a dark blue jacket, a blue turtle neck sweater, an orange shirt, grey slacks, and grey sneakers. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/FSB0a9C.png?1. If you see Madeline Devonish, please call 9-1-1.

notification_title: Planned Full & Partial Overnight Closures of the Battery Park Underpass thru 2/13 (MN)
email_body: Notification issued 2/1/16 at 3:00 PM. To facilitate post-Sandy restoration, full and partial overnight closures of the Battery Park Underpass North and South Tubes in Manhattan, one direction at a time, will continue Mondays to Saturdays through February 13, 2016.. A single lane will be closed Mondays through Thursdays starting at 10:00 PM, followed by full tube closures from midnight to 5:00 AM the next morning. Full closures will also be in effect on Saturday mornings from 1:00 AM to 8:00 AM. The South Tube will be closed February 1-3 and February 8-12, and the North Tube will be closed February 3-6 and February 13. Variable message signs are in place to alert motorists. For more information, please visit: http://i.imgur.com/YWINlG2.jpg.

notification_title: SBS Recovery Notification for Superstorm Sandy (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 1/29/16 at 9:00 AM.  In order to continue recovery efforts for small businesses from Hurricane Sandy, the President signed into law the Recovery Improvements for Small Entities (RISE) After Disaster Act of 2015, which gives the SBA Administrator the authority to make disaster loans for a period of one year. The Small Business Association offers Economic Injury Disaster Loans to help meet working capital needs caused by the disaster.  Survivors may apply online using the Electronic Loan Application (ELA) via SBAs secure website at https://disasterloan.sba.gov/ela.  The filing deadline to return applications for physical property damage is December 1, 2016. The deadline to return economic injury applications is December 1, 2016.    Additional details on the locations of recovery centers and the loan application process can be obtained by calling the SBA Customer Service Center at 800-659-2955 (800-877-8339 for the deaf and hard-of-hearing) or by sending an email to disastercustomerservice@s

Notification issued 1/28/16 at 4:21 PM. New York City Emergency Management has confirmed with the United States Geological Survey that the previously reported 'earthquake activity' was a sonic boom from an aircraft near the town of Hammonton, New Jersey and was NOT an earthquake.

Notification issued 1/28/16 at 3:19 PM. New York City is aware of unconfirmed reports of an earthquake in the New York City / New Jersey area. The New York City Emergency Management has consulted the US Geological Survey and the Earth Observatory at Columbia University. Neither has identified any seismic activity at this time. New York City Emergency Management will continue to monitor the condition and issue updates as necessary.

Notification issued 1/27/16 at 3:00 PM. New Yorkers are reminded that Mayor de Blasio has issued a travel advisory through Friday night, January 29, 2016. As nighttime temperatures drop to near or below freezing tonight through Friday, melted snow can turn to black ice, causing dangerously slick driving conditions. The National Weather Service forecasts daytime temperatures today through Friday to range between low-30s to low-40s, but nighttime temperatures will fall to near or below freezing, creating the potential for icy road conditions. New Yorkers are encouraged to exercise caution when walking and driving as some ice may not be visible.      For more information and safety tips, please see the following press release: http://on.nyc.gov/1OL273G.

Silver Alert issued 1/27/16 at 3:05 AM. NYPD has issued a Silver Alert in regard to the disappearance of Leonid Tsipenyuk, a 79-year-old white male with Alzheimer's Disease, from the area of Emmons Avenue and Webers Court in Brooklyn. He is described as being 5'7' tall, medium build, weighs 175lbs with brown eyes and gray hair. Mr. Tsipenyuk was last seen in the area of Emmons Avenue and Ocean Avenue in Brooklyn at approximately 5:00 PM on 1/26, and was wearing dark blue slacks and a waist length brown jacket. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/fsP0Ser.jpg. If you see Mr. Tsipenyuk, please call 9-1-1.

Notification issued 1/26/16 at 4:00 PM. Due to police activity, expect the presence of emergency personnel and traffic delays near the United Nations Plaza in Manhattan. Consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time.

Notification issued 1/26/16 at 4:30 AM. Following an earlier suspension, system-wide MTA Long Island Rail Road service will resume for the morning rush.     Customers should allow for additional travel time and check for potential weather-related delays. For more information, please visit: www.mta.info.
Notification issued 1/25/16 9:22 PM. Due to heavy volume, expect extensive traffic delays in the area of LaGuardia Airport in Queens. Confirm status of flights and allow for additional travel time.
Notification issued 1/25/16 at 7:15 PM. Following a prior suspension, A Train service has resumed between Rockaway Boulevard and Mott Avenue-Far Rockaway in Queens. Expect residual delays.

Notification issued 1/25/16 at 7:00 PM. Mayor de Blasio today issued a travel advisory for tonight, January 25, through Friday night, January 29, 2016. As nighttime temperatures drop to near or below freezing tonight through Friday, melted snow can turn to black ice, causing dangerously slick driving conditions. The National Weather Service forecasts daytime temperatures Tuesday through Friday to range between mid-30s to mid-40s, but nighttime temperatures will fall to near or below freezing, creating the potential for icy road conditions. New Yorkers are encouraged to exercise caution when walking and driving as some ice may not be visible.      For more information and safety tips, please see the following press release: http://on.nyc.gov/1OL273G.

Notification issued 1/25/16 at 6:00 PM. Due to mechanical problems, A Train service is suspended in both directions between Rockaway Boulevard and Mott Avenue-Far Rockaway in Queens. As an alternative, customers are advised to use the Q22, Q52, or Q53 bus. Info: www.mta.info.

notification_title: Road Reopened - Grand Central Parkway at LIE (QN)
email_body: Notification issued 1/25/16 at 5:32 PM. Following a prior closure, all lanes of the Grand Central Parkway have reopened at the Long Island Expressway in Queens. Expect residual delays.
Notification issued 1/25/16 at 5:12 PM. Following a prior closure, all lanes of the West Shore Expressway have reopened at Arthur Kill Road in Staten Island. Expect residual delays.

notification_title: Road Closure - West Shore Expressway at Arthur Kill Road (SI)
email_body: Notification issued 1/25/16 at 4:15 PM. Due to a motor vehicle collision, all lanes of the southbound West Shore Expressway are closed at Arthur Kill Road in Staten Island. All vehicles are exiting at Arthur Kill Road. Use alternate routes if possible and allow additional travel time.

notification_title: Department Of Buildings: Precautions during Snow and Ice Melting (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 1/25/16 at 3:00 PM. In preparation for melting snow, the New York City Department of Buildings is reminding all builders, contractors, and property owners to secure their properties from hazardous conditions. Falling icicles and snow masses from buildings can be dangerous in a dense city such as New York, and can injure pedestrians, damage vehicles, and disrupt transportation if streets must be closed for safety reasons. If sites are not safely secured, the Department of Buildings will take enforcement action with the issuance of violations if necessary. Please call 311 to report non-compliant conditions or 911 to report emergencies at construction sites or buildings. Please see the attached document for additional instructions and information or visit: www.nyc.gov/buildings Document: http://i.imgur.com/WmBfSQq.jpg

notification_title: Road Closure - Grand Central Parkway at LIE (QN)
email_body: Notification issued 1/25/16 at 2:45 PM. Due to a vehicle fire, all lanes of the westbound Grand Central Parkway are closed at the Long Island Expressway in Queens. Consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time.
Notification issued 1/25/16 at 9:07 AM. Following an earlier suspension, the Rockaway Park Shuttle service in Queens has resumed with limited service. Expect residual delays.

Notification issued 1/25/16 at 5:39 AM. Due to the ongoing impact from this weekend's blizzard, the Long Island Rail Road train service remains suspended and is expected to resume at 7:00 AM. Consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time.

Notification issued 1/24/16 at 8:40 PM. The MTA has announced that following a prior suspension, Long Island Railroad service will be restored on the following lines by 5:00 AM on Monday, January 25:     -Port Washington  -Oyster Bay  -Port Jefferson  -Ronkonkoma  -Huntington  -Babylon  -Greenport     Partial service will be offered on the Montauk branch as far as Speonk. Service on the Hempstead, West Hempstead, Far Rockaway, and Long Beach branches remains suspended. Customers using these lines are advised to use nearby MTA bus and subway service as an alternative.     Also, there will be no service between Jamaica Station and Atlantic Terminal for the Monday morning rush. LIRR tickets will be cross-honored on subways to support commuters who usually travel to Atlantic Terminal.     For more information, please visit www.mta.info.
Notification issued 1/24/16 at 6:20 PM. Following an earlier suspension, the Seastreak Ferry will resume full service from all locations tomorrow, Monday, January 25, 2016. Expect residual delays.

notification_title: Winter Storm Update - Alternate Side Parking & Trash Removal (CW)
email_body: Notification issued at 1/24/16 at 5:40 PM. Mayor Bill de Blasio today announced that the suspension of Alternate Side Parking rules has been extended until Monday, February 1. In addition, cars currently parked adjacent to schools in 'No Standing - School Hours' zones are permitted to remain there until Wednesday, January 27.     Drivers are encouraged to keep their cars parked, avoid unnecesssary driving, and avoid shoveling snow into the street during storm clean-up.     Curbside collection of trash and recycling will be suspended on Monday, January 25 as Sanitation crew focus on snow removal.    For more information, please the following press release: on.nyc.gov/1Pw3FMi.

notification_title: Road Reopened - FDR Drive at 63rd Street (MN)

The New York City Department of Transportation, in conjunction with the Department of Sanitation, today announced that Alternate Side Parking Regulations will be suspended Monday, January 25 to Friday, January 29, 2016 to facilitate snow removal. notification_title: Three Alarm Fire - 9th Avenue & W 51st Street (MN)
email_body: Notification issued 1/24/16 at 9:20 AM. Emergency personnel are on the scene of a three alarm fire located at 9th Avenue and West 51st Street in Manhattan. Expect smoke, traffic delays, and a presence of emergency personnel and vehicles in the area. The NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene advises avoiding smoke exposure from structural fires by closing windows while indoors and reducing outdoor activity where smoke is present. People with heart or breathing conditions such as asthma may be more sensitive and should seek immediate medical attention if they experience a worsening of their condition, shortness of breath, or chest pains.

Notification issued 1/24/16 at 9:00 AM.  UPDATE:  The outdoor sections of the following MTA subway lines will remain suspended until further notice due to on-going snow clearing operations: A, Q, N, L, S (Franklin Ave Shuttle) and Staten Island Railway.  Additionally, bus customers should expect delays and service changes throughout the day. For the latest information on subway service and bus routes visit: http://www.mta.info.

Metro - North Railroad service will begin restoring service today, 1/24, at 12:00 PM.  Long Island Rail Road is still suspended and is expected to be restored Monday morning, 1/25. Expect residual delays and check MTA for updates: http://alert.mta.info/

Notification issued 1/23/16 at 7:19 AM. New York City is experiencing intermittent wind gusts in excess of 40 MPH. During periods of high winds, residents should use caution when walking or driving high profile vehicles. Winds at these speeds can cause flying debris, turn unsecured objects into projectiles, and cause power outages. To prepare, charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1.

notification_title: Coastal Flood Update (Bronx and Northern Queens)
email_body: Notification issued 1/22/16 at 6:35 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Coastal Flood Warning for The Bronx and Northern Queens on 1/23 from 10AM-2PM and from 9PM-1AM for coastal locations adjacent to Western and Central Long Island Sound.     Tidal departures of 2.5 to 3 feet above astronomical tides are expected Saturday morning and tidal departures of 3 to 3.5 feet above astronomical tides are expected Saturday night.     A Coastal Flood Warning indicates that flooding is expected or occurring. Beach erosion and localized flooding may occur. Coastal residents should be alert for rising waters and take action to protect property. For more information, please visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

Alert issued on 1/22/16 at 3:30 PM. Mayor De Blasio has declared a Winter Weather Emergency as of 8:00AM Saturday, January 23, 2016. New York City is expecting 12-18 inches of snow, with sustained winds of 25 to 30mph with gusts up to 50 MPH. These weather conditions will create dangerous travel conditions including slippery roads and limited visibilities. New Yorkers are strongly advised to stay off the roads except in the event of an emergency. If you must travel, use mass transit.

Notification issued 1/22/16 at 11:52 AM. The National Weather Service has issued the following Coastal Flood products for NYC areas:    Southern Queens, Brooklyn, & Staten Island: Coastal Flood Warning in effect from  6AM - 12PM on 1/23 and again from 5PM until midnight 1/23 for coastal locations adjacent to the south shore of New York City along New York Harbor. Tidal departures are forecast to be three to four feet above normal. Beach erosion and localized flooding may occur.    Bronx, Northern Queens: Coastal Flood Advisory is in effect from 10AM - 2PM on 1/23. Tidal departures are forecast to be one and a half to two feet Saturday morning and two and a half to three and a half feet Saturday night.Beach erosion and localized flooding may occur.      Manhattan: Coastal Flood Advisory in effect from 6Am - 10AM on 1/23. Tidal departures are forecast to be two to three feet Saturday morning and three to four feet Saturday evening.Localized flooding may occur.    A Coastal Flood Warning indicates that flooding

email_body: Notification issued 1/22/16 at 11:29 AM. NYPD has cancelled the Missing Child Alert for Tahir Williams from The Bronx.

Notification issued on 1/22/16 at 7:40 AM. New York City Emergency Management has issued a hazardous travel advisory for Saturday, January 23, 2016 through Sunday, January 24, 2016. The National Weather Service has issued a Blizzard Warning for all of New York City from Saturday morning through Sunday afternoon. The system is forecast to bring heavy snow along with strong and potentially damaging winds, and will create slick and hazardous travel conditions. Total snow accumulation is expected to be between 8 - 12'. Use caution when driving and allow for additional travel time, as roads will be dangerous due to the weather conditions. To view this message in American Sign Language (ASL) with audio and subtitles, please visit: http://bit.ly/1FnLLsz   For more information: http://on.nyc.gov/1OIDwdM

In addition to the timing and locations listed below, minor coastal flooding is also forecast during the Saturday morning high tide cycle.    Manhattan, Southern Queens, Brooklyn, & Staten Island: Coastal Flood Watch in effect from 6PM-11PM on 1/23 for coastal locations adjacent to the south shore of western and central Long Island and New York Harbor. Tidal departures are forecast to be three to four feet above normal. Beach erosion may occur.    Bronx, Northern Queens: Coastal Flood Watch in effect from 10PM on 1/23 to 1AM on 1/24 for coastal locations adjacent to the western and central Long Island Sound. Tidal departures are forecast to be three to four feet above normal.     During a Coastal Flood Watch, moderate coastal flooding is possible, including the potential for widespread flooding of vulnerable shore roads and/or basements. Coastal residents should be alert f

notification_title: Missing Child Alert - Tahir Williams M/B/17 (CW)
email_body: Alert issued 1/21/16 at 4:35 PM. The NYPD Missing Person Squad has issued a Missing Child Alert in regard to the disappearance of Tahir Williams, a 17-year-old black male, from The Bronx. He is described as being 6'0' tall and 180lbs with black hair and brown eyes. He was last seen at his residence on East 184th Street in The Bronx at approximately 8:00 AM on January 21, 2016, and was wearing a blue jacket, a black baseball cap, gray jeans, green sneakers, and a black hoodie sweatshirt. He may be in the local area and is suicidal. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/BxwgXJq.jpg. If you see Mr. Williams, please call the NYPD Missing Person Squad at (718) 220-5216, or call 9-1-1.

Notification issued 1/21/16 at 3:50 PM. For more information, please visit http://on.nyc.gov/1cAl5rj.    To view this message in American Sign Language (ASL) with audio and subtitles, please visit: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=G4YXMLzpUII.

notification_title: NYS Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert - Robert Lichtman (CW)
email_body: Alert issued 1/17/16 at 9:02 PM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert in regard to the disappearance of Robert Lichtman, a 78-year-old white male with dementia, from Mount Vernon, NY. He may be in need of medical attention.    Mr. Lichtman is described as being 6'0' tall and 240lbs with gray hair and brown eyes.     He was last seen in Mount Vernon at approximately 1:00 PM on 1/17 wearing black jeans, a tan sweater, and driving a 2014 tan Subaru Forester with New York (Military Airborne Plate) registration DRRML.    A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/uwe4vA8.jpg.     If you see Mr. Lichtman or the vehicle, please call the Mount Vernon City Police Department at (914) 665-2500 or call 9-1-1.
Notification issued 1/17/16 at 7:33 PM. Due to a motor vehicle collision, all lanes of the Bayonne Bridge are closed in both directions. Allow for additional travel time.

The New York City Department of Transportation Division of Bridges is replacing the concrete deck of the 149th Street Bridge over the Long Island Railroad beginning January 18, 2016. The bridge will be closed to all traffic, including vehicles, pedestrians, and cyclists, until further notice. The work is expected to be completed on or before June 30, 2016, but is weather dependent and may be extended if necessary. For more information, please visit http://i.imgur.com/RARCJDt.jpg. For detour information, please visit http://i.imgur.com/RvAozTJ.jpg.

Notification issued 1/12/16 at 4:15 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Wind Advisory for NYC which is in effect from 8:00 PM 1/12 to 1:00 PM on Wed, 1/13. The advisory has been issued for sustained winds of 10-20mph with gusts up to 50mph possible. During periods of high winds, residents should use caution when walking or driving high profile vehicles. Winds at these speeds can cause flying debris, turn unsecured objects into projectiles, and cause power outages. To prepare, charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1. For the latest weather information visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

Notification issued 1/12/16 at 6:52 AM. Emergency personnel are on the scene of a three alarm fire located at Grand Concourse and East 180th Street in the Bronx. Expect smoke, traffic delays, and a presence of emergency personnel and vehicles in the area. The NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene advises avoiding smoke exposure from structural fires by closing windows while indoors and reducing outdoor activity where smoke is present. People with heart or breathing conditions such as asthma may be more sensitive and should seek immediate medical attention if they experience a worsening of their condition, shortness of breath, or chest pains.

notification_title: Planned Full & Partial Overnight Closures of the Battery Park Underpass thru 1/23 (MN)
email_body: Notification issued 1/11/16 at 5:00 PM. To facilitate post-Sandy restoration, full and partial overnight closures of the Battery Park Underpass South Tube in Manhattan will occur Mondays to Saturdays through January 22, 2016 with the exception of January 18th (MLK Day). A single lane will be closed Mondays through Thursdays starting at 10:00 PM, followed by full tube closures from midnight to 5:00 AM the next morning. Full closures will also be in effect on Saturday mornings from 1:00 AM to 8:00 AM. The North Tube will be closed on January 23, only. Variable message signs are in place to alert motorists. For more information, please visit: http://i.imgur.com/xVhlpub.jpg.

Expect to see FDNY and NYPD personnel in action. To learn more about CERT, visit http://www.NYC.gov/CERT.

notification_title: Missing Senior Notification - Jesus Reinat M/H/68 (CW)
email_body: Missing Senior Notification issued 1/11/2016 at 2:05 PM. A Missing Senior Notification has been issued in regard to the disappearance of Jesus Reinat, a 68-year-old Hispanic male with dementia, from the area of Stanley Avenue and Pine Street in Staten Island. He is described as being 5'2' tall and 125lbs, with a thin build, medium complexion, brown eyes, and gray hair. He was last seen at approximately 6:00 AM on 11/8 at Richmond University Hospital and was wearing a blue coat, a white crown royal baseball cap, blue jeans, a red shirt, black Crocs shoes, and eyeglasses. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/Dk2FY00.png. If you see Mr. Reinat, please call 9-1-1.

notification_title: NYS Missing Vulnerable Adult - Earl Bryant M/B/80 (CW)
email_body: Alert issued 1/9/16 at 3:38 AM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert in regard to the disappearance of Earl Bryant, an 80-year-old black male with dementia from Uniondale, NY. Mr. Bryant is described as being 5'7' tall and 250lbs with gray hair and brown eyes. He was last seen at his residence on Lawrence Street in Uniondale at 5:30 PM on Friday, 1/8. He may be in need of medical attention. Mr. Bryant was last seen driving a 2004 green Lexus ZZZ with New York registration EJL-6195. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/f0s9GQw.jpg.  If you see Mr. Bryant, please call the Nassau County Police Department 3rd Precinct at (516) 573-7347, or call 9-1-1.

Mr. Zheng is described as being 5'6' tall and 150lbs with black hair and black eyes. He was last seen leaving the NYC Public Library in Manhattan at approximately 2:00 PM on Wednesday, 12/30, and was wearing long pants, a black jacket, and a white baseball hat with black Jeep lettering. If you see Mr. Zheng, please call the Nassau County Police Department Detective Bureau at (516) 573-7347, or call 9-1-1.

Notification issued 12/19/15 at 5:37 PM. New York City is forecast to experience intermittent wind gusts near or in excess of 40 MPH. During periods of high winds, residents should use caution when walking or driving high profile vehicles. Winds at these speeds can cause flying debris, turn unsecured objects into projectiles, and cause power outages. To prepare, charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1. For the latest weather information visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

notification_title: NYS Missing Vulnerable Adult - Samuel Schossig M/W/21 (CW)
email_body: Alert issued 12/17/15 at 6:35 AM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for Samuel Schossig a 21-year-old male from Seaford, NY. Mr.Schossig is described as being 5'11' tall and 180lbs, with brown hair and brown eyes. He is described as having intermitten explosive disorder and may be suicidal. He was last seen leaving Washington Avenue in Seaford at approximately 12:30 AM on Thursday, 12/17 wearing NY Rangers pajama pants, a black Carhatt jacket, and black sneakers. Mr. Schossig was driving a 2003 beige Lincoln LS with NY registration GWT- 2667. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/tbQrDMj.png. If you see Mr. Schossig, please call the Nassau County Police Department 7th Precinct at (516)573-7347 or call 9-1-1.

email_body: Notification issued 12/6/15 at 10:25 PM. The Rochester City Police Department has cancelled the Missing College Student Alert for the disappearance of Nicholas Kollias and Ani Okeke-Ewo.

notification_title: Missing College Student Alert - Nicholas Kollias & Ani Okeke-Ewo
email_body: Alert issued 12/6/15 at 6:35 PM.  The Rochester City Police Department has issued a Missing College Student Alert for the disappearance of Nicholas Kollias and Ani Okeke-Ewo, students of the University of Rochester (NY) who are missing under suspicious circumstances and may be in danger. They were last seen in the area of Wilson Boulevard in Rochester at 2:00 AM on Saturday December 5. They are believed to be traveling in a silver 2005 BMW X5 with Illinois registration V835470. There is a possibility that there may be another vehicle that may also be traveling with them; a red/orange Mazda 6 with New York registration HBC-1803.  They may still be local.  Nicholas Kollias is described as a white male, 6'0', 240 lbs with brown hair and eyes. Ani Okeke-Ewo is a Black male, 6'1', 215 lbs with black hair and brown eyes.  Photo are attached: http://i.imgur.com/Vtyt9Fd.jpg  If seen, call the Rochester City Police Department at (585) 275-3333 or 9-1-1.

The NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene advises avoiding smoke exposure from structural fires by closing windows while indoors and reducing outdoor activity where smoke is present. email_body: Amber Alert Update issued 12/1/15 at 5:00 PM. Please see the updated photo of the missing child, Rebecca Valenzuela, and the suspect, Diomedes Valenzuela: http://i.imgur.com/24CrkoS.png. If seen, call 9-1-1.

AMBER Alert issued 12/1/15 at 4:40 PM. The NYPD has issued an AMBER Alert for the abduction of Rebecca Valenzuela, a 3-year-old Hispanic female from The Bronx. She is described as being 2' 6' tall and 30lbs with black hair and brown eyes. She was last seen at approximately 1:00 PM when she was reportedly abducted in the area of Perry Avenue, BX, by the suspect, Diomedes Valenzuela, a 47-year-old Hispanic male with bald hair and brown eyes. He is approximately 6'1' tall and 270lbs. They may be operating a 2004 silver Dodge Caravan with NJ license plate number K24ECS. A photo of the suspect is available at http://i.imgur.com/4VOOKiD.jpg. If you see Rebecca or Diomedes, call the NYPD at (866) NYS-AMBER or call 9-1-1.  For updates: http://amber.ny.gov.

email_body: Alert issued 11/14/15 12:13 AM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for Robert Walker, an 87-year-old white male from the town of Westbury in Nassau County. Mr. Walker is described as being 5'7' tall and 150lbs, with white hair and green eyes. He has dementia and may be in need of medical attention. He was last seen on Church Street in Westbury at approximately 5:00 PM on 11/13 wearing a gray jacket, gray pants, black shoes and a blue and white Mount Lemon baseball cap. Mr. Walker was last seen driving a blue 1989 Buick Century with New York registration 5XV-772. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/hplCfOu.jpg. If you see Mr. Walker, please call the Nassau County Police Department 3rd Police Precinct at (516) 573-7347 or call 9-1-1.

Notification issued 11/13/15 at 10:30 PM. New York City is forecast to experience intermittent wind gusts in excess of 40 MPH. During periods of high winds, residents should use caution when walking or driving high profile vehicles. Winds at these speeds can cause flying debris, turn unsecured objects into projectiles, and cause power outages. To prepare, charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1. email_body: Notification issued 11/6/15 at 3:00 PM. notification_title: Walkway & Bike Pathway Closure - Brooklyn Promenade (BK)

email_body: Notification issued 11/2/15 at 3:00 PM.  The NYC Department of Transportation will be closing the Metropolitan Avenue Bridge over English Kills for five consecutive overnights, November 3 - November 7, 2015, to continue the rehabilitation of the bridge from damage due to Superstorm Sandy. The full closure will take place Tuesday - Friday from 12:01 AM to 5:00 AM, and Saturday from 1:00 AM to 6:00 AM. The closure impacts vehicular, pedestrian and bicycle traffic including the Q54 Metropolitan Avenue bus.  Detour signs will be posted to assist motorists around the closure and there will be Traffic Control Agents posted each night from 11:30 PM until 6:30 AM. For more information: www.facebook.com/MetroSandyBridge or http://imgur.com/imtCRel

Notification issued 10/31/15 at 12:00 PM. Numerous bridge and street closures will be in effect citywide from 7:00 AM to 7:00 PM on Sunday, 11/1/15, in support of the 2015 TCS New York City Marathon, including the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge. In addition, the upper level of the bridge will be closed in both directions beginning at 11:00 PM tonight for roadway preparation. For further information visit: http://www.tcsnycmarathon.org/race-day/course. Also see the attached map of the event route and full list of road closures. For help finding an alternate route, call 511 or visit http://www.511NY.org. For other marathon-related roadway closures throughout the city, call the NYC hotline at 311. Please see the following map of the marathon: http://www.tcsnycmarathon.org/sites/default/files/pictures/TCSNYCM15%20CourseMap%20v3.pdf

She was last seen Monday, October 26 at approximately 9:00 PM wearing burgundy sneakers, a blue long sleeve shirt, a blue pom pom hat, eye-glasses. Ms. Arroyo is described as being 5'7' tall and 180 lbs with brown and gray hair, and she walks with a cane. A photo of the missing is available at: http://imgur.com/hLCBHrA. If you see Ms. Arroyo, please call 9-1-1.

Silver Alert issued 10/28/15 at 12:33 AM. NYPD has issued a Silver Alert in regards to the disappearance of Nestor Rodriguez, an 86-year-old Hispanic male from the area of East Tremont Avenue and Washington Avenue in the Bronx. He was last seen at approximately 7:00 PM on 10/13, wearing blue jeans, a striped shirt, and black shoes. He is described as being 5'8' tall and 110lbs. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/m4A0Tmp.jpg?1. If you see Mr. Rodriguez, please call 9-1-1.

notification_title: NYS Missing Vulnerable Adult - Juan Grullon M/H/65 (CW)
email_body: Alert issued 10/23/15 3:05 PM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for Juan Grullon, a 65-year-old Hispanic male from The Bronx, NY. Mr. Grullon is described as being 5'5' tall and 178 lbs, with gray hair and brown eyes. He has dementia and diabetes and may be in need of medical attention. He was last seen near the subway station at West 225 Street and Broadway in The Bronx at approximately 9:30 AM on Thursday, October 22, wearing a blue jacket, brown t-shirt, black pants, black sneakers, and glasses. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/lfBRLhR.jpg. If you see Mr. Grullon, please call the NYCPD Missing Person Squad at (800) 577-8477 or call 9-1-1.

The NYPD has issued a Silver Alert for the disappearance of Eldica Simmons, an 86-year-old Black female with Alzheimer's disease and high blood pressure, from the area of Park Place and Rochester Avenue in Brooklyn. She was last seen Wednesday, October 21 at approximately 8:15 AM wearing a black hat, black coat and carrying a white purse. Ms. Simmons is described as being 5'3' tall and 110 lbs. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/ehHzx2G.jpg. If you see Ms. Simmons, please call 9-1-1.

Notification issued on 10/21/15 at 2:59 AM. The NYPD has issued a Silver Alert for the disappearance of Yiunam Tsang, a 96-year-old Asian male from the area of 86 Street & 18 Avenue, Brooklyn.  He was last seen Wednesday, October 21 at approximately 4:45 PM. Mr. Tsang is described  as being 5'2' tall and 120 lbs, partially bald with short gray hair, brown eyes, a thin build and a light complexion. He was last seen wearing a blue/green sweater, blue jeans and black/gray sneakers, carrying a beige tote bag. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/XOlzzUX.jpg. If you see Mr.Tsang, please call 9-1-1.

Notification issued 10/21/15 at 5:00 PM.  The NYC Department of Transportation will be closing the Metropolitan Avenue Bridge in Brooklyn for three consecutive overnights, October 22 - October 24, 2015, to continue rehabilitation from damage due to Superstorm Sandy. The full closures will take place Thursday - Friday from 12:01 AM to 5:00 AM, and Saturday from 1:00 AM to 6:00 AM. The closure impacts vehicular, pedestrian and bicycle traffic, including the Q 54 Metropolitan Avenue bus.  Detour signs will be posted to assist motorists around the closure and there will be Traffic Control Agents posted each night from 11:30 PM until 6:30 AM. For a map, please visit: http://i.imgur.com/Uq1jhSj.jpg.

Silver Alert issued 10/21/15 at 3:40 PM.  The NYPD has issued a Silver Alert for the disappearance of Bohdan Pestrak, an 85-year-old white male with Parkinson's disease from the area of 166th St & 17th Ave, Queens.  He was last seen Saturday, October 17 at approximately 3:00 PM and drives a gray 2005 Toyota Rav 4 with New York Registration# DLE6457. Mr. Pestrak is described as being 5'8' tall and 150 lbs with gray hair, green eyes, and a mustache. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/GvjFgo5.jpg. If you see Mr. Pestrak, please call 9-1-1.

Silver Alert issued 10/21/15 at 3:10 PM. NYPD has issued a Silver Alert in regard to the disappearance of Hector Alvarez, a 76-year-old Hispanic male from the area of Livonia Avenue and Mother Gaston Boulevard in Brooklyn. He is described as being 5'5' tall and 140lbs. Mr. Alvarez was last seen at 7:00 AM on Sunday, 10/18 wearing black pants, a green sweater with black lettering, and black Jordan sneakers. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/HGou3sB.png. If you see Mr. Alvarez, please call 9-1-1.

notification_title: Planned Closure - Northbound Entrance Ramp to Willis Avenue Bridge (MN)
Planned Full & Partial Overnight Closures of the Battery Park Underpass thru 10/31 (MN)
email_body: Notification issued 10/16/15 at 4:30 PM. To facilitate post-Sandy restoration, full and partial overnight closures of the Battery Park Underpass in Manhattan will occur Monday through Saturday, through October 31, 2015. A single lane will be closed Monday through Thursday starting at 10:00 PM, followed by full tube closures from midnight to 5:00 AM the next morning. Full closures will also be in effect on Saturday mornings from 1:00 AM to 8:00 AM. Both lanes in the south tube (West Street to the FDR Drive) will remain open during this period. Variable message signs are in place to alert motorists. For more information, please visit: http://i.imgur.com/7FbOLgF.png.
Notification issued 10/16/15 at 2:00 PM. Following a prior suspension, PATH service has resumed normal service in both directions. Expect residual delays.

New Jersey Transit is cross-honoring PATH riders. FOr updates, please visit http://http://www.panynj.gov/path/.

email_body: Alert issued 10/15/15 1:10 PM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for Thomas Depew, a 77-year-old White male from Middletown, NY. Mr. Depew is described as being 5'9' tall and 164lbs, with brown hair and blue eyes. He has Alzheimer's and Lyme disease and may be in need of medical attention. He was last seen on East Main Street in Middletown at approximately 9:30 AM on 10/15 wearing a tan jacket, a brown/blue plaid shirt, blue jeans, and white leather shoes. Mr. Depew was last seen driving a white 2013 Toyota Prius with New York registration ECG-9492. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/CVZm2Wz.jpg. If you see Mr. Depew, please call the Wallkill Town Police Department at (845) 692-6757 or call 9-1-1.

notification_title: Planned Closure - Marine Parkway-Gil Hodges Memorial Bridge (BK/QN)
email_body: Notification issued 10/13/15 at 6:00 PM. Due to planned work, the Brooklyn bound Marine Parkway-Gil Hodges Memorial Bridge will be closed nightly from 11:00 PM to 5:00 AM from Wednesday, October 14 through Saturday, October 17. All north-bound traffic will be detoured to the Cross Bay Veterans Memorial Bridge during these hours. Traffic heading into the Rockaways from Brooklyn (south) will be detoured onto the Breezy Point exit and back onto the 169th Street entrance ramp. The Q35 bus will not be affected and will continue to operate on its normal route. This work is weather dependent and may be canceled in the event of rain. For more details, please see http://www.mta.info/bandt.

The drill will take place at the Roosevelt Island Tramway Station located on Main Street, and will include the movement of emergency personnel and equipment. The activity is expected to take place between approximately 10:30 AM and 12:30 PM.  This is only a drill.

Notification issued 10/12/15 at 3:00 PM.  The NYC Department of Transportation will be closing  the Metropolitan Avenue Bridge over English Kills for five consecutive overnights, October 13 - October 17, 2015, to continue the rehabilitation of the bridge from damage due to Superstorm Sandy. The full closure will take place Tuesday - Friday from 12:01 AM to 5:00 AM, and Saturday from 1:00 AM to 6:00 AM. The closure impacts vehicular, pedestrian and bicycle traffic including the Q 54 Metropolitan Avenue bus.  Detour signs will be posted to assist motorists around the closure and there will be Traffic Control Agents posted each night from 11:30 PM until 6:30 AM. For more information: https://www.facebook.com/MetroSandyBridge or http://bit.ly/1L2yw1A.

Notification issued 10/9/15 at 11:00 AM. Con Edison is responding to a power outage in the Castle Hill section of The Bronx, including parts of ZIP code 10473. To report a loss of electric service, contact Con Edison at 1-800-752-6633. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances, avoid downed and hanging power lines, and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you are having a life threatening medical emergency and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1. Report power outages to Con Edison at 1-800-752-6633 or, if you have a speech or hearing impairment, report outages to 1-800-642-2308. To view this message in American Sign Language (ASL) with audio and subtitles, please visit: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9FrinpULu74.

Notification issued 10/3/15 at 2:13 PM. New York City is forecast to experience intermittent wind gusts in excess of 40 MPH. During periods of high winds, residents should use caution when walking or driving high profile vehicles. Winds at these speeds can cause flying debris, turn unsecured objects into projectiles, and cause power outages. To prepare, charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1. For the latest weather information visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

Notification issue 10/2/2015 at 2:50 PM. NYC Emergency Management continues to closely monitor Hurricane Joaquin and has put extensive plans in place to deal with the possible effects of the storm on New York City. The latest National Hurricane Center forecast track has Hurricane Joaquin passing well off the eastern coast of the United States through early next week. The current forecast shows no direct impact to New York City. As a result, NYC Emergency Management is adjusting its emergency plans regarding opening shelters and conducting possible evacuations to match the forecast. NYC Emergency Management will continue to have enhanced staffing in place to respond or preempt any potential impacts. Please continue to monitor Notify NYC and local media for the latest information on the storms track, and for the latest forecast, please visit the National Hurricane Center at www.nhc.noaa.gov and the National Weather Service at www.weather.gov/nyc.

Notification issued 9/30/15 at 2:52 PM. New York City Emergency Management is continuing to monitor Hurricane Joaquin. The City is holding multiple daily calls with the National Weather Service and the National Hurricane Center.  The City is actively engaged with partner agencies at all levels of government and the private sector in preparation should the storm arrive. The City encourages the public and visitors to stay informed by signing up for Notify NYC, the Citys official source for emergency information, and identify their hurricane evacuation zone by visiting http://gis.nyc.gov/oem/he/index.html or calling 311. NYC Emergency Management continues to monitor the hurricane and keep the public updated as it develops. To learn more about preparing for coastal storms, please visit the Ready New York Guide at http://www.ready.gov/hurricanes.

notification_title: NYC Emergency Management Issues Travel Advisory (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 9/29/15 at 6:15 PM. New York City Emergency Management has issued a travel advisory for Wednesday, 9/30. According to the National Weather Service, a weak frontal system is approaching the New York City area and is expected to bring moderate to heavy rain tonight through Wednesday night. The heaviest period of rain is expected overnight Tuesday through the early morning rush. A total of 1 to 2 inches of rain is expected with this event. Urban flooding is expected in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Flash flooding cannot be ruled out during the periods of heaviest rain.    If you must drive a vehicle, monitor weather and traffic reports for the latest road conditions, drive slowly, and do not drive over flooded roadways. Exercise caution when walking and avoid slippery surfaces, flood waters, and downed power lines.    For more information, please visit http://on.nyc.gov/1PMeOL1 or www.weather.gov/nyc.

Notification issued 9/28/15 at 10:45 PM. On Tuesday, September 29, at 1:00 PM, filming of a TV series will take place on Roosevelt Island in Manhattan. The activity will occur on Tram Plaza Road at the intersection of West Roadway (at the water's edge) and will consist of simulated emergency activity, including the presence of emergency personnel and the firing of prop guns.

notification_title: NYC Health Department Investigating Legionnaires' Disease (BX)
email_body: Notification issued 9/28/15 at 4:40 PM. The NYC Health Department is currently investigating a cluster of seven Legionnaires' disease cases in the Morris Park section of The Bronx. This cluster is unrelated to the previous outbreak in The Bronx this summer. Legionnaires' disease cannot be spread from person to person and has not affected New York City's drinking water supply. Groups at high risk for Legionnaires' disease include people who are middle-aged or older (especially cigarette smokers), people with chronic lung disease, and people with weakened immune systems. New Yorkers with respiratory symptoms, such as fever, cough, chills, and difficulty breathing, are advised to promptly seek medical attention. For more information regarding Legionnaires' disease and the NYC Health Department's response, please visit http://on.nyc.gov/1P2aHMF.

email_body: Notification issued 9/26/15 at 12:00 PM. The Stephen Siller Tunnel to Towers Run/Walk will take place this Sunday, September 27, from 9:30 AM to 2:00 PM. This event starts in Brooklyn at the IKEA parking lot in Red Hook (1 Beard St), proceeds through the Hugh L. Carey Tunnel (formerly Brooklyn-Battery Tunnel) to West Street, north on West St to Liberty St, west on Liberty St through Battery Park City, to end at West St and Vesey St (MN). One tube of the Hugh L. Carey Tunnel will close tonight at 10:00 PM.  The other tube will have one lane open in each direction until tomorrow, 9/27 at 7:45 AM, when both tubes will be fully closed until 3:00 PM for the event. Motorists are advised to use an alternate route and allow for additional travel time.  For more information, please visit http://i.imgur.com/9PDbzfE.jpg or www.mta.info.
