notification_title: Road Closure - Harlem River Drive at East 126th St (MN)
email_body: Notification issued 9/23/15 at 9:50 PM. Due to a motor vehicle collision, all southbound lanes of the Harlem River Drive are closed at East 126th Street in Manhattan. Two northbound lanes are also closed. Consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time.
Notification issued 9/23/15 at 8:13 PM. Following a prior service suspension, 4 Train service has resumed between Burnside Avenue and Woodlawn in The Bronx. Expect residual delays.

Notification issued 9/23/15 at 4:53 PM. Due to FDNY activity, 4 Train service is currently suspended in both directions between Burnside Avenue and Woodlawn in The Bronx. Consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time. Visit www.mta.info for updates.

Notification issued 9/23/15 at 3:05 PM. Due to emergency personnel in the area, expect extensive traffic delays on 30th Street between 6th Avenue & 7th Avenue in Manhattan in both directions. Consider alternate routes and please avoid the area if possible.

Notification issued 9/23/15 at 10:30 AM. Due to the ongoing United Nations General Assembly and the Papal Visit, expect significant traffic delays throughout Manhattan from September 24 - September 26. Anticipate traffic disruptions, various street closures, and an increased presence of emergency personnel. Use of public transportation is highly encouraged during this period. For more detailed information, please visit: http://on.nyc.gov/1JeMBa6 and http://bit.ly/1WfIbZO.

Silver Alert issued 9/22/15 at 11:44 AM. NYPD has issued a Silver Alert for the disappearance of Chamoun Hazim, a 53-year old white male from 66th Street & Cameron Court in Brooklyn. Mr. Hazim was last seen at approximately 4:00 PM on Monday, September 21 at his residence on 66th Street in Brooklyn. He can be described as 5'9' tall and 185 pounds, with a medium build and a mustache and goatee. Mr. Hazim was wearing beige shorts, a tan shirt, black sneakers, eye glasses, and a black bracelet at the time of his disappearance. A photo is available at http://i.imgur.com/rZCwgxd.jpg. If you see Mr. Hazim, please call 9-1-1.
Notification issued 9/22/15 at 5:30 AM. Following a prior disruption, A, B, C, and D Trains have resumed normal service. Expect residual delays.

Notification issued 9/21/15 at 5:20 PM. Due to rail conditions at 125th Steet and 72nd Street in Manhattan, expect various service changes and delays on the A, B, C, and D Lines in both directions, including a suspension of B Train service between Bedford Park Blvd in The Bronx and DeKalb Avenue in Brooklyn. For more information, please visit www.mta.info.

Notification issued 9/21/15 at 3:00 PM. Due to planned maintenance, the south tube of the Battery Park Underpass, from West Street to FDR Drive, will be closed during the early morning hours from Tuesday, September 22 through Saturday, September 26, except for Friday, September 25. In addition, the north tube of the Battery Park Underpass, from FDR Drive to West Street will be closed during the early morning hours from Tuesday, September 29 through Saturday, October 3. Closures will be from 12:01 AM - 5:00 AM Tuesday - Friday and 1:00 AM - 8:00 AM on Saturday. Consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time. For more information, please see the below link: http://i.imgur.com/TKHnZ0O.jpg.

notification_title: LIRR Restored - Penn Station & Jamaica Station (QN, MN)
email_body: Notification issued 9/21/15 at 2:00 AM.  Following a previous suspension, LIRR service has been restored in both directions between Penn Station and Jamaica Station. MTA continues to cross-honor LIRR fares on the E and 7 subway.  Expect residual delays.

notification_title: LIRR Suspension - Penn Station & Jamaica Station
email_body: Notification issued 9/21/15 at 12:35 AM. Due to FDNY activity, LIRR service is suspended in both directions between Penn Station and Jamaica Station. MTA Transit is cross - honoring LIRR fares at Jamaica and Woodside on the E and 7 subway. For more information, please visit www.mta.info.

Notification issued 9/20/15 at 12:00 PM. Weather permitting, the NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene will conduct ground-based spraying of mosquito adulticide to help prevent West Nile Virus between 8:30 PM Monday, 9/21, and 6:00 AM the following morning, 9/22.  Spraying will be conducted in parts of the following Brooklyn and Queens ZIP codes: 11101, 11103, 11104, 11105, 11201, 11205, 11231, 11238, 11370, 11377, 11378, 11379, 11385, 11416, 11418, and 11421. For details, go to http://www.nyc.gov/html/doh/html/environmental/wnv-home.shtml, http://i.imgur.com/QBZpNZD.png, or call 3-1-1.

Notification issued 9/20/15 at 5:15 PM. Due to a police investigation, 6 Train service is suspended in both directions between 3 Avenue - 138th Street to Pelham Bay Park in The Bronx. Consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time.

Notification issued 9/18/15 at 11:40 AM. The New York State Department of Environmental Conservation has issued an Air Quality Health Advisory for New York City today, September 18, until tonight at 10:00 PM. Active children and adults, and people with respiratory problems, such as asthma, should reduce prolonged or heavy exertion outdoors. For more information, visit the National Weather Service at http://www.1.usa.gov/16w10Sq or the Department of Environmental Conservation at http://www.dec.ny.gov/cfmx/extapps/aqi/aqi_forecast.cfm. To view this message in American Sign Language (ASL) with audio and subtitles, please visit: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_o24hmZJ3DY.

Notification issued 9/17/15 at 2:00 PM. Due to a rail condition, 7 train service is suspended between Times Square - 42nd Street, MN and Hunters Point Avenue, QN in both directions. Consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time.

AMBER Alert issued 9/17/15 at 11:25 AM. The NYPD has issued an AMBER Alert for Celine Hicks, a 10-year-old black female from Manhattan. She is described as being 5'4' tall and 120lbs with black hair and brown eyes. She was last seen in Manhattan at 12:56 PM on September 15. She  was last seen wearing a yellow school uniform shirt with Caste Middle School embroidered on the front. She is believed to be endangered and is in the custody of Carlos Hicks (M/B/42) AND Jacqueline Hendricks (F/B/40). They may be operating a 1993 white Chevrolet Lumina with New Mexico registration NGG506. The subjects may be in the Bronx or traveling to New Mexico.  For a photo of the missing, please visit: http://imgur.com/PTVFb0j. If you see Celine, call the NYPD Missing Person Squad at (800) 577-8477, or call 9-1-1.  For updates: http://amber.ny.gov
Notification issued 9/17/15 at 6:47 AM.  There are extensive delays on the eastbound lanes of the Verrazano Bridge with a temporary closure of the 92nd Street exit.  Use alternate routes if possible.

notification_title: NYS DCJS Missing Child Alert - Celine Hicks F/B/10 (CW)
email_body: Alert issued 9/17/15 at 2:38 AM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Child Alert for Celine Hicks, a 10-year-old black female from Manhattan. She is described as being 5'4' tall and 120lbs with black hair and brown eyes. She was last seen in Manhattan at 12:56 PM on September 15. She  was last seen wearing a yellow school uniform shirt with Caste Middle School embroidered on the front. She is believed to be endangered and is in the custody of Carlos Hicks (M/B/42) AND Jacqueline Hendricks (F/B/40). They may be operating a 1993 white Chevrolet Lumina with New Mexico registration NGG506. The subjects may be in the Bronx or travel out of state.  For a photo of the missing, please visit: http://imgur.com/PTVFb0j. If you see Celine, call the NYPD Missing Person Squad at (800) 577-8477, or call 9-1-1.

notification_title: LIRR Suspension - Westbound Service Huntington, Pt. Jefferson, Ronkonkoma Stations (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 9/16/14 at 4:55 PM. Due to a previous minor freight train derailment, Long Island Railroad is suspending westbound service on the Huntington, Port Jefferson, and Ronkonkoma Branches from 4-8pm today, September 16. Consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time. For updated information: http://www.mta.info/lirr.

Notification issued 9/16/15 at 7:34 AM. Con Edison is responding to a power outage in the Eltingville section of Staten Island, including parts of ZIP code 10308. To report a loss of electric service, contact Con Edison at 1-800-752-6633. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances, avoid downed and hanging power lines, and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you are having a life threatening medical emergency and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1. Report power outages to Con Edison at 1-800-752-6633 or, if you have a speech or hearing impairment, report outages to 1-800-642-2308. To view this message in American Sign Language (ASL) with audio and subtitles, please visit: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9FrinpULu74.

notification_title: LIRR Suspension - Westbound between Jamaica and Ronkonkona/Port Jefferson Stations (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 9/15/14 at 4:17 PM. Due to a minor freight train derailment, Long Island Railroad is suspending westbound service between Ronkonkoma and Jamaica stations, and between Port Jefferson/Huntington and Jamaica stations. Consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time. Info:http://www.mta.info/lirr.

notification_title: High-Rise Fire - 54th St and FDR Drive (MN)
email_body: Notification issued 9/15/15 at 2:30 PM. Emergency personnel are on the scene of a high-rise fire located at 54th Street and Franklin D. Roosevelt Drive in Manhattan. Expect smoke, traffic delays, and a presence of emergency personnel and vehicles in the area. The NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene advises avoiding smoke exposure from structural fires by closing windows while indoors and reducing outdoor activity where smoke is present. People with heart or breathing conditions such as asthma may be more sensitive and should seek immediate medical attention if they experience a worsening of their condition, shortness of breath, or chest pains.

Notification issued 9/15/15 at 12:00 PM. Weather permitting, the NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene will conduct ground-based spraying of mosquito adulticide to help prevent West Nile Virus between 8:30 PM on Wednesday, 9/16, and 6:00 AM the following morning, 9/17.  Spraying will be conducted in parts of the following Bronx ZIP codes: 10461, 10465, 10469, and 10475. For details, go to http://www.nyc.gov/html/doh/html/environmental/wnv-home.shtml, http://i.imgur.com/c8L58rz.png, or call 3-1-1.

Notification issued 9/15/15 at 7:34 AM.  Due to an overturned vehicle, all southbound lanes of the Outerbride Crossing are closed (SI).  Expect heavy delays.

Notification issued 9/14/15 at 5:30 PM. Two Navy F-18s will conduct a flyover along the Hudson River on Tuesday, September 15th. Beginning at approximately 12:30 PM, the aircraft will travel northbound at an altitude of approximately 2,000 feet past the Verrazano Bridge, the Statue of Liberty, the George Washington Bridge, and will continue to the Tappan Zee Bridge. The aircraft will then turn southbound and travel back down the Hudson River at an altitude of approximately 2,500 feet before exiting the area.

Silver Alert issued 9/14/15 at 5:50 AM. NYPD has issued a Silver Alert for the disappearance of Cesario Barroso, an 80-year old Hispanic male from Davidson Avenue in The Bronx. He is described as being 5'2' with a thin build, white hair and brown eyes. Mr. Barroso was last seen 9/13/15 at Davidson Avenue & Buchanan Place in The Bronx wearing a gray hat, a light blue jacket, a blue shirt, brown pants and black sneakers. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/X7DfFya.jpg. If you see Mr. Barroso, please call 9-1-1.

notification_title: Planned Closure of Lincoln Tunnel South Tube Overnight for Emergency Drill (MN)
email_body: Notification issued 9/12/15 at 4:00 PM. On Sunday, September 13, The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey will conduct an emergency response drill. The NY-bound south tube of the Lincoln Tunnel will be closed this Sunday morning, from 12:01 AM until 9 AM. There will be two lanes open in both directions using the center and north tubes of the tunnel. Motorists traveling to New York should use caution approaching the tunnel due to emergency vehicles on the New Jersey side of the south tube.

notification_title: Military Flyover at Arthur Ashe Stadium (QN)
email_body: Notification issued 9/12/15 at 3:00 PM. A military flyover above Arthur Ashe Stadium in Queens is scheduled to take place at 4:00 PM, September 13th. The flyover will involve four F-15's aircrafts. Following the flight the f-15's will turn northwest towards the Tappan Zee Bridge and land at Newark Airport.

Notification issued 9/11/15 at 12:00 PM. From September 24 through September 26, 2015, Pope Francis will be visiting New York City. The U.S. Department of Homeland Security has designated this event as a National Security Special Event which will require added security measures. New Yorkers can also anticipate traffic disruptions and various street closures. The use of public transportation is highly encouraged during this period. For more detailed information, please visit http://www1.nyc.gov/assets/em/downloads/pdf/press_releases/papal_visit_new_york_city.pdf.

Four  jumpers will exit a helicopter over the Hudson River and land on two barges that are located in the channel between pier 59 and 60, in the area of West 20th Street (MN).  Some of the jumpers may be wearing apparatus that release smoke.

notification_title: NYS Missing Vulnerable Alert - Rosa Gonzalez Rios - F/H/65
email_body: Alert issued 9/6/15 at 1:01 AM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert in regards to the disappearance of Rosa Gonzalez Rios, a 65-year-old female with dementia. She was last seen in LaGuardia Airport on 9/4 at approximately 6:00 PM, wearing a maroon long sleeve button down shirt and skirt, carrying a zebra colored duffle bag. She may be in the Harlem area of 125th Street (MN), possibly lost or confused and in need of medical attention. A photo of the missing is available at http://imgur.com/scJLibC. If you see Ms. Gonzalez Rios, please call 9-1-1.

Notification issued 9/5/15 at 8:45 PM. Con Edison is responding to a power outage in the South Ozone Park section of Queens, including parts of ZIP code 11417 and 11420 . To report a loss of electric service, contact Con Edison at 1-800-752-6633. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances, avoid downed and hanging power lines, and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you are having a life threatening medical emergency and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1. Report power outages to Con Edison at 1-800-752-6633 or, if you have a speech or hearing impairment, report outages to 1-800-642-2308. To view this message in American Sign Language (ASL) with audio and subtitles, please visit: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9FrinpULu74.

He is described as 5'10' tall and 150 pounds, with short gray hair. Mr. Sloan was last seen at his residence on Thursday, September 3 at approximately 7:00 AM wearing blue pajama pants and a blue and gray button down shirt. For more information, visit the National Weather Service at http://www.1.usa.gov/16w10Sq or the Department of Environmental Conservation at http://www.dec.ny.gov/cfmx/extapps/aqi/aqi_forecast.cfm. Notification issued 8/31/15 at 3:00 PM.  The NYC Department of Transportation will be closing  the Metropolitan Avenue Bridge over English Kills for five consecutive overnights, September 1 - September 5, 2015, to continue the rehabilitation of the bridge from damage due to Superstorm Sandy. The closure impacts vehicular, pedestrian and bicycle traffic including the Q 54 Metropolitan Avenue bus.  Detour signs will be posted to assist motorists around the closure and there will be Traffic Control Agents posted each night from 11:30 PM until 6:30 AM. For more information: https://www.facebook.com/MetroSandyBridge.

Notification issued 8/31/15 at 12:00 PM. The alternate time frame is between 8:30 PM on Wednesday, 9/2 and 6:00 AM the following morning, 9/3. Silver Alert issued 8/31/15 at 5:00 AM.  The NYPD has issued a Silver Alert in regards to the disappearance of Hector Feliciano, a 68 year-old Hispanic male from the South Ozone Park area of Queens.  He is described as being approximately 5'8' tall and weighing 180 lbs. with brown eyes and salt and pepper hair. Mr. Feliciano was last seen Saturday, August 29, at approximately 8:30 PM in the area of Lefferts Boulevard and 109th Avenue in Queens, wearing a blue polo shirt, blue jeans and brown shoes.  A photo is available at http://i.imgur.com/0wYOC0t.png. If you see Mr. Feliciano, please call 9-1-1 or call Crime Stoppers at 1-800-577-TIPS (8477).  The public can also submit their tips by logging onto the Crime Stoppers website at WWW.NYPDCRIMESTOPPERS.COM or by texting their tips to 274637 (CRIMES) then enter TIP577.

email_body: Alert issued 8/28/15 at 3:45 PM. email_body: Alert issued 8/26/15 at 6:12 PM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert in regards to the disappearance of Rita Goodwin, a 77-year-old white female with Alzheimer's, from New Hyde Park, NY. She is described as being 5'3' tall and 100lbs with grey hair, and blue eyes. She was last seen walking from Hull Avenue towards Aberdeen Road in New Hyde Park at approximately 10:00 AM today. Ms. Goodwin speaks with an Irish accent and was last seen wearing a white shirt, grey pants, and carrying a black purse. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/oge55ai.png. If you see Ms. Goodwin, please call 9-1-1.

notification_title: Four Aircraft Flyover of the Statue of Liberty and Freedom Tower 8/27 (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 8/26/15 at 12:00 PM. Tomorrow, August 27, 2015 at approximately 10:30AM there will be a flyover involving four military aircrafts near the Statue of Liberty and Freedom Tower in Lower Manhattan. The event will consist of a B-25, P-51, F-16, and F-22. The planes will converge in New York Harbor and maintain an altitude of 1500 - 2000 feet. The aircrafts will then travel northbound along the Hudson River and land in Newburgh, NY.  A photo of the aircrafts are available at http://i.imgur.com/X5EJ1Kt.jpg.

Alert issued 8/21/15 at 5:25 AM. The National Weather Service has issued a Flash Flood Warning for Brooklyn, Queens and The Bronx until 7:15 AM. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage areas and low lying spots. Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. Move to higher ground. For the latest information, visit: http://www.weather.gov/nyc. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1.

Alert issued 8/18/15 at 5:17 AM. The National Weather Service has issued a Flash Flood Warning for Manhattan, until 6:00 AM. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage areas and low lying spots. Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. Move to higher ground. For the latest information, visit: http://www.weather.gov/nyc. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1.

notification_title: NYS Missing Vulnerable Adult - Guido Potzinger M/W/88 (CW)
email_body: Alert issued 8/17/15 at 5:10 PM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert in regards to the disappearance of Guido Potzinger, an 88-year-old white male with dementia, from Dix Hills, NY. He is described as being 5'10' tall and 165lbs with gray hair,brown eyes, and a vertical scar on his throat. He was last seen at his home in Dix Hills at approximately 7:30 AM on 8/17, wearing beige shorts, a brown shirt, brown shoes, a dark blue baseball hat, glasses, and a Pan American lanyard. Mr. Potzinger was driving a 2013 gray Honda Civic with New York registration DLU3588. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/l4EgLnk.jpg. If you see Mr. Potzinger, please call 9-1-1.

The NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene advises avoiding smoke exposure from structural fires by closing windows while indoors and reducing outdoor activity where smoke is present. People with heart or breathing conditions such as asthma may be more sensitive and should seek immediate medical attention if they experience a worsening of their condition, shortness of breath, or chest pains.

Alert issued 8/6/15 at 8:00 PM. The NYC Health Commissioner has issued an order to all owners of buildings with cooling towers. If you own a building with a cooling tower please see the following link for information and steps you will need to take: http://on.nyc.gov/1Ec9Fp5.  The City issued this order because of an outbreak of Legionnaires' Disease in the South Bronx. Several cooling towers in the affected neighborhoods tested positive for Legionella. The outbreak has not affected the City's drinking or bathing water; it is safe for building residents to drink and bathe with tap water. It is also safe to use home air conditioning units and to be in air conditioned environments.

Silver Alert issued 8/6/15 at 12:45 AM. NYPD has issued a Silver Alert in regards to the disappearance of Rosa Murphy, a 73-year-old Hispanic female with dementia, from 108th Street and 1st Avenue in Manhattan. Ms. Murphy is described as being 5'3' and 120 lbs, with brown eyes, and red and gray hair. She was last seen on Wednesday, 8/5 at approximately 1:00 PM wearing a patterned dress, black blazer, black stockings, and either brown or black boots. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/fp06xpy.jpg. If you see Ms. Murphy, please call 9-1-1.

email_body: Notification issued 7/30/15 at 6:30 PM. Due to a flooding condition west of the Hicksville Station, Long Island Railroad service is suspended in both directions on the Ronkonkoma and Port Jefferson Branches. For more information, please visit www.mta.info.

Notification issued 7/30/15 at 2:58 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Severe Thunderstorm Warning for The Bronx and Queens until 3:30 PM. Strong winds and heavy rain is expected. For the latest information, please visit http://www.weather.gov/nyc. During a severe thunderstorm, be prepared to potentially lose power. Charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by the outage, turn off all appliances, avoid downed and hanging power lines, and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1.    To view this message in American Sign Language (ASL) with audio and subtitles, please visit: http://bit.ly/1t08zHb.

Alert issued 7/30/15 at 2:40 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Flash Flood Warning for Queens, Manhattan, and The Bronx until 4:30 PM. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage areas and low lying spots. Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. Move to higher ground. For the latest information, visit: http://www.weather.gov/nyc. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1.

Notification issued 7/29/15 at 3:25 PM. With the heat indices expected to remain in the mid to high 90s through Thursday, the National Weather Service has extended the previously issued citywide Heat Advisory until 8:00 PM on Thursday, 7/30. These conditions are dangerous to health, especially for people without air conditioning, older adults, and people with chronic health conditions. New Yorkers should use air conditioning to stay cool, go to a place that has air conditioning if it is not available at home, drink water at regular intervals, and limit strenuous activity. New York City has opened cooling centers through Thursday around the five boroughs. Please visit http://www.nyc.gov/oem or call 311 for more information on cooling center locations and hours.

Mr. Santos is described as being 5'5' tall and 130 pounds, with brown hair and brown eyes. He was last seen at his home on Morsemere Avenue in Yonkers at approximately 11:45 AM on 7/23, and was wearing a black t-shirt, khaki pants, blue sneakers, and a stainless steel chain with a black cross. He may be traveling by train to Grand Central Terminal or towards water at an unknown location. A missing poster is available at http://i.imgur.com/jvwTy47.jpg. notification_title: Three Alarm Fire - Midland Avenue & Patterson Avenue (SI)
email_body: Notification issued 7/22/15 at 1:38 AM. Emergency personnel are on the scene of a three alarm fire located at Midland Avenue and Patterson Avenue in Staten Island. Expect smoke, traffic delays, and a presence of emergency personnel and vehicles in the area. The NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene advises avoiding smoke exposure from structural fires by closing windows while indoors and reducing outdoor activity where smoke is present. People with heart or breathing conditions such as asthma may be more sensitive and should seek immediate medical attention if they experience a worsening of their condition, shortness of breath, or chest pains.

Notification issued 7/21/15 at 6:30 PM. Update: Repairwork on the Metropolitan Avenue Bridge will be extended to include Tuesday, 7/28, through Thursday, 7/30. During this time, a full closure of the bridge is scheduled to occur nightly from 12:01AM - 5AM the following morning. As previously reported, the Metropolitan Avenue Bridge will also be closed nightly this week, with work beginning tonight and lasting through Saturday, 7/25. These closures will occur from 12:01AM - 5AM on Tuesday-Friday, and from 1:00 AM - 6:00 AM on Saturday.     The bridge will be closed to all vehicular, pedestrian, and bicycle traffic during the reported closure periods and there will be posted variable message signs to assist travelers. For more information and detour route, please visit http://i.imgur.com/G7JRZzw.jpg.

Con Edison is asking customers to limit use of washers, dryers, air conditioners, and other energy-intensive equipment, and to turn off lights and televisions when not needed until the issue is resolved.     If you lose power, turn off all appliances, avoid downed and hanging power lines, and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you are having a life threatening medical emergency and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1. email_body: Alert issued 7/19/15 at 6:40 PM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for Josh Niewierowski, an 18-year old White male who has autism and is non-verbal, from Lynbrook, NY. Mr. Niewierowski is described as being 5'10' tall and 170 pounds, with brown hair and brown eyes. He was last seen at approximately 3:00 PM on 7/19 wearing a green t-shirt with a camp anchor patch on the left breast, beige cargo shorts, blue Nike sneakers, and a black hat with 'Maryland' written on it. He is reportedly traveling on foot. A missing poster is available at http://i.imgur.com/irg0p9N.jpg. If you see Mr. Niewierowski, please call the Lynbrook Village Police Department at (516) 573-7347 or 9-1-1.

email_body: Notification issued 7/19/15 at 3:00 PM. The NYC Department of Transportation Division of Bridges will replace switches on the Pelham Bridge over the Hutchinson River in The Bronx during the overnight hours on Monday 7/20 - Tuesday 7/21, and Wednesday, July 22 - Thursday, July 23. Motorists may use the Hutchinson River Parkway as an alternative. For more information, please visit http://i.imgur.com/m0vqzeS.jpg.

Notification issued 7/18/15 at 3:05 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Heat Advisory for New York City from 11:00 AM Sunday, July 19 to 6:00 PM Monday, July 20. Heat index values are expected between 95 and 100 due to anticipated temperatures in the lower 90s. These conditions are dangerous to health. Avoid strenuous activity. People without air conditioning, older adults, and people with chronic health conditions are most at risk. New York City will open cooling centers tomorrow, July 19. Please visit http://www.nyc.gov/oem or call 311 for more information on cooling center locations and hours.

Also, eastbound lanes of Mosholu Parkway between Henry Hudson Parkway & West Gun Hill Road (BX),  West 79th Street between Riverside Drive & Henry Hudson Parkway (MN), West 72nd Street between Riverside Drive and Central Park West (MN). Alert issued 7/15/15 at 12:54 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Flash Flood Warning for Brooklyn and Queens until 2:45 PM. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage areas and low lying spots. Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. Move to higher ground. For the latest information, visit: http://www.weather.gov/nyc. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1.

email_body: Notification issued 7/8/15 at 4:11 AM. Due to a motor vehicle collision, FDR Drive has all southbound lanes closed at Delancey Street in Manhattan. Consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time.

Notification issued 7/6/15 at 8:15 PM. Beginning today, July 6th, the NYC Department of Transportation is scheduled to begin a major resurfacing project along the FDR Drive. Priority repair work is scheduled to happen each week from Monday to Friday during the overnight hours (11PM - 6AM) and continue for several months. The repairs will be done on various sections of the highway and will involve one or more intermittent lane closures each night.     During this project, motorists should anticipate delays in the vicinity of the work zones. All work is weather dependent. For more information and weekly updates, please visit: http://on.nyc.gov/1NJNPOO.

Notification issued 7/6/15 at 3:00 PM. Tomorrow, July 7th, there will be a simulated explosion in the vicinity of Avenue B between East 6th Street and East 7th Street in Manhattan. The stunt will occur once between 6:00 PM and 11:00 PM. NYPD and FDNY will be on site.

notification_title: West Nile Virus Aerial Larviciding 7/7-7/9 (BX, QN, SI)
email_body: Notification issued 7/6/15 at 12:00 PM. Weather permitting, the NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene will conduct aerial spraying of mosquito larvicide to help prevent West Nile Virus between 6 AM and 7 PM on Tuesday 7/7, Wednesday 7/8, and Thursday 7/9. The spraying will be conducted in parts of the following ZIP codes in The Bronx, Queens, and Staten Island: 10303, 10306, 10308, 10309, 10311, 10314, 10464, 10475, 11354, 11356, 11357, 11691, and 11692. In case of inclement weather, the alternate application dates will be Wednesday 7/8, Thursday 7/9, and Friday 7/10. For more details, go to http://www.nyc.gov/html/doh/html/environmental/wnv-spray.shtml, http://i.imgur.com/mdnHorC.png or call 3-1-1.

He was last seen on Saturday, July 4th at 7:30pm near 233rd Street and 120th Avenue in Queens. A photo of the missing is available at LINK. If you see Mr. Bony, please call 9-1-1.

The NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene advises avoiding smoke exposure from structural fires by closing windows while indoors and reducing outdoor activity where smoke is present. People with heart or breathing conditions such as asthma may be more sensitive and should seek immediate medical attention if they experience a worsening of their condition, shortness of breath, or chest pains.

The aircrafts will depart LaGuardia at 11:30am and be over the Statue of Liberty at approximately 12:05 pm. See the attached photo of the aircraft: http://i.imgur.com/nJAwy5k.jpg.

Notification issued 7/3/15 at 12:00 PM. There will be a fireworks display on the East River tomorrow, Saturday, July 4th at 9:20 PM. The display will take place in two locations over the East River: One at the Brooklyn Bridge and the other between East 23th Street and East 37th Street in Midtown Manhattan.
Notification issued 7/3/15 at 12:00 PM. There will be a fireworks display over Coney Island Beach, north of the fishing pier in Brooklyn tomorrow, Friday, July 4th, at 9:45 PM.

notification_title: NYS Missing Vulnerable Adult - Katherine Laos F/W/24 (CW)
email_body: Alert issued 7/3/15 at 6:42 AM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for Katherine Laos, a 24-year old white female with mental health disabilities from Island Park, NY (Nassau County). Ms. Laos is described as being 4'5' and 155 pounds, with brown hair and brown eyes. Ms. Laos was last seen at the Long Island Railroad Train station taxi stand in Island Park, NY in Nassau County at 7:30 PM on Friday, July 2. She was seen leaving with an unknown Hispanic male. Ms. Laos was last seen wearing a pink one piece jumpsuit. A missing poster is available at: http://i.imgur.com/z0qi9xc.png. If you see Ms. Laos, please call 911 or the Nassau County Police Department at (516) 573-7347.

Silver Alert issued 7/2/15 at 9:20 PM. NYPD has issued a Silver Alert for the disappearance of Maria Edita, a 73-year old Hispanic female from Willoughby Avenue and Knickerbocker Avenue in Brooklyn. She is described as being 5'6' and 180 pounds, with brown eyes and salt and pepper hair. Ms. Edita has Alzheimer's, dementia, and requires insulin for diabetes. She was last seen on Wednesday, July 1 at 6:30 AM in the area of her residence on Willoughby Avenue in Brooklyn. Ms. Edita was wearing black pants and a light blue shirt at the time of her disappearance. She does not have a cell phone or Metro Card in her possession. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/lKZPJ3A.jpg. If you see Ms. Edita, please call 9-1-1.

Notification issued 7/2/15 at 12:30 PM. There will be a fireworks display off of Fort Hamilton, Brooklyn on Friday, July 3 at 9:45 PM. In case of inclement weather, the event will take place on Sunday, July 5 at 9:45 PM.

Notification issued 7/2/15 at 12:00 PM. There will be a fireworks display over Coney Island Beach between West 10th and West 12th Streets in Brooklyn every Friday, from tomorrow, July 3 to August 21. The displays will take place between 9:30 PM and 10:15 PM.

email_body: Missing Child Alert issued 7/1/15 at 7:33 PM. The NYPD has issued a Missing Child Alert for the disappearance of Nathaniel Jabbour, a 7 month-old white, male child from The Bronx (NY). He is believed to be in danger and is described at 1'05', 20 lbs with brown hair and brown eyes. He is in the custody of his mother, Alexis Jabbour (5'8', 130lbs, 19 years old) who has made threats to harm him. They are believed to be in the area of Pine Bush, NY. A photo is attached. notification_title: Missing Vulnerable Adult - Ann Conte F/W/85 (CW)
email_body: Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert issued 7/1/15 at 8:50 AM.  The Glen Cove City Police Department has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for the disappearance of Ann Conte.  Ann Conte is an 85-year-old missing vulnerable adult with dementia and may be in need of medical attention. She was last seen at 11:45 p.m. on Tuesday, June 30 in College Point (QN) . Ann was driving a 2005 gray Toyota Camry with New York registration GLJ7789 with the spare tire in the right rear location. Ms.Conte is described as 5'6', 120 lbs., with hazel eyes and a reddish blonde wig. She was last seen wearing beige pants, beige shoes, yellow socks, a flowered shirt. Ann has her brown Yorkshire terrier with her.  A photo is attached.  If seen call (516) 573-7347 or 9-1-1. http://imgur.com/vcRpAFe

Notification issued 7/1/15 at 5:22 PM. New York City is currently experiencing intermittent wind gusts in excess of 40 MPH. During periods of high winds, residents should use caution when walking or driving high profile vehicles. Winds at these speeds can cause flying debris, turn unsecured objects into projectiles, and cause power outages. To prepare, charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1. For the latest weather information visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

Notification issued 7/1/15 at 4:43 AM. The National Weather Service has issued a Severe Thunderstorm Warning for all five boroughs of New York City until 5:00 AM. Strong winds and heavy rain is expected. For the latest information please visit: http://www.weather.gov/nyc. During a severe thunderstorm, be prepared to potentially lose power. Charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by the outage, turn off all appliances, avoid downed and hanging power lines, and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1.    To view this message in American Sign Language (ASL) with audio and subtitles, please visit: http://bit.ly/1t08zHb.

Alert issued 7/1/15 at 4:35 AM. The National Weather Service has issued a Flash Flood Warning Citywide until 6:15 AM. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage areas and low lying spots. Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. Move to higher ground. For the latest information, visit: http://www.weather.gov/nyc. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1.

notification_title: AMBER ALERT - F/W/3 - New York, NY
email_body: AMBER Alert issued 6/30/2015 at 2:40PM: The NYPD has activated the New York State AMBER Alert and is investigating a child abduction that occurred on 345 East 102nd Street in Manhattan at about 12:00 PM today. The child is described as a White female approximately 3 years old and is possibly related to the suspect. The SUSPECT, Patrick Giblin, is a White male, approximately 50 years old with short, brown hair and green eyes. He is approximately 6 feet tall and weighs about 230 pounds. The suspect was last seen wearing a green shirt and blue jeans and a camouflage cap.  The VEHICLE has been identified as a black SUV Dodge Durango with New York license plate number GDE4791.  The SUSPECT was last seen traveling East on the Brooklyn Bridge.  The suspect is believed to have down syndrome. The suspect is suicidal and suffers from P.T.S.D. Any information on this abduction is asked to call NYPD at (866)N Y S-AMBER or dial 911 to provide information on a report or sighting.

notification_title: NYS Vulnerable Adult Alert - Marshall Kaplan (M/W/81)
email_body: Alert issued 6/27/15 at 12:42 PM. NYPD has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for Marshall Kaplan, an 81-year old white male from Amsterdam Avenue in Manhattan. Mr. Kaplan has dementia and a severely hunched back. He is described as being 5'8' and 145 pounds, with gray hair and brown eyes. He was last seen at his residence on Amsterdam Avenue on Friday, June 26 at 12:00 PM. Mr. Kaplan is believed to be driving a 2012 green Toyota Prius with NY registration AHX-2237 and may be traveling to Cold Spring, NY (Putnam County). He may appear confused or disoriented and may be in need of medical attention. If you see Mr. Kaplan, please call NYPD at (800) 577-8477 or dial 9-1-1. A missing poster is available below.    The sender included the following attachment:   https://attachments.sendwordnow.com/Attachments.aspx?token=859b10d3-6eb4-4f10-b3c7-66f0c0cdb698

Silver Alert issued 6/21/15 at 9:08 PM. NYPD has issued a Silver Alert for the disappearance of Mangra Molita, a 87-year old Hispanic male from 186th Street and Jamaica Avenue in Queens. Mr. Molita is described as 5'5' tall and weighing 140 pounds, with salt and pepper hair and brown eyes. He was last seen on Wednesday, June 17 at his residence on 186th Street in Queens, wearing a light colored baseball cap, blue sneakers, a red and white button down shirt, and blue pants with a white stripe. Mr. Molita has high blood pressure and does not have a cell phone, metro card, or cash in his possession. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/w2UAvCv.png. If you see Mr. Molita, please call 9-1-1.

Notification issued 6/21/15 at 7:20 PM. New York City is currently experiencing intermittent wind gusts in excess of 40 MPH. During periods of high winds, residents should use caution when walking or driving high profile vehicles. Winds at these speeds can cause flying debris, turn unsecured objects into projectiles, and cause power outages. To prepare, charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1. For the latest weather information visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

notification_title: NYS Missing Vulnerable Adult - Ali Jaffrey M/I/25 (CW)
email_body: Alert issued 6/21/15 at 9:35 AM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for Ali Jaffrey, a 25-year old Indian male with autism, from Valley Stream, NY. Mr. Jaffrey is described as being 5'8' tall and 250 pounds, with black hair and black eyes. He was last seen at approximately 12:30 AM on 6/21 wearing a dark blue shirt with a white collar and gray sweatpants. He walks with a limp and his right foot turns inward. He may attempt to travel to Queens or JFK airport. A missing poster is available at http://i.imgur.com/blBfm5i.jpg. If you see Mr. Jaffrey, please call the Nassau County Police Department at (516) 573-7347 or 9-1-1.

He was last seen on Wednesday, 6/17 at approximately 2:00 PM in the area of Seaview Avenue and E 102nd Street in Brooklyn.  Mr. Smith has dementia and is described as being approximately 6'1' tall, weighing 160 lbs., with a medium build, brown eyes, and gray hair. He was last seen wearing multicolored sneakers, khaki pants and jacket, with a tan hat.  If seen, call 9-1-1.  Photo attached: http://i.imgur.com/9TQUtjb.png.

notification_title: Flyover - Wings and Wheels Expo - Hudson River
email_body: Notification issued 6/18/15 at 12:10 PM. As a part of a 'Wings and Wheels Expo' at Teterboro Airport in New Jersey, a number of flyovers will be taking place today, June 18 through Sunday, June 21. Today before 1:00 PM, a B-17 'Yankee Lady' aircraft will arrive at Teterboro Airport and will depart at approximately 3:00 PM. On Saturday, June 20 and Sunday, June 21, the B-17 'Yankee Lady' will be conducting hourly flights over the Hudson River between 9:00 AM and 5:00 PM. All of the mentioned flights will depart Teterboro to the Statue of Liberty, and then north to West Point (Orange County) before returning to Teterboro. A photo of the aircraft is available at: http://i.imgur.com/9MBnFxZ.jpg.

notification_title: Planned Closure of the Manhattan-Bound Brooklyn Bridge - 6/20 - 6/22
email_body: Notification issued 6/15/15 at 6:40 PM.  There will be detours for overnight, Manhattan-bound Brooklyn Bridge traffic Monday to Thursday (6/15-6/18), 11:00 PM - 6:00 AM. Starting Friday night, June 20th to Monday morning, June 22nd there will be a Full Weekend Closure to Manhattan-bound traffic on the Brooklyn Bridge. This closure will begin at 12:01 AM on Saturday (6/20) and continue through 6:00 AM on Monday morning (6/22), for 54 consecutive hours. During this time, Manhattan-bound traffic will be closed entirely. Among other operations, this full weekend closure will enable the contractor to set grid deck on the Manhattan-bound roadway of the Brooklyn Approach. All motorists should consider taking the Manhattan Bridge, Williamsburg Bridge, or the Brooklyn-Battery Tunnel (MTA-tolled facility). More info: http://bit.ly/1FPov5s.

email_body: Alert issued 6/13/15 at 11:26 AM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for Suze Davilmar, a 64-year old black female from Mount Vernon, NY (Westchester County). Ms. Davilmar is described as being 5'4' tall and 200 pounds, with black hair and brown eyes. Ms. Davilmar has severe dementia and may be in need of medical attention. She was last seen at approximately 3:00 PM on Friday, June 12 wearing a blue shirt, purple pants, blue shoes, and black glasses. The last time Ms. Davilmar went missing, she was located safely in the Village of Bronxville in Westchester County. A missing poster is available at http://i.imgur.com/V0SlubJ.jpg. If you see Ms. Davilmar, please call the Mount Vernon City Police Department at (914) 665-2500 or 9-1-1.

notification_title: AMBER ALERT CANCELLATION - Mia Olarte F/H/4  (CW)
email_body: The NYS Troopers have cancelled the AMBER Alert for the disappearance of Mia Olarte.

Amber Alert issued 6/9/15 at 5:00 AM. The NYS Troopers have issued an Amber Alert for Mia Olarte, a 4-year old Hispanic female with Down Syndrome from The Bronx, New York. She is described as 21 and 48 lbs, with brown hair and brown eyes. The child was last seen on 6/8/15 at 4:52 PM near Brown Place and East 136 Street in The Bronx wearing gray pants with polka dots and a pink shirt. The child is reportedly traveling by foot with Dora Estella Olarte, her non-custodial mother, a 49-year old Hispanic female, 5'4', 140 lbs with brown hair and brown eyes. Dora was last seen wearing jeans and a white short-sleeve shirt, and carrying a blue pocket book. The child may be in imminent danger and requires medication. If seen, please call (866) NYS - AMBER or 9-1-1. For updates, visit http://amber.ny.gov.

email_body: Alert issued 6/8/15 at 5:30 PM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for Claude Mondesir, a 75-year old Black male, from Woodmere, NY. Mr. Mondesir is described as being 5'10' tall and 180 pounds, with gray hair and brown eyes. Mr. Mondesir suffers from dementia and may be in need of medical attention. He was last seen at approximately 2:50 PM on 6/8 wearing beige pants, a striped beige shirt, blue baseball hat, white sneakers, and a gold chain. He speaks English and Creole, may be using public transportation, and may attempt to travel to a casino. A missing poster is available at http://i.imgur.com/AoJr1to.jpg. If you see Mr. Mondesir, please call the Nassau County Police Department at (516) 573-7347 or 9-1-1.

notification_title: Planned Closure of the Manhattan-Bound Brooklyn Bridge - 6/6 - 6/7
email_body: Notification issued 6/5/15 at 3:00 PM. A planned 33-hour closure of the Manhattan-bound Brooklyn Bridge is planned to take place from 12:01 AM on Saturday, June 6th, through 9:00 AM on Sunday, June 7th. Among other operations, this full weekend closure will enable asphalt placement on the Brooklyn Approach.    During this time, please consider taking the Manhattan Bridge, Williamsburg Bridge, or the Brooklyn-Battery Tunnel (MTA-tolled facility). For detour information, please visit: http://bit.ly/1Fqqf40.

Notification issued 6/5/15 at 1:00 PM. Due to construction work, the Queens bound (eastbound) Jackie Robinson Parkway will have planned closures both this weekend and next weekend from Jamaica/Pennsylvania Avenues in Brooklyn to Metropolitan Avenue/Queens Boulevard in Queens. The first of the planned closures will begin at 11:00 PM today, June 5, and continue until Monday, June 8 at 5:30 AM. The second of the planned closures will begin at 11:00 PM on Friday, June 12, and continue until Monday, June 15 at 5:30 AM. The Metropolitan Avenue entrance ramp leading to the eastbound Jackie Robinson Parkway will remain open during these closures. Consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time. Please see https://www.dot.ny.gov/portal/page/portal/news/press-releases/2015/2015-May-29 for details.
Notification issued 6/5/15 at 12:00 PM. There will be a fireworks display off Ellis Island tomorrow, June 6, at 10:15 PM.

notification_title: NYS Missing Vulnerable Adult - Eliu Rivera (CW)
email_body: Alert issued 6/5/15 at 10:55 AM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for the disappearance of Eliu Rivera, a 55-year old white male from Monroe, NY (Orange County). Mr. Rivera has dementia, kidney disease, and cancer. He is described as 6'0' tall and weighing 160 lbs. Mr. Rivera has black hair and brown eyes. He was least seen at 3:00 PM on Thursday, June 4 in the area of 1200 Route 208 in Monroe, NY. Mr. Rivera was last seen wearing a blue demin jacket, blue jeans, and red, black, and white addidas sneakers. He may have traveled to The Bronx and may be in need of medical attention. The missing poster is available at: http://www.criminaljustice.ny.gov/missing/#/missing-alert/345. If you see Mr. Rivera, please call the Blooming Grove Town Police Department at (845) 496-9161 or call 9-1-1.

Alert issued 5/31/15 at 5:33 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a citywide Flash Flood Warning until 8:30 PM. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage areas and low lying spots. Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. Move to higher ground. For the latest information, visit: http://www.weather.gov/nyc. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1.

Notification issued 5/31/15 at 5:10 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Severe Thunderstorm Warning for Staten Island until 6:00 PM. Strong winds and heavy rain is expected. For the latest information please visit: http://www.weather.gov/nyc. During a severe thunderstorm, be prepared to potentially lose power. Charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by the outage, turn off all appliances, avoid downed and hanging power lines, and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1.    To view this message in American Sign Language (ASL) with audio and subtitles, please visit: http://bit.ly/1t08zHb.

Notification issued 5/28/15 at 1:25 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Severe Thunderstorm Watch for all five boroughs of New York City until 7:00 PM. Intermittent wind gusts in excess of 40 MPH can be experienced throughout this time. During periods of high winds, residents should use caution when walking or driving high profile vehicles. Winds at these speeds can cause flying debris, turn unsecured objects into projectiles, and cause power outages. To prepare, charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1. For the latest weather information visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

If you are affected by the outage, turn off all appliances, avoid downed and hanging power lines, and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors.  If you are having a life threatening medical emergency and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1. Report power outages to Con Edison at 1-800-752-6633 or if you have a speech or hearing impairment, report outages to 1-800-642-2308.

NYPD has issued a Silver Alert in regards to the disappearance of Thomas Gallegos, a 90-year old white male with dementia, from the area of Abbey Court and Cyrus Avenue in Brooklyn. He is described as being 5'6' tall and 140lbs. He was last seen at approximately 12:00 AM on 5/24, wearing blue slacks, a blue and black hat, and a green and red jacket. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/xHHjpie.jpg. If you see Mr. Gallegos, please call 9-1-1.

NYPD has issued a Silver Alert in regards to the disappearance of Yvonne Ellington, a 73-year-old Black female with hypertension and diabetes, from the area of Aberdeen Street and Broadway in Brooklyn. She is described as being 4'11' tall and 110lbs with black hair. Ms. Ellington was last seen in Staten Island at approximately 9:10 PM, wearing a longsleeve white shirt with a blue t-shirt. She walks with a cane and may be driving a green Toyota Rav-4 with NY plate DJF2321. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/er6fnnT.jpg. If you see Ms. Ellington, please call 9-1-1.

notification_title: NYS DCJS Missing Child Alert - Angelo Ponce M/W/14 (CW)
email_body: Alert issued 5/24/15 at 4:45 PM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Child Alert for Angelo Ponce, a 14-year-old white male from Herricks, NY. He is described as being 5'8' tall and 140lbs with brown hair and brown eyes. He was last seen at his residence in the Town of Herricks at approximately 11:00 PM on Saturday, May 23rd. He is in need of medical attention and may be disoriented and suicidal. Angelo may appear very thin and is believed to be wearing white sneakers and gray sweatpants. He may have traveled to the New York City area. For a photo of the missing, please visit: http://i.imgur.com/S9lVYgI.jpg. If you see Angelo, call the Nassau County Police Department at (516) 573-7347, or call 9-1-1.

notification_title: Fleet Week 2015 - Various Demonstrations - Intrepid Pier, Citifield (MN/QN)
email_body: Notification issued 5/24/15 at 4:00 PM. In conjunction with Fleet Week 2015, various military flyover activities will take place tomorrow, May 25th.     From 11:15 AM - 12:30 PM, The U.S. Navy will conduct a flyover involving four FA - 18 Super Hornets above Pier 86 - The Intrepid Air & Space Museum in Manhattan. Aircraft photo: http://i.imgur.com/p3WBgtf.jpg.    The U.S. Navy will conduct a flyover involving an FA-18 Super Hornet above Citi Field in Queens between 12:30 PM - 1:05 PM. Aircraft photo: http://i.imgur.com/p3WBgtf.jpg.    The U.S Coast Guard will conduct a search & rescue demonstration over the water in the vicinity of Pier 86 - The Intrepid Air & Space Museum in Manhattan, from 1:30 PM - 2:00 PM. Weather permitting, the demonstration will consist of one (1) swimmer exiting a U.S. Coast Guard helicopter to perform a rescue demonstration. Aircraft photo: http://i.imgur.com/KoNm18u.jpg.    For more info, please visit www.fleetweeknewyork.com.

notification_title: NYS Missing Vulnerable Adult - Salvatore Iervolino M/W/78
email_body: Alert issued 5/21/15 at 6:55 PM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for Salvatore Iervolino, a 78-year old white male, from Hauppauge, NY. Mr. Iervolino is described as being 5'3' tall and 235 pounds, with gray hair and green eyes. Mr. Iervolino suffers from dementia, has numerous scars on his chest due to surgery, uses crutches to get around, and may be lost or confused and in need of medical attention. He was last seen at approximately 10:30 AM this morning wearing a light salmon-colored jacket, a blue shirt, black pants, black shoes, and a black cap. He was last seen driving a gray 2002 Nissan Maxima with New York registration 503521. A missing poster is available at http://i.imgur.com/SLzY9NF.jpg. If you see Mr. Iervolino, please call the Suffolk County Police Department at (631) 852-6000 or 9-1-1.

Notification issued 5/21/15 at 3:15 PM. The US Air Force Thunderbirds are scheduled to conduct a flyover photo mission tomorrow, Friday, 5/22, from 10:30 AM - 11:30 AM, over various areas around NYC. The event will consist of six F-16 aircraft in addition to the aircraft taking photographs. The F-16's will maintain an altitude of 1500 - 2000 feet. The aircraft will travel westbound from Long Island over the water near the south shores of Queens and Brooklyn before turning and navigating north over the Verrazano Bridge, and up the east side of the Hudson River to the Tappan Zee Bridge. From there, the aircraft will turn around and travel southbound over the west side of the Hudson River to the Verrazano Bridge, before traveling northbound up the east side of the Hudson River to finish their route. The rain date for the event is scheduled for Monday, 5/25 at 9:00 AM. A photo of the aircraft is available at http://i.imgur.com/malYQeZ.jpg.

notification_title: Planned Closure of the Manhattan-Bound Brooklyn Bridge from 5/16 - 5/17 (BK/MN)
email_body: Notification issued 5/15/15 at 3:00 PM. The overnight detours of Manhattan-bound traffic on the Brooklyn Bridge will be extended to include daytime hours this weekend, May 16th to May 17th. During this time, the Brooklyn Bridge will be closed to Manhattan-bound traffic from 12:01 AM on Saturday (5/16) through 9:00 AM on Sunday morning (33 consecutive hours). Among other operations, this full weekend closure will enable the contractor to prepare the Manhattan-bound roadway for upcoming asphalt placement on the Brooklyn Approach.    During this time, please consider taking the Manhattan Bridge, Williamsburg Bridge, or the Brooklyn-Battery Tunnel (MTA-tolled facility). See http://bit.ly/1ExzOO7 for more information.

notification_title: Road Closures - NYRR Air BnB Brooklyn Half Marathon - 5/16 (BK)
email_body: Notification issued 5/15/15 at 12:00 PM. Multiple intermittent street closures will be in effect throughout Brooklyn tomorrow, Saturday, May 16th, from approximately 12:00 AM to 3:00 PM, in support of the New York Road Runners' Brooklyn Half Marathon. Expect road closures and traffic along the route, which begins near Prospect Park, ends near Coney Island, and includes sections of Washington Avenue, Eastern Parkway, Empire Boulevard, Flatbush Avenue, Grand Army Plaza, Ocean Avenue, Parkside Avenue, Ocean Parkway, Surf Avenue, and Stillwell Avenue. notification_title: NYC Bound Amtrak Train Derailment North of Philadelphia (CW)
email_body: Notification issued on 5/14/15 at 12:20 AM. This evening Amtrak Northeast Regional Train 188 operating from Washington to New York derailed north of Philadelphia. There were approximately 238 passengers and 5 crew members on board. Several passengers have been injured and taken to local medical facilities for treatment. Local emergency responders are on scene and an investigation is ongoing. Northeast Corridor service between New York and Philadelphia is suspended. Persons with questions about their friends and family aboard this train have a special number to call for information: 800-523-9101.

The upper level of the Verrazano Bridge will remain open in both directions throughout the event.  In addition, traffic exiting the Hugh L. Carey Tunnel (Brooklyn-Battery Tunnel) will be diverted to Hamilton Avenue between 9:00 AM and 3:30 PM. The ramp to the FDR Drive from the Robert F. Kennedy Bridge will be closed between 7:45 AM and 12:00 PM, with all Manhattan bound traffic exiting at 125th Street. notification_title: US Small Business Administration Disaster Loan Outreach Center - East Village Building Collapse (MN)
email_body: Notification issued 5/1/15 at 1:00 PM. NYC residents and businesses affected by the 2nd Avenue Building Fire and Explosion in the East Village of Manhattan can now apply for low-interest disaster loans from the U.S. Small Business Administration. The Disaster Loan Outreach Center will be located at the Manhattan Community Board 3 District Office at 59 East 4th Street in Manhattan. The center will be open to the public on Tuesday, May 5 at 9:00 AM until Thursday May 14 at 6:00 PM. The Disaster Loan Outreach Center will be open weekdays from 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM and Saturday May 9, from 9:00 AM to 1:00 PM. The center will be closed on Sunday, May 10. For more information, please see the attached fact sheet or visit: http://www.nyc.gov/html/oem/html/relief_recovery/east_village_relief_recovery.shtml. Notification issued 4/22/15 at 3:42 PM. New York City is currently experiencing intermittent wind gusts in excess of 40 MPH. During periods of high winds, residents should use caution when walking or driving high profile vehicles. Winds at these speeds can cause flying debris, turn unsecured objects into projectiles, and cause power outages. To prepare, charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1. For the latest weather information visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

notification_title: Planned Moored Balloon - Broadway & West 61st Street (MN)
email_body: Notification issued on 4/22/15 at 3:15 PM. A moored (tethered) balloon will be launched in the area of Broadway and West 61st Street in Manhattan beginning tomorrow, 4/23, in order to conduct aerial survey data. The window for allowable operations lasts through April 22nd, 2016. In that time, two twelve hour days of surveying will take place, during daylight hours. The altitude of the balloon will not exceed the tallest building in the area. The balloon will be white and orange and the size of a typical weather balloon.

notification_title: Red Flag Warning - Increased Risk of Brush Fires - 4/18/15 (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 4/18/15 at 11:55 AM. The National Weather Service has issued a Red Flag Warning for New York City and surrounding areas from 12:00 PM to 8:00 PM today, 4/18/15. A Red Flag Warning means a combination of dry brush and gusty wind conditions support fire danger. Exercise extra caution when using outdoor gas and charcoal grills. In addition, smokers should never carelessly discard cigarettes. Immediately report a brush fire to 911. Please see attached press release:   http://www.nyc.gov/html/oem/html/pr/15_04_18_brush_fire_risk.shtml.

notification_title: NYS Missing Vulnerable Adult - Raymond Hubbs - M/W/84
email_body: Alert issued 4/9/15 at 11:37 PM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for Raymond J. Hubbs, an 84-year old white male from Centerport, NY (Suffolk County). Mr. Hubbs is described as 5'11' tall, weighing 160 pounds, with gray hair. Mr. Hubbs has early onset dementia. He was last seen in Centerport, New York at 12:00 PM today, 4/9. Mr. Hubbs was seen driving a 2012 gray Toyota Tacoma with New York registration FWV-1263. Hubbs was last seen wearing a blue khaki jacket and sneakers. There is no photo of Raymond available. A missing poster is available at http://i.imgur.com/gF2xJ1o.jpg. If you see Mr. Hubbs, please call the Suffolk County Police Department at (631) 854-8200 or 9-1-1.

NYPD has issued a Silver Alert in regards to the disappearance of Ana Garcia a 77-year-old Hispanic female, who suffers from high blood pressure, from the area of Beach 56th St. and Rockaway Beach Blvd. in Queens. She is described as 5'6' 160lbs with a medium complexion, black hair, and brown eyes. She was last seen at approximately 11:00 AM yesterday, 4/5, wearing a pink and white wool hat, brown suede jacket and light blue jeans and black shoes. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/CxvFLFj.jpg.  If you see Ms. Garcia, please call 9-1-1.

notification_title: Traffic Delays - Northbound FDR Drive at 31st Street (MN)
email_body: Notification issued 4/5/15 at 7:06 PM. Due to a motor vehicle collision, expect extensive traffic delays on the northbound FDR Drive at 31st Street in Manhattan. Consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time.

Silver Alert issued 4/5/15 at 3:40 PM.  NYPD has issued a Silver Alert in regards to the disappearance of Leo Parede, a 73-year-old male who suffers from Alzheimer's, from the area of West 105th Street and Amsterdam Avenue in Manhattan.  He was last seen at approximately 11:00 AM yesterday, 4/4, wearing jeans and a black jacket with yellow on the sleeves. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/JzTBOMC.jpg.  If you see Mr. Parede, please call 9-1-1.

Notification issued 4/5/15 at 7:50 AM. Due to NYPD Activity, expect extensive traffic delays in the area of Queens Boulevard and 71st Avenue in Queens. Consider alternate routes and allow additional travel time.

notification_title: NYS Vulnerable Adult - Gerard Abeles M/W/79 (CW)
email_body: Alert issued 4/5/15 at 12:50 AM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for Gerard Abeles, a 79-year-old white male from Scarsdale, NY who has early on-set dementia. Mr. Abeles was last seen on 4/4 at 2:00 PM driving near Griffen Avenue in Scarsdale in a dark green Toyota Camry with Massachusetts registration # 964-NV2. He is described as being 5'11' tall and 175 lbs. with gray hair and brown eyes. Mr. Abeles was wearing black pants, black shoes and a blue ski jacket. He is believed to be en route to the NYC area. A photo is available at: http://i.imgur.com/CZ2CRxu.jpg. If you see Mr. Abeles, please call the Scarsdale Village Police Department at (914) 722-1200 or call 9-1-1.

Notification issued 4/4/15 at 10:55 AM. New York City is currently experiencing intermittent wind gusts of up to 40-50 mph. During periods of high winds, residents should use caution when walking or driving high profile vehicles. Winds at these speeds can cause flying debris and can turn unsecured objects into projectiles. For the latest weather information visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

Notification issued 4/4/15 at 9:35AM. Con Edison is responding to a power outage in the Eltingville section of Staten Island affecting the following ZIP codes: 10312 & 10308. To report a loss of electric service, contact Con Edison at 1-800-75-CONED(26633) or online at http://www.coned.com.     To view this message in American Sign Language (ASL) with audio and subtitles, please visit: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9FrinpULu74.

Notification issued 4/4/15 at 4:45 AM. Following an earlier closure, all westbound and eastbound lanes of the BQE at Metropolitan Avenue have reopened. Expect residual delays.

Notification issued 4/4/15 at 4:25 AM. Due to a motor vehicle collision, all westbound lanes of the BQE and two lanes on the eastbound BQE at Metropolitan Avenenue are closed. Consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time.
Notification issued 4/4/15 at 3:50 AM. Following a prior closure, the Manhattan bound Battery Tunnel has been reopened. Expect residual delays throughout the area.

notification_title: Tunnel Closure - Battery Tunnel East Tube (BK/MN)
email_body: Notification issued 4/4/15 at 3:30 PM. Due to a motor vehicle collision, the Manhattan bound Battery Tunnel is closed. Consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time.
Notification issued 4/3/15 at 2:35 AM. Following an earlier closure, all lanes of the Staten Island Expressway at Goethals Bridge have re-opened to vehicular traffic. Expect residual delays.

Notification issued 4/2/14 at 11:25 PM. Due to a motor vehicle collision, all westbound lanes and one eastbound lane of the Staten Island Expressway are closed at the approach to the Goethals Bridge.  Please use alternate routes and expect delays.

Notification issued 4/2/14 at 10:43 PM.  There is a power outage in the North East section of The Bronx.  To report a loss of electric service, contact Con Edison at 1-800-75-CONED(26633) or online at http://www.coned.com.

Notification issued 4/2/15 at 12:00 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Wind Advisory for Brooklyn and Southern Queens from 2:00PM this afternoon through 8:00PM this evening. Sustained winds of 30MPH with gusts 35-40 MPH are expected. Other areas of New York City may experience gusty winds. During periods of high winds, residents should use caution when walking or driving high profile vehicles. Winds at these speeds can cause flying debris and can turn unsecured objects into projectiles. For the latest weather information visit http://www.weather.gov/okx/.

notification_title: Three Alarm Fire - East 78th St. & Paerdegat 1st St. (BK)
email_body: Notification issued 4/2/15 at 5:15 AM. Emergency personnel are on the scene of a three alarm fire located at East 78th St. & Paerdegat 1st St. in Brooklyn. Expect smoke, traffic delays, and a presence of emergency personnel and vehicles in the area. The NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene advises avoiding smoke exposure from structural fires by closing windows while indoors and reducing outdoor activity where smoke is present. People with heart or breathing conditions such as asthma may be more sensitive and should seek immediate medical attention if they experience a worsening of their condition, shortness of breath, or chest pains.
Notification issued 4/1/15 at 10:50 PM. Following a prior disruption, B & C Trains have resumed normal service in both directions. Expect residual delays.

Notification issued 4/1/15 at 9:10PM.  Due to a water main break, B Train service is suspended in both directions between 145th Street, MN, and Brighton Beach, BK.  Southbound C Trains are running express from 125th Street to 59th Street, MN. For updates, visit www.mta.info.

notification_title: Traffic Delays due to Water Main Break (MN)
email_body: Notification issued 4/1/15 at 9:00PM.  Due to a water main break, expect extensive traffic delays in the area of Central Park West and West 96th Street in Manhattan. Consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time.

Notification issued 4/1/15 at 1:14 PM. In response to the building collapse that occurred at 2nd Avenue and East 7th Street in Manhattan on Thursday, 3/26, the Reception Center for affected residents, currently located at 331 East 10th Street, Manhattan, will move to the Community Board 3 Office, located at 59 East 4th Street, Manhattan, after close of business at 8 PM on Thursday, 4/2. Hours of operation at the new location will be from 9 AM to 5 PM on Friday, 4/3, and 9 AM to 3 PM Saturday, 4/4. The center will be closed Sunday. Hours of operation will be from 12 PM to 9 PM on Monday, 4/6, and Tuesday, 4/7. For more information visit NYC.gov/EastVillageRecovery, or call 311.

notification_title: NYS Missing Vulnerable Adult - Frederick McGhee M/W/89 (CW)
email_body: Alert issued 4/1/15 at 12:40 PM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for Frederick McGhee, a 89-year old white male from St. James, NY (Suffolk County). Mr. McGhee is described as 5'9' tall, weighing 145 pounds, with white hair and blue eyes. Mr. McGhee has early onset dementia and may be in need of medical attention. He was last seen at his home on Bentley Court in St. James at 2:30 AM today, 4/1. Frederick was seen driving a 2003 gray Toyota Camry with New York registration AVH-8442. Mr. McGhee was last seen wearing a royal blue jacket and black hat. A missing poster is available at http://i.imgur.com/F7WJiVV.jpg. If you see Mr. McGhee, please call the Suffolk County Police Department at (631) 854-8400 or 9-1-1.

Notification issued 4/1/15 at 6:14 AM. Due to a jack-knifed tractor trailer, expect extensive traffic delays in both directions of the Cross Bronx Expressway at Weeks Avenue in The Bronx. Consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time.

Silver Alert issued 4/1/15 4:33 AM. The NYPD issued a Silver Alert for the disappearance of Huizhen Gu, an 81-year-old Asian female from Queens. She was last seen Tuesday, March 31 at approximately 5:30 pm leaving her residence and walking toward the entrance of Alley Pond Park. Huizhen Gu is described as 5'2', 100lbs with a thin build, light complexion, gray hair and brown eyes, last seen wearing a redding-pink down jacket, black slacks and white sneakers. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/78puzRJ.jpg. If seen, please call 9-1-1.

notification_title: NYS Missing Vulnerable Adult - Peter Ciulla M/W/88
email_body: Alert issued 4/1/15 at 3:30 PM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for Peter Ciulla, a 88-year-old white male who has early onset dementia. Mr. Ciulla was last seen in the area of Stewart Avenue on Tuesday, March 30. He is described as being 5'9' and 150 lbs. with gray hair and brown eyes. Mr. Ciulla was last seen wearing beige pants, a light colored jacket and a baseball cap and driving a 2005 white Buick Century with New York registration AHH-9576. He may be in need of medical attention. A photo is available at: http://i.imgur.com/MX5y5ko.jpg. If you see Mr. Ciulla, please call the Nassau County Police Department 1st Precinct, or call 9-1-1.

Notification issued 3/31/15 at 3:00 PM. As part of a Community Emergency Response Team (CERT) training class, a controlled fire and disaster drill will be conducted at Floyd Bennett Field in Brooklyn at 6:30 PM tomorrow, Wednesday, 4/1/15. Expect to see FDNY and NYPD personnel in action. To learn more about CERT, visit http://www.NYC.gov/CERT.

Notification issued 3/31/15 at 1:43 PM. Following the building collapse that occurred at 2nd Avenue and East 7th Street in Manhattan on 3/26, a website has been set up providing information regarding recovery, services, and other resources. Visit http://www.nyc.gov/eastvillagerecovery or call 311.

Notification issued 3/30/15 at 5:45 PM. On Tuesday, March 31st, a practice parachute jump will take place at the Aqueduct Racetrack in Queens. The actual jump date for the event will be April 4th, from 10:30 AM to 11:30AM.

Notification issued 3/29/15 at 5:32PM. Con Edison is responding to a power outage in the Flushing section of Queens affecting the following ZIP codes: 11365 & 11366. To report a loss of electric service, contact Con Edison at 1-800-75-CONED(26633) or online at http://www.coned.com.     To view this message in American Sign Language (ASL) with audio and subtitles, please visit: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9FrinpULu74.
Notification issued 3/28/15 at 8:19 PM. Following an earlier incident, 1 trains have resumed normal service with residual delays.
Notification issued 7:55 PM.  Due to FDNY activity, there is no 1 train service in both directions between 137th Street and 242nd Street (MN).  Use alternate routes if possible. http://www.mta.info
Notification issued 3/28/15 at 7:38 PM.  Due to FDNY activity, 1 trains are bypassing 168th Street in both directions causing delays.  Use the M3 bus as an alternate. http://www.mta.info/

notification_title: Port Authority Exercise - Holland Tunnel Eastbound Closure (MN / NJ)
email_body: Notification issued 3/28/15 at 3:00 PM. On Sunday, 3/29/15 The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey will conduct an emergency preparedness drill in the New York-bound Holland Tunnel. The New York-bound Holland Tunnel will be closed from 12:01 AM to 8:00 AM on Sunday. All New York-bound traffic will be diverted to the Lincoln Tunnel. Expect an increased presence of emergency personnel in the area. Consider alternate routes.

notification_title: Planned Closure - Brooklyn Bound Manhattan Bridge (MN/BK)
email_body: Notification issued 3/28/15 at 12:00 PM. On Sunday, March 29, the NYC Department of Transportation Division of Bridges will close eastbound lanes on the Manhattan Bridge to replace safety devices. The lane closures will be in effect early Sunday morning from 12:01 AM until 8:00 AM and again from 9:00 PM Sunday evening until 5:00 AM Monday morning. During these hours, the Brooklyn bound upper level will be fully closed and one lane will be closed on the Brooklyn bound lower level. The bicycle and pedestrian paths will remain open, though there may be occasional brief interruptions. Variable message signs will be installed to alert motorists.

Notification issued 3/28/15 at 11:45 AM.  As part of a Community Emergency Response Team (CERT) fire safety training class, a controlled fire and disaster drill will be conducted in the area of Cadman Plaza East and Red Cross Place in Brooklyn today, 3/28. The activity is scheduled to take place between 1PM and 4PM. Expect to see emergency personnel in action. To learn more about CERT, visit http://www.NYC.gov/CERT.

notification_title: Re-Opened - Road Closure - Eastbound Brooklyn Bridge (BK)
email_body: Notification issued 3/28/15 at 10:42 PM. Following an earlier closure, the southbound FDR Drive ramp to the Brooklyn Bridge, and the eastbound Brooklyn Bridge have re-opened to vehicular traffic. Expect residual delays.

Notification issued 3/28/15 at 9:54 AM. Due to FDNY activity at Jay Street and Tillary Street in Brooklyn, the southbound FDR Drive ramp to the Brooklyn Bridge is closed. In addition, the eastbound Brooklyn Bridge is closed. Consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time.
