notification_title: Update - Road Closures Due to Building Collapse - 2nd Avenue & East 7th Street (MN)
email_body: Notification issued 3/27/15 at 1:12 PM. This is an update to the previously issued notification. Due to ongoing emergency operations, East 5th Street to East 10th Street is closed between 1st Avenue and 3rd Avenue in the East Village of Manhattan. If you require access to the affected areas, please bring identification for proof of residence or ownership. Expect intermittent closures in the area. Consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time.

notification_title: Road Closures Due to Building Collapse - 2nd Avenue (MN)
email_body: Notification issued 3/27/15 at 10:00 AM. Due to the building collapse at 2nd Avenue and East 7th Street in the East Village of Manhattan, 2nd Avenue is closed to vehicular and pedestrian traffic from East Houston Street to East 14th Street. In addition, East 7th Street is closed from 2nd Avenue to 3rd Avenue. Consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time.

email_body: Notification issued 3/27/15 at 2:05 AM.  Emergency personnel are on the scene of a three alarm fire located at East 66th Street & 1st Avenue in Manhattan. Expect smoke, traffic delays, and a presence of emergency personnel and vehicles in the area. The NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene advises avoiding smoke exposure from structural fires by closing windows while indoors and reducing outdoor activity where smoke is present. People with heart or breathing conditions such as asthma may be more sensitive and should seek immediate medical attention if they experience a worsening of their condition, shortness of breath, or chest pains.

Silver Alert issued 3/27/15 at 2:52 AM.  NYPD has issued a Silver Alert in regards to the disappearance of Yefim Futoryan, an 84-year-old white male from the area of Brightwater Court and Brighton 4 Street in Brooklyn. He was last seen at approximately 10:00 AM on 3/26 wearing a black jacket, black sweat pants, grey sneakers and a brown hat.  Mr. Futoryan is described as 5'6' tall and weighs 165 pounds.  A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/o08iSix.jpg. If you see Mr. Futoryan, please call 9-1-1.

notification_title: Resident Service Center for 3/27 - 331 E. 10th Street (MN)
email_body: Notification issued 3/27/15 at 12:22 AM. In response to the prior building collapse at East 7th St and 2nd Ave, Manhattan on Thursday, 3/26, NYC will open a Resident Service Center at the Tompkins Square Branch Library at 331 E. 10th Street, Manhattan, at 8:00 AM on 3/27. If you are concerned about someone who may have been affected by the collapse and are unable to contact them, please call 311. From outside NYC, call (212) 639-9675.

notification_title: Unified Victim Identification System (UVIS) Activated, Red Cross Reception Center Opened (MN)
email_body: Notification issued on 3/26/15 at 6:00 PM. The New York City Unified Victim Identification System (UVIS) has been activated in response to a 7-Alarm Fire that occurred earlier today at 2nd Avenue and East 7th Street in Manhattan. If you are concerned about the welfare of someone who may have been affected by the collapse and are unable to contact them, please call 311. From outside of NYC, you may call (212) 639-9675. The American Red Cross has also opened a reception center at P.S. 63, located at 121 East 3rd Street in Manhattan.

notification_title: Fort Hamilton Event - Ceremonial Cannon Fire (BK/SI)
email_body: Notification issued 3/26/15 at 12:55 PM. A ceremony honoring the 'Changing of Command' will take place at Fort Hamilton, Brooklyn today, March 26, between 1:00 PM and 1:30 PM. The event will involve ceremonial cannon fire, nine times in the vicinity of the Verrazano Bridge. Traffic on the Verrazano Bridge will not be impacted.

Notification issued 3/26/15 at 12:05 PM. Due to a building condition, staff and students of Meyer Levin JHS, located at 5909 Beverley Road, Brooklyn, have been relocated to 18K563, located at 5800 Tilden Avenue in Brooklyn. Students will be dismissed from 18K563.

Notification issued 3/26/15 at 8:15AM.  Due to electrical work, expect extensive traffic delays in the vicinity of East 37th Street between 1st Avenue and Lexington Avenue in Manhattan. Consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time.

Kennedy Bridge's Harlem River lift span will be closed in both directions tonight, March 24th, at approximately 8:30PM.  The closure is expected to last 15-20 minutes.  Consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time.

Silver Alert issued 3/23/15 at 2:45 AM. The NYPD has issued a Silver Alert for the disappearance of Tsang Yiunam, a 95-year-old Asian man who suffers from Alzheimer's. Mr. Yiunam is described as 5'1', 120 lbs with gray hair and black eyes. He was last seen on 3/22 at approximately 2-3pm on 86th St between Bay Pkwy and 23 Ave (BK), wearing a brown winter jacket, brown hat, green shirt and blue jeans. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/u0OHdZU.jpg. If seen, please call 9-1-1.

notification_title: TV Series Filming w/Simulated Explosion - 3/23/15 - Brooklyn Navy Yard (BK)
email_body: Notification issued 3/22/15 at 12:00 PM. On Monday, March 23, the filming of a TV show will include a simulated explosion involving a vehicle on private property at the Brooklyn Navy Yard in the vicinity of 2nd Street between Eastway and Front Avenue in Brooklyn. The stunt will occur between 12:00 PM and 6:00 PM.  NYPD and FDNY will be on site.

Notification issued 3/22/15 at 11:50 AM. Con Edison is responding to a power outage affecing the following Brooklyn ZIP codes: 11235 and 11229. To report a loss of electric service, contact Con Edison at 1-800-75-CONED(26633) or online at http://www.coned.com.     If you are affected by the outage, turn off all appliances, avoid downed and hanging power lines, and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1.     To view this message in American Sign Language (ASL) with audio and subtitles, please visit: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9FrinpULu74.

Mr. Thein is described as 5'2', 110 lbs with gray hair, a birthmark under the right eye, and was last seen 3/12 approximately 11:00 AM in the area of Arlington Avenue & West 259th Street (BX).A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/JzaofPn.jpg. If seen, please call 9-1-1.

Silver Alert issued 3/21/15 at 2:54 PM.  NYPD has issued a Silver Alert in regards to the disappearance of Otis Green, a 75-year-old black male who suffers from dementia, from the area of 229th Street and 139th Avenue in Queens. He was last seen at approximately 8:45 AM on 3/20 wearing blue jeans, a black sweater with gray stripes, a navy blue Michael Kors jacket and black sneakers.  Mr. Green is described as 5'5' with a slim build.  A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/1ZOEx6P.jpg. If you see Mr. Green, please call 9-1-1.

Silver Alert issued 3/20/15 at 4:25 PM. NYPD has issued a Silver Alert for the disappearance of Horace Cleare, male, black, 61 years old who has Alzheimer's, from Bouck Avenue and Adee Avenue in The Bronx. Mr. Cleare is described as 5'11' tall, 185 pounds, bald with a black beard. He was last scene at Macy's Department Store on 34th and 7th Ave on Thursday, 3/19, wearing a black waist length jacket, black boots, blue jeans and a gray and black cap. He is also wearing a Safe Return necklace. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/XBNrr1v.jpg?1. If you see Mr. Cleare, please call 9-1-1.

Notification issued 3/20/15 at 3:35 PM. Due to the weather, Seastreak Ferry will have some service cancellations for this evening, Friday, March 20. For info, visit http://www.seastreak.com/servicealerts.aspx.

Notification issued 3/19/15 at 5:15 PM. The New York City Office of Emergency Management today issued a travel advisory for Friday, March 20. The National Weather Service has issued a Winter Weather Advisory from 6 AM Friday, March 20, through 2 AM Saturday, March 21. Snow will begin Friday morning and will continue throughout the day. The snow will begin to intensify in the afternoon with the heaviest snow expected to fall during the Friday evening rush. The snow will taper off late Friday evening. A total of 4 to 6 inches is expected. New Yorkers are asked to exercise caution and be prepared for limited visibility and slippery conditions when traveling.  For more information see attached press release: http://on.nyc.gov/19Dk4lg

People with heart or breathing conditions such as asthma may be more sensitive and should seek immediate medical attention if they experience a worsening of their condition, shortness of breath, or chest pains.

Notification issued 3/18/15 at 6:45 PM. New York City is currently experiencing intermittent wind gusts of up to 30-40 mph. During periods of high winds, residents should use caution when walking or driving high profile vehicles. Winds at these speeds can cause flying debris and can turn unsecured objects into projectiles. For the latest weather information visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

notification_title: Hugh L Carey Closure of One Lane (MN)
email_body: Notification issued 3/8/15 at 12:00 PM. Starting Monday, March 9, 2015 until 2018, one tube of the Hugh L. Carey Tunnel will be closed nightly Monday to Friday between 9:30 p.m. and 5:30 a.m. The weekend-long single tube closures will happen once a month and begin Friday night at 9:30 p.m. and continue through 5:30 a.m. Monday morning. This work is to repair and restore damage to the Hugh L. Carey Tunnel caused by Superstorm Sandy will begin and will require nightly closures of one tunnel tube through 2018.  In addition, one tube will also be closed for routine maintenance work Sunday night beginning at 11 p.m. through 5:30 a.m. Monday.    For more information, see http://bit.ly/1Emyv9X.

notification_title: Verrazano Bridge Closure of One Lane (SI)
email_body: Notification issued 3/6/15 at 3:00 PM. Beginning  Saturday, March 7 until summer 2017, there will be lane closures on the upper level of the Verrazano Bridge for replacement of the existing roadway. During the first phase, drivers who need to access the BK-bound Belt Parkway ramp from the upper level in the morning must use the left lane of the bridge. Signs will be in place directing drivers to the dedicated lane. During the work, all current lanes of traffic will be maintained during peak weekday morning and afternoon drive times using a movable barrier that can be shifted to allow for three Brooklyn-bound, upper level lanes in the morning and three Staten Island-bound, upper level lanes in the afternoon. Drivers can also utilize the lower level of the bridge, which have three available lanes in each direction during peak traffic times. See http://bit.ly/1zPpkqV for details.

email_body: Notification issued 3/4/15 at 7:06 AM. The National Weather Service has issued a Winter Storm Warning for Staten Island, Brooklyn and Queens from 7:00 PM, March 4th to 7:00 PM, Thursday, March 5th. The current forecast calls for 4-8 inches of snow. Visibilities are expected to be approximately one quarter to one half mile at times. A Winter Storm Watch has been issued for Manhattan and the Bronx from 7:00 PM, March 4th to 7:00 PM, Thursday, March 5th. The current forecast calls for 3-6 inches of snow. For updates please visit: http://www.weather.gov/nyc.

email_body: Notification issued 2/28/15 at 10:44 PM.  Following earlier incident, the northbound exit ramp of the Van Wyck Expressway at Main Street (QN) is now open.

Notification issued 2/28/15 at 9:33 PM. The New York City Office of Emergency Management today issued a travel advisory for a wintry mix of snow and freezing rain Sunday, March 1 through Monday morning, March 2, 2015. The National Weather Service has issued a Winter Weather Advisory for 10:00AM Sunday through 7:00AM Monday. Light snow will develop by midday Sunday, with 1-2 inches of accumulation expected by Sunday evening. The snow will mix with or change to freezing rain Sunday evening. The ice and snow is expected to taper off before the Monday morning commute, but untreated roads and walkways are expected to still be slippery. A total of 2-4 inches of snow is expected with this event, with up to a tenth of an inch of ice. New Yorkers are asked to exercise caution and be prepared for slippery conditions.   For more information see attached press release: http://imgur.com/VipK1VX

Notification issued 3/2/15 10:00 PM. The New York City Office of Emergency Management today issued a travel advisory for a wintry mix of snow, sleet, freezing rain and rain Tuesday evening March 3, through Wednesday morning March 4, 2015. The National Weather Service has issued a Winter Weather Advisory for 3:00 PM Tuesday through 2:00 AM Wednesday. Snow will develop late Tuesday afternoon and will mix with or change to sleet and freezing rain Tuesday evening. The wintry mix will then change over to rain late Tuesday night into early Wednesday morning. The rain will taper off before the Wednesday morning commute, but untreated roads and walkways are expected to still be slippery. A total of 1-3 inches of snow and a trace of ice is expected with this event. New Yorkers are asked to exercise caution and be prepared for limited visibility and slippery conditions when traveling.  http://imgur.com/LL6PvCb

Notification issued 4:00PM. The New York City Office of Emergency Management today issued a hazardous travel advisory for Thursday, March 5, 2015. The National Weather Service has issued a Winter Storm Warning for all of New York City from 7:00PM Wednesday evening through 7:00PM Thursday evening, March 5, 2015. Rain Wednesday evening will mix with or change to sleet and snow around midnight. The heaviest snow is expected early Thursday morning, with 2 to 4 inches of snow accumulation expected by the Thursday morning rush. The snow will taper off Thursday afternoon. A total of 4 to 8 inches of snow accumulation is expected with this event. New Yorkers are asked to use mass transit where possible. Use caution when driving and allow for additional travel time, as roads will be dangerous due to the weather conditions. Fore more info:  http://www.nyc.gov/html/oem/html/pr/15_03_04_hazardous_travel_advisory.shtml

notification_title: Three Alarm Fire - Avenue N & East 12th Street (BK)
email_body: Notification issued 2/27/15 at 2:16 PM. Emergency personnel are on the scene of a three alarm fire located at Avenue N and East 12th Street in Brooklyn. Expect smoke, traffic delays, and a presence of emergency personnel and vehicles in the area. The NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene advises avoiding smoke exposure from structural fires by closing windows while indoors and reducing outdoor activity where smoke is present. People with heart or breathing conditions such as asthma may be more sensitive and should seek immediate medical attention if they experience a worsening of their condition, shortness of breath, or chest pains.

notification_title: Bayonne Bridge - 'Raise the Roadway' Project Through 2017 (SI)
email_body: Notification issued 2/25/15 at 4:00 PM.  As the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey continues to progress in the 'Raise the Roadway' Bayonne Bridge Navigational Clearance Project, many intermittent planned delays and bridge closures will take place through estimated completion in 2017.  To stay up-to-date on closures and delays throughout the process, please visit http://www.panynj.gov/alerts-advisories/advisories.html?tabnum=4 or visit http://www.panynj.gov/bayonnebridge/ and sign up for email updates.  As an alternative, customers can also receive updates by following @BayonneBridge on Twitter.

Notification issued 2/23/15 at 6:20 PM. Due to planned construction, the Bayonne Bridge will be closed in both directions from 9:00 AM - 3:00 PM on Wednesday, 2/25, Thursday, 2/26, and Friday, 2/27. Overnight closures will occur nightly from 9:00PM - 5:00 AM the following morning on the following nights: 2/23, 2/24, 2/25, and 2/26. A 24-hour full closure will take effect Friday, February 27 at 11:59 PM until Saturday, February 28 at 11:59 PM.    During these planned closures, all traffic will be diverted to the Goethals Bridge.     For more information, please visit http://www.panynj.gov/alerts-advisories/advisories.html.

Notification issued 2/20/15 at 3:00 PM. New York City Emergency Management has issued a weather alert for dangerous cold temperatures for tonight, followed by a wintry mix of snow, sleet, freezing rain, and rain Saturday, 2/21 through Sunday 2/22. Low temperatures tonight are forecast around 10 degrees and wind chills near 5 degrees. Saturday wind chills between 0 and 10 degrees can be expected. Light snow will begin late Saturday morning and continue throughout the day, becoming heavier between 4:00 PM and 7:00 PM. Snow will transition to sleet and freezing rain Saturday evening into Sunday morning. New Yorkers are asked to exercise caution during the period of extreme cold weather, and be prepared for slippery conditions, as freezing rain could cause icy conditions Sunday. See the following press release for details http://on.nyc.gov/1zTBlLE or view NYC Emergency Management's winter weather video: http://bit.ly/1CV6zGS.

Notification issued 2/18/15 at 5:25 PM. New York City Emergency Management has issued a cold weather alert for extremely cold temperatures & subzero wind chills Thursday, February 19, 2015. High winds are expected to begin Thursday afternoon and continue through Thursday night, with sustained winds of 20- 30 mph and gusts up to 35- 40mph. Temperatures remain around zero Thursday night, but wind chills will be as low as 15 to 20 degrees below zero. Temperatures remain extremely cold Friday, with a high near 15 degrees and wind chills as low as 2 degrees. New Yorkers are asked to exercise caution during this period of extreme cold weather and check on their neighbors, friends, and relatives, especially the elderly and those with disabilities and access and functional needs.    For more info: http://i.imgur.com/KnpSuUO.png.    To view this message in American Sign Language (ASL) with audio and subtitles, please visit: http://bit.ly/1xyhDK1.

notification_title: ASP Suspension and NYC Emergency Management Travel Advisory for 2/17 (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 2/16/15 at 6:47 PM. New York City Emergency Management has issued a Travel Advisory for Tuesday, 2/17/15. The National Weather Service issued a Winter Weather Advisory from Midnight tonight - Noon 2/17. Snow is expected to begin after midnight and will continue into the Tuesday morning commute, ending early Tuesday afternoon.  2 - 4 inches is predicted, with wind gusts of up to 20 mph. High temperatures Tuesday will be near 25 degrees, with wind chills of 5 to 15 degrees. New Yorkers are asked to exercise caution when driving and allow for additional travel time.    Alternate Side Parking rules are suspended Tuesday. Parking meters remain in effect throughout the city. Info http://on.nyc.gov/1cAl5rj. To view this message in American Sign Language (ASL) with audio and subtitles, please visit: http://bit.ly/11wDLan.    The Department of Sanitation issued a Snow Alert. PlowNYC: www.nyc.gov/severeweather.    For more info: http://i.imgur.com/MHqvKx9.png.

notification_title: NYS Missing Vulnerable Adult - Thi Chau F/A/69
email_body: Notification issued 2/16/15 at 1:08 AM. The New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for Thi Chau, a 69-year-old Asian female with dementia and may be in need of medical attention. She was last seen in Smithtown, New York at 4:00 PM on Sunday, February 15. It has been determined that Ms. Chau took a train to New York City where she often frequents homeless shelters. She is 5'2', 137 lbs, with black hair, brown eyes and was last seen wearing a dark colored Northface jacket, black jeans, and white sneakers. Ms.Chau speaks Chinese and limited English. A photo is available at http://imgur.com/c85V4kB. If you see Ms. Chau, please call the Suffolk County Police Department at (631) 852-6410 or 911.

notification_title: NYC Emergency Management Travel Advisory & Cold Weather Alert (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 2/14/15 at 6:30 PM. New York City Emergency Management has issued a Travel Advisory for 3-7' of snow (locally higher amounts possible) tonight, and a cold weather alert for extremely frigid temperatures & subzero wind chills through Monday, 2/16. The National Weather Service issued a Winter Weather Advisory from 1PM today - 1PM 2/15, and a High Wind Warning from midnight - 2PM 2/15. Near-blizzard conditions & low visibilities are possible. The system will make travel dangerous late tonight through early Sunday. New Yorkers are asked to exercise caution when driving and to check on neighbors, friends, and relatives who may be at an increased risk of being affected by the extreme cold.    The Department of Sanitation issued a Snow Alert. PlowNYC: www.nyc.gov/severeweather.    For more info: http://bit.ly/1JeOgTr.    To view this message in American Sign Language (ASL) with audio and subtitles, please visit: http://bit.ly/1xyhDK1.

Notification issued 2/14/15 at 3:55 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a High Wind Warning citywide from midnight tonight to 2:00 PM Sunday, 2/15. Sustained winds of 30-40 MPH and gusts up to 60 MPH are expected. Please visit http://www.weather.gov/nyc for the latest information.

The National Weather Service has issued a Winter Weather Advisory from midnight tonight until 6 AM Tuesday. A mix of sleet and rain is expected this evening and will transition to freezing rain after midnight. This wintry mix will continue through Monday evening and will taper off overnight Monday into early Tuesday morning. A trace of snow and a total of a tenth of an inch of ice accumulation is expected. New Yorkers are asked to exercise caution when driving and allow for additional travel time, as roads may be dangerous due to the icy conditions. Notification issued 1/31/15 at 10:10 PM. At this moment, the Department of Health recommends that residents in the immediate vicinity of the fire at Kent Avenue & North 11th Street (BK) and those who are immediately downwind of the smoke limit exposure by staying indoors, and keeping their windows closed. If anyone in the immediate area experiences shortness of breath, chest pains, or a worsening medical condition such as asthma, they should seek immediate medical attention. As with most fires of this magnitude, it is important that everyone limit their exposure to smoke. Local air quality has been affected but is not likely to cause significant health problems for healthy people. People who are vulnerable, like seniors, children and people with respiratory conditions may experience some difficulty breathing.

Notification issued 1/29/15 at 3:00 PM. New York City Emergency Management has issued a Weather Advisory for Thursday, January 29, 2015 and Friday, January 30, 2015. Light snow is expected to begin around 9:00 PM and continue until early Friday morning. An accumulation of 1-2 inches of snow is expected, with little to no ice formation, but roads could be slippery for Friday's commute. Decreasing temperatures and increased winds are forecast for Friday afternoon and evening. Nighttime lows of 12 to 13 degrees with wind chills of -5 to -10 degrees are possible. Sustained winds of 20 to 30 MPH can be expected with gusts of of up 40 MPH. New Yorkers are advised to check on their neighbors, friends, and relatives - especially the elderly and those with disabilties and access functional needs. For more information see attached press release: http://www.nyc.gov/html/oem/html/pr/15_01_29_weather_advisory.shtml

email_body: Notification issued 1/27/15 at 10:52 AM. Following an earlier suspension, MTA Long Island Railroad, Metro-North Railroad, and Staten Island Railroad have resumed with limited service. All service will operate on a Sunday schedule for today, Tuesday, 1/27. See http://mta.info for details.     In addition, New Jersey Transit train service resumed as of 10:00 AM and New Jersey Transit bus service will resume at 11:00 AM. Both trains and buses will operate on a weekend schedule. See http://njtransit.com for details.     Amtrak service will now operate between New York and Albany. Amtrak Northeast Regional and Acela Express service will continue to operate on a reduced schedule between New York and Washington, but service remains suspended between New York and Boston.    Expect residual delays and allow for additional travel time.

Alert issued 1/27/15 at 8:34 AM. Following an earlier suspension, NYC Subway and Bus service will resume with limited service at 9:00 AM today, 1/27. A full sunday schedule is expected to begin at noon. Expect residual delays.

Notification issued 1/27/15 at 8:20 AM. As of 8:00 AM, all MTA Bridge and Tunnel facilities have re-opened. Due to slick roadway conditions, motorists are asked to drive at reduced speeds. In addition, all Port Authority Bridges and Tunnels have re-opened. PATH train service and the Port Authority Bus service will resume at 9:30 AM.

notification_title: Travel Ban Lifted & Staten Island Ferry Service Resumed (CW)
email_body: Alert issued 1/27/15 at 7:30 AM. Mayor de Blasio has announced that the travel ban for all NYC roads has been lifted as of 7:30 AM. All residents are allowed to travel on NYC roadways. In addition, Staten Island Ferry service has resumed as of 7:30 AM. Exercise caution when driving and allow for additional travel time.

Alert issued 1/26/15 at 9:25 PM. Due to impending winter weather, Mayor de Blasio has issued a State of Emergency for New York City. All non-emergency vehicles must be off all roads in the city by 11:00 PM, and until further notice.

notification_title: Additional Mass Transit Suspensions - PATH, SI Ferry, PANYNJ, Amtrak (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 1/26/15 at 7:50 PM. Due to impending winter weather, many mass transit suspensions are in effect:    The Staten Island Ferry will suspend operations beginning at 11:30PM tonight, 1/26.     PATH service and the Port Authority Bus Terminal will suspend service as of 11:00PM tonight, 1/26.    All Port Authority Bridges and Tunnels will close at 11PM tonight, 1/26, until further notice.    Amtrak has suspended Northeast Regional and Acela Express service between NY and Boston for tomorrow, 1/27. In addition, Amtrak has suspended Empire Service, Amtrak Downeaster, Vermonter, and Springfield line service, as well as Lake Shore Limited between NY and Albany and Albany and Boston only for tomorrow, 1/27. Acela Express and Northeast Regional (NY-Washington) and Keystone Service (NY-Harrisburg, PA) will operate at reduced frequencies.     Limit unnecessary travel.

notification_title: Suspension - MTA Subway, Metro North, Long Island Railroad, MTA Bus, NJ Transit (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 1/26/15 at 5:25 PM. Due to impending winter weather, all NYC Subway, Metro North, Long Island Railroad, and MTA Bus service will be suspended effective 11:00 PM tonight, 1/26.  NJ Transit will be suspended effective 8:00PM tonight, 1/26. Limit unnecessary travel.

Notification issued 1/26/15 at 3:30 PM. Due to the impending winter storm, NYC Parks will close tonight at 6:00 PM, effective until further notice. Closures include all parks and recreation centers, and signage will be posted at all parks sites. Heavy ice and snow can cause hazardous conditions in parks, including falling branches and treacherous frozen park paths. On Tuesday morning NYC Parks will provide an update on parks conditions.

Notification issued 1/26/15 at 3:15 PM.  The National Weather Service has issued a Coastal Flood Warning for The Bronx and Northern Queens from 3AM - 7AM tomorrow, 1/27.  The affected area includes the New York coasts of the western Long Island Sound. Tidal departures are expected to be 2-3 feet above normal tide, with potential for up to 4 feet. Waves of 3-5 feet and high storm tides may cause beach erosion along the north facing shorelines open to the Long Island Sound. A few exposed waterfront structures may be damaged, and the potential for flooding of vulnerable shore roads exists. Coastal residents in the warned area should be alert for rising water and take appropriate action to protect life and property. For more information, visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

Notification issued 1/26/15 at 3:15 PM.  The National Weather Service has issued a Coastal Flood Warning for Brooklyn and southern Queens from midnight tonight through 5AM tomorrow, 1/27.  The affected area includes the south shore bays of western Long Island. Tidal departures are expected to be 2-3 feet above normal tide. Waves of 6-9 feet and high storm tides may cause beach erosion and washovers along ocean facing barrier beaches. A few exposed waterfront structures may be damaged, and the potential for flooding of vulnerable shore roads exists. Coastal residents in the warned area should be alert for rising water and take appropriate action to protect life and property. For more information, visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

Notification issued 1/26/15 at 1:48 PM. Due to Winter Storm Juno, all New York City public schools will be closed tomorrow, Tuesday, January 27, 2015. Student after-school programs and PSAL games are also cancelled. We urge New Yorkers to exercise caution when going outside. For more information: http://schools.nyc.gov/default.htm    To view this message in American Sign Language (ASL) with audio and subtitles, please visit: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cx0Pm3hQ6x4

Notification issued 1/25/15 at 3:35 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a citywide Blizzard Warning which is in effect from Monday, 1/26 at 1PM until midnight on Tuesday, 1/27. The current forecast calls for 20-30 inches of snow, with locally higher amounts possible and snowfall rates of up to 2-4 inches per hour late Monday night into Tuesday morning. Northern winds of 30-40mph are forecast, with gusts of up to 65mph possible. Temperatures in the lower 20s are expected, with visibilities of one quarter mile or less at times. For more information visit www.weather.gov/nyc.
Notification issued 1/25/15 at 3:15 PM. Emergency personnel are on the scene of a high rise fire in the area of Grand Central Terminal in Manhattan. Expect traffic delays and smoke in the area.

Mr. Alvarado has Alzheimer's and is described as 5'8' tall, 180 pounds, with brown eyes. He was last seen at 3:00 PM on Saturday, 1/24, wearing a grey jacket, green pants, and a navy blue backpack. A photo of the missing is available at http://bit.ly/1wvsyOF. If you see Mr. Alvarado, please call 9-1-1.

Notification issued 1/24/15 at 9:02 PM. The New York City Departments of Sanitation, Transportation, and Emergency Management (OEM) have issued a Weather Update. Black ice may create travel hazards tonight into Sunday, 1/25.  As temperatures drop below freezing areas of black ice are possible on walk ways and untreated surfaces. Motorists are advised to use caution when traveling tonight and drive slowly.  Vehicles take longer to stop on snow and ice than on dry pavement. Pedestrians should exercise caution, avoid slippery surfaces, and have a heightened awareness of cars, particularly when approaching or crossing intersections.  Seniors should take extra care outdoors to avoid slips and falls from icy conditions. http://bit.ly/1wvhn8E

The National Weather Service has issued a Winter Weather Advisory from midnight tonight until 6:00 PM on Saturday, January 24. Light snow is expected to begin around 11:00 PM tonight and is expected to taper off by 6:00 PM Saturday. A total of 2-5 inches has been forecast, with wind gusts between 30 and 40 MPH expected late Saturday afternoon. Slippery roads, limited visibilities, and temperatures below freezing can be anticipated. Exercise caution when driving and limit unnecessary travel. For more information see attached press release: http://www.nyc.gov/html/oem/html/pr/15_01_23_travel_advisory.shtml

notification_title: NYS DCJS Missing Child Alert - Stephanie Quito F/W/14 (CW)
email_body: Alert issued 1/22/15 at 7:47 AM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Child Alert for Stephanie L. Quito, female, white, 14 years old, from Eastchester, NY. She is described as 5'5' tall, weighing 110 pounds, and has brown hair and brown eyes. Ms. Quito is an endangered runaway who was last seen wearing a white jacket, blue jeans, brown Ugg boots, and a blue backpack. Police believe Ms. Quito may have been at the Crestwood Train Station in Tuckahoe, NY, and are concerned for her safety. She may attempt to travel to NYC. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/gvb0AZh.jpg. If you see Ms. Quito, please call 9-1-1 or the Eastchester Town Police Department at (914) 961-3464.

notification_title: Missing Child Alert - Karla Galarza F/W/16 (CW)
email_body: Missing Child Alert issued 1/14/15 at 8:15 PM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Child Alert in regards to the disappearance of Karla Galarza, a 16-year old White female who suffers from low cognitive function and bi-polar disorder as well as other psychological conditions, from the Bronx.  She was last seen at 5:00PM yesterday, 1/13, in the area of East 149th Street & Courtlandt Avenue, BX, wearing faded gray jeans, black boots, a pink polar fleece, and a pink down vest. Miss Galarza is described as being 5'8' tall and 140lbs, with brown hair and brown eyes.  She may attempt to travel to Philipstown, NY. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/uvTXPpI.png.  If you see Miss Galarza, please contact the NYS Police Cortlandt at 914-737-7171 or 9-1-1.

Mr. Coley is described as 5'7' tall, weighing 160 pounds, with brown eyes and gray hair. He was last seen at 12:30 PM on Monday, January 12, inside his residence located at East 95th Street and Farragut Road in Brooklyn. Mr. Coley was reportedly wearing pajamas at the time of his disappearance. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/6aEbcqU.jpg. If you see Mr. Coley, please call 9-1-1.

Less than one inch of snow and a glaze of ice is forecast before the wintry mix transitions to all rain after 10:00 AM. A Winter Weather Advisory is in effect from 3:00 AM to 10:00 AM Monday. For more information: http://i.imgur.com/b0MuG3r.png

notification_title: NYS Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert - William Slade M/B/54 (CW)
email_body: Alert issued 1/8/15 at 6:23 PM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for William Slade, a 54-year-old Black male who is bi-polar and suicidal, from Yonkers, NY. Mr. Slade frequents the area of Hudson Street and may be in need of medical attention. He is described as being 5'9' tall and 169 lbs. with black hair and brown eyes. He was last seen on foot at 1:00 PM today, 1/8, in the area of St. Joseph's Hospital, located at 127 South Broadway in Yonkers. He was wearing a blue hooded sweatshirt and blue jeans, and made threats that he was going to jump into the Hudson River. A photo is available at: http://i.imgur.com/lPyc1pw.jpg. If you see Mr. Slade, please call the Yonkers City Police Department Communications Division at 914-377-7900, or call 9-1-1.

notification_title: Wind Chill Advisory In Effect Wednesday Evening, Frigid Temperatures Through Thursday (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 1/6/14 at 5:40 PM.  With temperatures expected to be dangerously cold today through Thursday, 1/8, Mayor de Blasio has issued a winter weather update, urging New Yorkers to take precautions to protect themselves and help others who may be at increased risk of health problems.     Today's forecast includes temperatures in the low 20s with wind chill values of 10-15 degrees. Wednesday's forecast includes a high near 28 degrees, with a low of 9 degrees Wednesday night and wind chill values between zero and -15 degrees. The National Weather Service has issued a Wind Chill Advisory from 7PM Wednesday evening until 8AM on Thursday, 1/8.    New Yorkers should take precautions, including staying indoors when possible, checking on neighbors who may be at risk, and reporting loss of heat or hot water to property managers & 3-1-1. Visit http://on.nyc.gov/1DuIkPn for info and tips for staying safe.

notification_title: NYS Missing Vulnerable Adult - Thomas A Odwyer M/W/75
email_body: Alert issued 12/25/14 at 5:40 PM. The New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert in regards to the disappearance of Thomas A Odwyer, a 75-year-old white male with dementia, a heart condition, and kidney failure from West Hempstead, NY.  Mr. Odwyer is described as being 5'8' tall, 160 lbs with white hair, and gray eyes. Mr. Odwyer was last made contact with his family on 12/24. He may be driving a 2014 blue Honda Accord, license plate GLV - 7286. Mr. Odwyer may appear lost or confused and may be in need of medical attention.  A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/rXiisjj.png. If you see Mr. Odwyer, please call 9-1-1 or 516-573-7347.

notification_title: Update - School Relocation PS 396X, MS 390X, P10X - (BX)
email_body: Notification issued 12/17/14 at 12:18 PM. This is an updated notification to the previously issued school relocation message. Students of PS 396, which have been relocated to PS 226, located at 1950 Sedgwick Avenue in The Bronx, will be bussed from or can be picked up from the relocation site (1950 Sedgwick Avenue). Students who wish to walk home will be walked to the front of PS 396 (home school building) and then dismissed. Students of MS 390 and P10X, which were relocated to PS 15 located at 2195 Andrews Avenue in The Bronx, will be bussed from or can be picked up from the relocation site (2195 Andrews Avenue). Students who wish to walk home will be walked to the front of MS 390 or P10X (home school building) and then dismissed.

email_body: Alert issued 12/16/14 at 8:48 PM.  The New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert in regards to the disappearance of Lillian Arana, a 72-year-old white female with Alzheimer's, from Larchmont Village, NY.  Ms. Arana is described as being 5'2' tall , 150 lbs with brown hair, brown eyes, and tattooed eyebrows. Ms. Arana was last seen at approximately 8:00 AM on 12/16 on West Street, Larchmont Village, NY. She was last seen wearing a brown jacket and dark leggings. Ms. Arana may seem to be confused and in need of medical attention.  A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/FbIjWA0.jpg. If you see Ms. Arana, please call 9-1-1.

email_body: Alert issued 12/10/14 at 7:22 PM.  The New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert in regards to the disappearance of Jose Leon, a 20-year-old white male with autism, from Queens, NY.  Mr. Leon is described as being 5'7' tall and 200lbs with black hair and brown eyes. Mr. Leon was last seen at approximately 1:30 PM on 12/10 in Yonkers, NY. He was last seen wearing a gray jacket, brown sweatpants with yellow stripes, and blue and red sneakers. Mr. Leon likes to frequent McDonald's restaurants. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/RQGZo2v.jpg.  If you see Mr. Leon, please call 9-1-1.

notification_title: Areal Flood Warning (BX, MN, QN, BK)
email_body: Notification issued 12/9/14 at 2:15 PM. The National Weather Service has issued an Areal Flood Warning for The Bronx, Manhattan, Queens, and Brooklyn until 4:00 PM. Locally heavy rainfall totals between a inch and two inches has been reported in the area. Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. Move to higher ground. For the latest information visit: http://www.weather.gov/nyc.

Notification issued 12/9/14 at 12:55 PM. The National Weather Service has issued an Areal Flood Warning in effect until 3:15 PM for The Bronx. Locally heavy rainfall totals between a quarter of an inch to a half an inch has been reported in the area. Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. Move to higher ground. For the latest information visit: http://www.weather.gov/nyc.

notification_title: NYS Missing Vulnerable Adult - Henry Finke M/W/84 (CW)
email_body: Alert issued 12/3/14 at 2:55 AM.  The New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert in regards to the disappearance of Henry Finke, an 84-year-old White male with dementia, from Huntington, NY.  He is described as being 5'1' tall and 200lbs with white hair and blue eyes.  Mr. Finke was last seen at approximately 1:00 PM on 12/2 in Huntington, NY, and was driving a 2007 gray Buick Lucerne with New York registration CVL9022.  He may be traveling to the Hunter Mountain area and may be in need of medical attention.  A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/WYa5xCY.jpg.  If you see Mr. Finke, please call the Suffolk County Police Department at 631-854-8200, or call 9-1-1.

notification_title: NYS Missing Vulnerable Adult - Paolo Macri M/W/83 (CW)
email_body: Alert issued 12/3/14 at 12:55 AM.  The New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert in regards to the disappearance of Paolo Macri, an 83-year-old White male with early onset dementia, from Great Neck, NY.  Mr. Macri is described as being 5'8' tall and 240lbs with gray hair and brown eyes.  He was last seen in Great Neck, NY at approximately 7:30 AM on 12/2 and was driving a 2014 gray Jeep Cherokee with NY registration CER8457.  He may be in need of medical attention. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/mzaMHek.jpg.  If you see Mr. Macri, please call the Nassau County Police Department 3rd Precinct at 516-573-7347, or call 9-1-1.

email_body: Silver Alert issued 12/2/14 at 3:32 AM. NYPD has issued a Silver Alert for the disappearance of Chong Hi Kim, female, Asian, 80 years of age, from Main Street and Blossom Avenue in Queens. Ms. Kim is described as 5'2' tall and weighing 110 pounds with brown eyes and gray hair. She was last seen at 12:30 PM on Sunday, November 30th at her residence wearing a blue jacket, tan pants and white sneakers. The missing speaks predominately Korean. A photo is available at http://i.imgur.com/9pI6c8U.jpg. If you see Ms. Kim, please call 9-1-1.

Ms.Livshen was last seen 11/30 at 4:00 PM in the area of East 18th Street and Avenue R (BK) wearing a black coat, pink sweater, black pants and white sneakers. notification_title: NYS Vulnerable Adult Alert - Michael Ward M/W/85 (CW)
email_body: Alert issued 11/25/14 at 9:49 AM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for Michael R. Ward, male, white, 85 years old, from Cortlandt Manor, NY. Mr. Ward has early on-set dementia and may be in need of medical attention. He is described as 5'9' tall and weighing 130 lbs. Mr. Ward has gray hair and blue eyes. He was last seen leaving his home in Cortlandt Manor, NY at 12:00 PM on Monday, 11/24. Mr. Ward was reportedly driving a 2012 black Cheverolet Malibu with NY Registration FTK2463. A photo is available at: http://i.imgur.com/B54oIxS.jpg. If you see Mr. Ward, please call the NYS Police at (914) 737-7171 or dial 9-1-1.

email_body: Alert Cancellation issued 11/24/14 at 6:53 AM.  The NYS Troopers have cancelled the AMBER Alert for Steven Ristick.

notification_title: AMBER ALERT - Steven Ristick - M/W/3 Months (CW)
email_body: AMBER Alert issued 11/24/14 at 1:35 AM. NY State Police have issued an Amber Alert for Steven Ristick, a 3 month old white male from Greenport, NY (Columbia County). Mr. Ristick is described as 18' long, 11 lbs., w/ brown hair & brown eyes. He was last seen @ 10:47 PM on 11/23 wearing a long sleeved white T-shirt underneath a green shirt which says 'Daddy's Little Sidekick.' He is reportedly traveling with suspect Jonathan Lawrence, a 21 year old white male, 6'1' tall, 200 lbs, with brown hair and brown eyes. Mr. Lawrence was last seen wearing a red and blue puffy jacket & blue jogging pants, with a tattoo of 'Canadien' on his left arm & a tribal tattoo on his right bicep. The suspect and missing were last seen traveling south on Fairview Avenue in a blue Chrysler minivan w/ a Connecticut license plate, and are possibly en route to NJ. The child may be in imminent danger. A photo is not available. If seen, please call(866) NYS - AMBER or 9-1-1. For updates visit http://amber.ny.gov.

Notification issued on 11/23/14 at 5:07 PM. The NYPD has issued a Silver Alert for Gerald Kinnison, a 60 year old Black male with dementia, from the area of Surf Avenue in Brooklyn. Mr. Kinnison is describerd as being 6' tall and 180 pounds, thin built, with brown eyes, black hair, and beard. The individual was last seen in the area of 23-16 Surf Avenue in Brooklyn on 11/21 at 8:00 AM wearing a black jacket, black shirt, blue pants, and large black sneakers. He may be walking in the direction of Manhattan. A photo of the missing is attached. If you see Mr. Kinnison, please call 9-1-1. http://bit.ly/1qWiMJs

notification_title: NYS Missing Vulnerable Adult - Marilyn E. Frank F/W/82 (CW)
email_body: Alert issued 11/21/14 at 12:48 AM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for the disappearance of Marilyn E. Frank, female, white, 82 years old, from Merrick, NY. Ms. Frank has dementia and may appear lost or confused and she may be in need of medical attention. She was last seen driving a 2004 gray Hyundai Accent with New York registration FFB-7764 yesterday, 11/20. She is described as being 4'4' tall and 140 lbs. with white hair and green eyes. If you see Ms. Frank, please call the Nassau County Police Department at 1-516-573-7347 or 911. A photo is attached.

Notification issued 11/20/14 at 3:00 PM. In commemoration of the 50th Anniversary of the Verrazano Bridge, two Howitzer cannons will alternately fire 25 shots between 10:30 AM and 11:30 AM on Friday, November 21, in the vicinity of the bridge. One cannon will be located in Fort Hamilton, Brooklyn and the other in Fort Wadsworth, Staten Island. A test firing will be conducted between 8:00 AM and 10:00 AM, which will consist of one shot being fired from each side of the bridge. A helicopter flyover will take place at approximately 11:30 AM. Traffic on the Verrazano Bridge will not be impacted.

Notification issued 11/20/14 at 9:22 AM. Due to intermittent bridge lifts, expect extensive delays on the Bayonne Bridge in the Staten Island and New Jersey bound directions until 3:00 PM today. Consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time.

LIRR eastbound trains from Penn Station are experiencing heavy delays and intermittent cancellations. Please consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time.

Notification issued 11/19/14 at 2:10 PM.  A blue Twinstar helicopter, registration number N326SC, will be conducting a flyover survey today, 11/19, in the vicinity of One World Trade Center and Four World Trade Center in Manhattan.  The activity will take place between 2:00 PM and 6:00 PM and will involve a helicopter with an external mounted camera pod.

notification_title: NYS Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert - Richard Duroseau (CW)
email_body: Alert issued 11/14/14 at 9:40 PM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for the disappearance of Richard Duroseau, male, black, 74 years old, from East Meadow, NY. Mr. Duroseau has dementia. He was last seen leaving Nassau University Medical Center on Friday, 11/14/2014. He is believed to be on foot and was last seen wearing a dark grey jacket, pressed pants, a dress shirt, and a tie. Mr. Duroseau is a musician that could be traveling to Brooklyn, NY. A photo is available at http://i.imgur.com/s8V1Csu.jpg. If you see Mr. Duroseau, please call the Nassau Police Department at (516) 573-7347 or 9-1-1.

email_body: Alert issued 11/14/14 at 9:37 AM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for the disappearance of William Andrews, male, black, 64 years old, from Hempstead, NY. Mr. Andrews has dementia and may be in need of medical attention. He was last seen leaving Nassau University Medical Center at 7:30 PM on Thursday, 11/13. He is believed to be on foot and was last seen wearing blue jeans, white sneakers, a green jacket, and a brown baseball hat. Mr. Andrews could be traveling to Roosevelt or Brooklyn, NY. A photo is available at http://i.imgur.com/wikdSV7.jpg. If you see Mr. Andrews, please call the Nassau Police Department at (516) 573-7347 or 9-1-1.

Silver Alert issued 11/13/14 at 4:25 PM. NYPD has issued a Silver Alert for the disappearance of Ronald Bastone, a 69-year-old black male with dementia. Mr. Bastone is described as being 6'0' tall and 170 pounds with a slim build, brown eyes, and salt and pepper hair. He is from Delaware, but he was last seen yesterday, 11/12, at 5:00 PM in the area of Lenox Avenue & West 132nd Street in Manhattan, wearing a dark gray jacket, black sweatpants, and black shoes. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/l3K8isL.jpg. If you see Mr. Bastone, please call 9-1-1.

email_body: Notification issued 11/13/14 at 4:05 PM. Due to FDNY activity, expect traffic delays and the presence of emergency personnel and vehicles in the area of 24th Avenue and 36th Street in Queens.

notification_title: Missing Child Alert - Gene Warren M/B/17
email_body: Missing Child Alert issued 11/13/14 at  3:00 PM. The New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Child Alert for the disappearance of Gene Warren, a 17 year old black male child with autism. He has been known to travel to Brooklyn or he may return to his residence in Yonkers (Westchester County). He may be in need of medical attention. He is 5'9', 230lbs with black hair, a stocky build, and a beard. Gene was last seen wearing royal blue jeans, a navy blue and white plaid shirt, a black bubble jacket, and blue and white sneakers. A photo is available at  http://i.imgur.com/pUpkfK2.jpg. If seen, please call the Westchester County Department of Public Safety at 914-864-7701, or call 9-1-1.

notification_title: Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert - Ronald Bastone M/B/69 (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 11/13/14 at 12:53 PM. NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for Ronald Bastone, male, black, 69-years old, from out of state. Mr. Bastone has dementia and was last seen on foot at 7:00 PM on Wednesday, 11/12 in the vicinity of West 132nd Street and Lenox Avenue in Manhattan. The missing is currently visiting from out of state and is unfamiliar with the area. Mr. Bastone may appear lost or confused and in need of medical attention. A photo is available at http://i.imgur.com/VIqpOU4.jpg. If you see Mr. Bastone, please call the NYCPD Missing Person Squad at (212) 690-6315 or 9-1-1.

notification_title: Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert - Albert Ser M/W/77 (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 11/13/14 at 12:24 PM. NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for Albert Ser, male, white, 77-years old, from Wetherole Street and 66th Avenue in Queens. Mr. Ser has dementia and was last seen wearing a blue jacket, red plaid shirt, brown pants, and black shoes. The missing is believed to be operating a black 2010 Mercury Milan, with NY registration BHU-8759 in the Manhattan area. Mr. Ser may be lost or confused and in need of medical attention. A photo is available at http://i.imgur.com/4WywO7V.jpg. If you see Mr. Ser, please call the NYCPD Missing Person Squad at (718) 520-9200 or 9-1-1.

Silver Alert issued 11/13/14 at 8:53 AM. NYPD has issued a Silver Alert for the disappearance of Albert Ser, male, white, 77 years of age, from Wetherole Street and 66th Avenue in Queens. Mr. Ser has dementia and is described as 5'7' tall and weighing 135 pounds, medium build with gray hair, blue eyes and wears glasses. He was last seen at his residence wearing a blue waist length jacket, red plaid shirt, brown pants and black shoes. Mr. Ser was last seen on 11/12 at 4:00 PM. A photo is available at http://i.imgur.com/EcwTsM8.jpg. If you see Mr. Ser, please call 9-1-1.

notification_title: Planned Closure of the Manhattan-Bound Brooklyn Bridge from 11/7 - 11/10 (BK/MN)
email_body: Notification issued 11/7/14 at 3:00 PM. The overnight detours of Manhattan-bound traffic on the Brooklyn Bridge will be extended to include daytime hours this weekend, November 7th to November 10th. During this time, the Brooklyn Bridge will be closed to Manhattan-bound traffic from midnight on Friday night until 6:00 a.m. on Monday morning (54 consecutive hours). Among other operations, this full weekend closure will enable the contractor to place asphalt on a portion of the Manhattan-bound Brooklyn Approach. While the Manhattan Bridge remains an alternative for Manhattan-bound traffic, we urge motorists to also consider taking the Williamsburg Bridge or Brooklyn-Battery Tunnel (MTA-tolled facility) due to an expected high volume of traffic. Brooklyn-bound motorists will access the lanes of the Brooklyn Bridge normally. See http://bit.ly/1wO8UkV for more information.

notification_title: Road Closures for 2014 TCS NYC Marathon - 11/2/14 (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 11/1/14 at 12:00 PM. Numerous bridge and street closures will be in effect citywide from 7:00 AM to 7:00 PM on Sunday, 11/2/14, in support of the 2014 TCS New York City Marathon, including the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge. In addition, the upper level of the bridge will be closed in both directions beginning at 11:00 PM tonight for roadway preparation. For further information visit: http://www.tcsnycmarathon.org/race-day/course. Also see the attached map of the event route and full list of road closures. For help finding an alternate route, call 511 or visit http://www.511NY.org. For other marathon-related roadway closures throughout the city, call the NYC hotline at 311. Please see the following map of the marathon: http://www.tcsnycmarathon.org/sites/default/files/TCSNYCM14_Course%20Map.pdf.

Notification issued 11/1/14 at 7:03 AM. Due to signal problems, expect extensive delays on the G train in both directions between Bedford-Nostrand Avenue in Brooklyn and Court Square in Queens. In addition, extensive delays can be expected in both directions on the N train between Queensboro Plaza and Astoria-Ditmars Boulevard in Queens due to switch problems. Consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time.

notification_title: NYS Missing Vulnerable Adult - Anthony Fata - M/W/93
email_body: Notification issued 10/31/14 at 9:35 PM. The New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for Anthony Fata, a 93-year-old white male from Mineola, NY. Mr. Fata suffers from dementia, may be in need of medical attention, and may be en route to NYC. He is described as being 5'8' tall and 150 lbs with gray hair and brown eyes. He was last seen today at 1:30 PM wearing a gray sweatshirt and gray sweatpants. Mr. Fata is believed to be operating a 1994 green Buick Park Avenue with New York registration AEU8451. A photo is available at http://i.imgur.com/MRqStsn.jpg. If you see Mr. Fata, please call the Nassau County Police Department at 1-516-573-7347 or 911.

Notification issued 10/27/14 at 1:00 PM. Weather permitting, the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) will launch the Orbital Sciences Corporation's Antares orbital rocket from the Wallops Flight Facility in Virginia on Monday, October 27th, at 6:45 PM.  The launch of the rocket may be visible through-out the Mid-Atlantic and Northeast Regions, including parts of New York City. In case of inclement weather, the backup launch dates are 10/28, 10/29, or 10/30. For more information, please see the attached map, or visit: http://i.imgur.com/Av0sCzh.jpg, and http://www.nasa.gov/mission_pages/station/structure/launch/orbital.html.

notification_title: Parachute Jump Demos and Helicopter Flyovers - 10/28, 10/29, 11/8 (BX, MN)
email_body: Notification issued 10/27/14 at 12:00 PM. On Tuesday, October 28th and Wednesday, October 29th (with a possible rain date of Wednesday, November 5th), West Point will conduct parachute demonstrations out of a helicopter over Yankee Stadium (twice daily). These are practice jumps for the actual event, which will take place on Saturday, November 8th. The helicopter will travel from West Point, land on the Intrepid to pick up the four (4) parachute jumpers, and then travel to Yankee Stadium, where the jumpers will begin their demonstration.

Silver Alert issued on 10/25/14 at 2:35 PM. NYPD has issued a Silver Alert for the disappearance of Mary Shannon, a 73-year-old black female who is deaf and mute, from the area of East 102nd Street and 1st Avenue in Manhattan. Ms. Shannon was last seen on 10/24 around 4:00 PM wearing a a purple coat, dark green sweatpants, and a brown wig. She is described as being 4'8' tall and 110lbs. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/6OFFr7R.jpg. If you see Ms. Shannon, please call 9-1-1.

notification_title: Planned Closure of the Manhattan-Bound Brooklyn Bridge from 10/24 - 10/27 (BK/MN)
email_body: Notification issued 10/23/14 at 3:00 PM. Nightly in-bound closures of the Brooklyn Bridge will be extended to include next weekend, October 24th to October 27th. During this time, the Brooklyn Bridge will be closed to Manhattan-bound traffic for 54 consecutive hours, from 11:59 PM on Friday night, 10/24 through 6:00 AM on Monday morning, 10/27. Among other operations, this full weekend closure will enable the completion of rehabilitation work on the Manhattan-bound Sands Street and York Street Structures. Notification issued on 10/22/14 at 3:41 AM. The National Weather Service has issued a Flash Flood Warning for Kings County and Queens County until 5:30 AM. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses, as well as other drainage areas and low lying spots. Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. Move to higher ground. For the latest information visit: http://www.weather.gov/nyc.

Notification issued 10/21/14 at 8:00 AM. Due to NYPD activity, expect extensive delays in the vicinity of Broadway and West 25th Street in Manhattan. Consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time.

Silver Alert issued on 10/20/14 at 2:30 AM. NYPD has issued a Silver Alert for the disappearance of Manuel DeJesus, a 70-year-old Hispanic male with dementia, from the area of Highland Place and Ridgewood Avenue in Brooklyn. notification_title: Update: Planned Closure of the Southbound FDR Drive - 10/18 & 10/19 (MN)
email_body: Notification issued 10/17/14 at 10:35 PM. Update: Weather permitting, the NYC Department of Transportation (DOT) will install a steel protection beam to prevent over-height vehicles from striking the overpass at East 90th St on the FDR Drive in Manhattan. This work will be conducted on Sat, 10/18 and Sun, 10/19, and require a full closure of the southbound FDR Drive from East 96th St to East 78th St from 2:00 AM to 7:00 AM on Sat, 10/18 and on Sun, 10/19. The left lane on the northbound FDR Drive will also be closed near the worksite at East 90th St starting at 10:00 PM. All lanes will reopen at 7:00 AM on Sunday, 10/19. During this project, motorists will be guided along a detour route by NYPD Traffic Control agents. Signs indicating the detour route will also be installed for additional guidance. In case of inclement weather, work will be rescheduled for the weekend of October 24-26. For more information, please visit http://www.nyc.gov/dot.

email_body: Notification issued 9/27/14 at 12:00 PM. The Hugh L. Carey (formerly Brooklyn-Battery) Tunnel will be fully closed in both directions for several hours on Sunday, September 28th, for the annual Stephen Siller Tunnel to Towers Run. One tube will be closed beginning tonight at 10:00 PM.  The other will remain open until 8:00 AM on Sunday, 9/28, when both tubes will be fully closed until 3:00 PM for the event. Consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time.  For more information, please visit www.mta.info.

The New York City Department of Transportation has announced that Alternate Side Parking regulations will be suspended tomorrow, Wednesday, September 24th, 2014, for streets near the Queens Borough Hall, to assist with the closure of the Queens Borough Hall Municipal Garage and Parking Field. The affected area includes: Metropolitan Avenue from Union Turnpike to Hillside Avenue, Union Turnpike from Metropolitan Avenue to Main Street, Main Street from Union Turnpike to Queens Boulevard, Queens Boulevard from Main Street to Hillside Avenue, and Hillside Avenue from Queens Boulevard to Metropolitan Avenue. For more information, please see the attached map, http://imgur.com/8jWYos6, or visit http://www.nyc.gov/html/dot/html/motorist/alternate-side-parking.shtml.

Notification issued 9/23/14 at 5:00 PM.  PATH train service on the Journal Square - 33rd Street and Hoboken - 33rd Street lines remains suspended.  As an alternative, New Jersey Transit and Bus will cross honor PATH tickets.  Ferry service is also available, and will cross honor tickets for NY service from Pier 79 to Hoboken North and Paulus Hook, and World Financial Center to Hoboken South. Ferry service will also cross honor tickets for NJ service from Hoboken South to World Financial Center, and Hoboken North to Paulus Hook to Pier 79. Consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time. See http://www.panynj.gov/path/ for details.

notification_title: AMBER ALERT CANCELLED - Sophia Salazar - F/H/9 - Phillipstown, NY
email_body: AMBER Alert issued 9/23/14 at 12:00 PM. The New York State Police have cancelled the AMBER Alert for the disappearance of Sophia Salazar.

notification_title: AMBER ALERT - Sophia Salazar - F/H/9 - Phillipstown, NY
email_body: AMBER Alert issued 9/23/14 at 11:18 AM. NY State Police have issued an Amber Alert for Sophia Salazar, 9 year old Hispanic female from Phillipstown, NY (Putnam County). Ms. Salazar is described as 4'4' tall, 70 lbs., with brown hair and brown eyes. She was last seen at approximately 5:30 AM today wearing sleepwear. She is reportedly traveling with the lead suspect Luisa Salazar, a 37 year old hispanic female. Luisa Salazar is described as 5'1' tall and weighing 160 pounds. Sophia and Luisa are reportedly traveling in a 2007 blue metallic 4-door Honda Civic with a New York license plate tag DMN9229. The suspect is bipolar, off medication, and has been experiencing delusional episodes. The child may be in imminent danger. A photo is not available at this time. If either are seen, please call(866) NYS - AMBER or 9-1-1. For updates visit http://amber.ny.gov.

The aircraft will depart from Atlantic City International Airport in New Jersey and return to La Guardia Airport in Queens upon completion.

notification_title: NYS Missing Vulnerable Adult - Eva Jones - F/B/80
email_body: Notification issued 9/17/14 at 8:00 PM. The New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for Eva Jones, female, black, 80 years of age, from Roslyn Heights, NY. Ms. Jones suffers from demetia, may be in need of medical attention, and may be en route to NYC. Ms. Jones is described as 5'0' tall, 150 lbs., with gray hair and brown eyes. She was last seen wearing green pants, a white blazer, white sneakers and a white cap. She is believed to be operating a 1999 tan Toyota Camry with New York registration AGZ-2073. A photo is available at http://imgur.com/4gxsOxd. If you see Ms. Jones, please call the Nassau County Police Department at 1-516-573-7347 or 911.

notification_title: Planned Closures of the Eastbound Belt Pkwy - Mon-Fri Starting 9/15/14 (BK)
email_body: Notification issued 9/14/14 at 5:00 PM. The NYC Department of Transportation (DOT) will be milling and resurfacing portions of the eastbound Belt Parkway between Flatbush Ave and Rockaway Parkway (Brooklyn), from 11 PM until 5 AM, beginning Monday, 9/15. Full closures will occur Monday nights through Saturday mornings, and last for approximately three weeks. During this project, motorists will be guided through a detour route, which exits at Flatbush Ave, proceeds to Utica/Flatlands Aves, then East 76th St/Paerdegat Ave, Seaview Ave and returns to the Belt Parkway via Rockaway Parkway. Flatlands and Pennsylvania Aves become an alternate route. Signs indicating the detour route will provide additional guidance. Work will not occur on the nights of Wednesday, 9/24, and Thursday, 9/25, in observance of Rosh Hashanah. Work will resume on the night of Friday, 9/26. For more info and updates, please see the attached map, http://imgur.com/CSxgo6F, or visit http://www.nyc.gov/dot.

The New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for Saurav Banik, a 20 year old Asian male missing from Liberty Avenue and 121st Street in Queens. Mr. Banik suffers from Autism, is non-verbal, and may be in need of medical attention. He is described as being 5'7' and weighing 225 lbs. with black hair and brown eyes. Mr. Banik was last seen at his residence at approximately 6:45 PM Sunday, 8/10/14, wearing a blue shirt and brown jeans. A photo is attached. If you see Mr. Banik, please call the New York City Police Department at 718-776-9252 or 9-1-1. Mr. Hill was last seen at approximately 2:00 PM today, 8/10/14, at Jones Beach State Park wearing blue floral Hawaiian-style shorts and no shirt. notification_title: Road Closures for the 2014 NYC Triathlon (BX / MN)
email_body: Notification issued 8/2/14 at 12:00 PM. All northbound lanes of the Henry Hudson Parkway leading to the Bronx-bound Henry Hudson Bridge will be closed Sunday, August 3, between 4:00 AM and 12:00 PM for the biking portion of the annual NYC Triathlon. The southbound lanes of the Henry Hudson Bridge will remain open; however, motorists should expect delays and consider alternate routes during this event. In addition, the West Side Highway will be closed northbound from 56th Street to the Henry Hudson Bridge, as well as from the Henry Hudson Bridge to Mosholu Parkway. For more information, please see the attached press release or visit http://www.nyctri.com.

notification_title: NYC DOH - Point of Dispensing Drill on 8/1/14
email_body: Notification issued 8/1/14 at 6:30 AM. Today, August 1, the New York City Department of Health will be conducting an emergency preparedness drill at 30 New York City Department of Education facilities across New York City to test the delivery of emergency medications. This drill will occur from approximately 6:30 am until 3:00 pm. Supply trucks will be escorted by NYPD and other law enforcement vehicles, and volunteer staff will receive these supplies and set up medication dispensing operations inside these facilities. No medications will be distributed as part of this drill, and there should be no impact to other planned  activities in these facilities. Please see the DOHMH website at www.nyc.gov/health for more information.

Silver Alert issued 7/24/14 at 7:35 PM.  The New York City Police Department has issued a Silver Alert for the disappearance of Pedro Diaz, a 74 year old Hispanic male with dementia and hypertension.  Mr. Diaz was last seen 7/23 at 8:00 AM in the area of Hull Avenue and East 204th Street, The Bronx. He is described as being 5'3' tall and 170 lbs. with a moustache and brown eyes. He was last seen wearing a light blue jacket, brown shoes, and gray pants. A photo of the missing is attached and available at DCPI. Anyone with information regarding this missing person is asked to call 9-1-1.

notification_title: West Nile Virus Spraying: 7/17/14 to 7/21/14 (SI, QN, BX)
email_body: Notification issued 7/16/14 at 5:00 PM. Weather permitting, the NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene will conduct aerial spraying for mosquitoes via a low-flying helicopter to help prevent West Nile Virus between 6:00 AM and 7:00 PM on 7/17, 7/18, and 7/21 with alternate spray dates of 7/18, 7/21, and 7/22 in the marshlands near the following zip codes in Staten Island, Queens, and The Bronx: 10303, 10306, 10308, 10309, 10311, 10314, 11354, 11356, 11357, 11362, 11363, 10464, 10475, 11691, and 11692. Silver Alert issued 7/16/14 at 2:50 PM.  The New York City Police Department has issued a Silver Alert for the disappearance of Noel Charles, a 68 year old black male with Alzheimer's.  Mr.Charles was last seen 7/15 at 5:30PM in the area of Avenue D and East 89th Street, Brooklyn. He is described as being 6'0' tall, 160 lbs., and bald with brown eyes. He was last seen wearing blue jeans, a green jacket, and a baseball cap with the marking 'DC37'. A photo of the missing is attached and available at DCPI. Anyone with information regarding this missing person is asked to call 9-1-1.

notification_title: Planned Closure of the Manhattan-Bound Brooklyn Bridge from 7/19 to 7/21 (BK/MN)
email_body: Notification issued 7/18/14 at 10:00 AM. As part of the ongoing Brooklyn Bridge Ramps Rehabilitation Project, there will be a continuous 54 hour closure of the Manhattan-bound Brooklyn Bridge and westbound/southbound BQE exit ramp onto Cadman Plaza West (Brooklyn) from 12:01 AM Saturday, July 19 to 6 AM Monday, July 21. BQE exit ramp traffic will be diverted to the Atlantic Avenue exit onto Furman Street. Traffic proceeding inbound to Manhattan should use the Hugh L. Carey Tunnel (pay toll) or the Manhattan/Williamsburg Bridges as alternates. For more information, please visit: http://www.nyc.gov/dot.

Notification issued on 7/15/14 at 7:30 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Flash Flood Warning for Kings County and Queens County until 10:15 PM. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses, as well as other drainage areas and low lying spots. Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. Move to higher ground. For the latest information visit: http://www.weather.gov/nyc.

notification_title: NY State Missing Vulnerable Adult - Jorge Cortes M/H/90 (CW)
email_body: Alert issued 7/13/14 at 7:30 PM. The New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for Jorge Cortes, male, Hispanic, 90 years of age. Mr. Cortes suffers from dementia and may be in need of medical attention. Mr. Cortes is described as 5'7 1D tall, 140 lbs., with grey hair and brown eyes. He was last seen wearing a blue and white shirt and may be operating a 1995 4 door green Ford Taurus with NY registration AKV-9835. A photo is attached. If you see Mr. Cortes, please call the Nassau County Police Department at 516-573-7347 or 9-1-1.

Notification issued on 7/3/14 at 7:45 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Flash Flood Warning for the NYC area until 9:30 PM. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses, as well as other drainage areas and low lying spots. Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. Move to higher ground. For the latest information visit: http://www.weather.gov/nyc.

Notification issued 7/3/14 at 6:25 PM. July 4th fireworks displays will occur tomorrow night after 8 PM off of Liberty State Park in Jersey City, NJ, at 9:30 PM off of the Coney Island Beach Fishing Pier in Brooklyn, and on the East River near the Brooklyn Bridge. The East River display will last for approximately 40 minutes. Associated road closures will begin at 4:00 PM and end at approximately midnight. These will include the FDR Drive from Houston St to the Battery in Manhattan, as well as the Brooklyn Bridge, which will be closed in both directions beginning at 5:00 PM. Governors Island will be closed at 6:00 PM. Expect extensive traffic delays near all fireworks viewing locations. If traveling, consider use of mass transit. For a full list of road closures and recommended public viewing locations, please see the attached list and map, or visit: http://bit.ly/1ldQpwJ.    https://phx-attachments.sendwordnow.com/Attachments.aspx?token=9dd77dc3-a45e-46dc-a234-dca816d60129.

notification_title: Planned Closure of the Upper Level of the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge 6/30-7/1 & 7/1-7/2  (SI)
email_body: Notification issued 6/30/14 at 6:10 PM. Beginning tonight, June 30, to Wednesday, July 2, the MTA will resume an improvement project on the upper level of the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge that may cause significant overnight delays. All three westbound upper-level lanes and one eastbound lane will be closed Monday to Tuesday from 9PM to 6AM the following morning. There will be a full closure of all upper-level lanes in both directions overnight Monday to Tuesday. Passenger vehicles should use the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge lower level OR consider alternate routes. Vehicles carrying hazardous materials and trucks more than 13-feet-6-inches must consider alternate routes. For the most up-to-date closure schedule, visit http://www.mta.info.

notification_title: Planned Closures of the George Washington Bridge - 6/16/14 to 6/21/14 (BX/MN)
email_body: Notification issued 6/15/14 at 3:00 PM. Beginning Monday, June 16, to Saturday June 21, the Port Authority of NY and NJ will resume a steel deck improvement project on the upper level of the George Washington Bridge that may cause significant overnight delays. Three of four upper level lanes will be closed in either the eastbound or westbound direction Monday to Thursday from 9PM to 5AM the following morning, and on Friday night from 10PM to 10AM Saturday. Closure hours will be adjusted to accommodate Yankee games and Meadowlands events. Passenger vehicles should use the GWB lower level OR consider alternate routes. Trucks are required to use the upper level at all times. Highway message signs, 511 and traffic reports will advise motorists in advance which direction will be under construction on any given night. For the most up-to-date closure schedule, visit http://www.panynj.gov/. For regional traffic conditions, call 511 or visit http://www.511NY.org or http://www.511NJ.org.

notification_title: Planned Overnight Closures of the Eastbound/Northbound BQE - 6/14/14 to 6/16/14 (BK/QN)
email_body: Notification issued 6/13/14 at 8:55 PM. To facilitate overhead deck replacement at the Brooklyn Bridge, the following overnight closures of the northbound/eastbound Brooklyn-Queens Expressway (BQE) in Brooklyn will be in effect from Saturday, 6/14 to Monday, 6/16: one of three lanes will be closed from Hamilton Ave to Atlantic Ave, two of three lanes will be closed from Atlantic Ave to Cadman Plaza West, and the northbound/eastbound BQE will be fully closed between Cadman Plaza West and the Sands Street entrance. These closures will occur overnight from 1 AM to 6 AM Saturday, 6/14, from 2 AM to 7 AM Sunday, 6/15, and from 12:01 AM to 4 AM Monday, 6/16. During these times, the Hamilton Ave and Atlantic Ave entrances to the northbound/eastbound BQE will also be closed. Consider alternate routes. For more information, please visit: http://www.nyc.gov/html/dot/html/home/home.shtml.

Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses, as well as other drainage areas and low lying spots. Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. Move to higher ground. For the latest information visit: http://www.weather.gov/nyc.

notification_title: 70th Anniversary of D-Day: Helicopter Flyover, Rose Petal Release, and 21-Gun Salute - 6/6/14 (BK, MN, SI)
email_body: Notification issued 6/5/14 at 7:50 PM. To commemorate the 70th Anniversary of D-Day, an organization called The French Will Never Forget will conduct a helicopter flyover and ceremonial release of one million rose petals (weather permitting) over the Statue of Liberty tomorrow, Friday, June 6, between 11:30 AM  12 PM. The activity will consist of two (2) AS365 helicopters (photo attached) executing the petal release and one (1) additional helicopter for filming at an altitude of approximately 100 feet above the statue. This event is expected to last approximately 5-7 minutes. In addition, the French Naval Frigate Lafayette (photo attached) will participate by positioning itself adjacent to the Statue of Liberty in the Hudson River from 10 AM  2 PM. A 21-gun salute will be conducted at approximately 12 PM.  The U.S. Coast Guard will provide a safety zone in the Hudson River for the aviation activity and the positioning of the frigate.    Photo: http://bit.ly/1i720xp

notification_title: Joint Emergency Response Drill - Lenox Hill HealthPlex and NewYork-Presbyterian/Lower Manhattan Hospital (MN) - 5/23
email_body: Notification issued 5/22/14 at 7:35 PM. On Friday, 5/23, Lenox Hill HealthPlex and NewYork-Presbyterian/Lower Manhattan Hospital will perform an emergency response drill from 11:00 AM to approximately 2:00 PM. Doctors, nurses, EMS personnel and students will train in emergency management and healthcare response using simulated patients and mannequins. During this exercise, Lenox Hill HealthPlex, located at 30 Seventh Avenue in Manhattan, will receive twelve patients with simulated injuries. Twelve other patients will arrive at the HealthPlex and then be transferred to NewYork-Presbyterian/Lower Manhattan Hospital, located at 83 Gold Street. Other agencies involved in the drill include the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA), Fire Department of New York, Greater NY Hospital Association, NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene, NYC Office of Emergency Management, New York City Police Department, NY State Department of Health, and Tribeca Community Emergency Response Team.
