The demonstration will consist of all helicopters landing in the area of the park's administrative building and parking lot.    For more information, please see the attached photos or visit: http://www.fleetweeknewyork.com/.

notification_title: Lenox Hill HealthPlex Drill - ZIP Code 10011 (MN) - 5/23/14
email_body: Notification issued 5/22/14 at 3:00 PM. On Friday, May 23, the Lenox Hill Healthplex will be conducting a disaster drill at the future site of its Emergency Medical Center. The building is located at 30 Seventh Avenue between West 12th and West 13th Streets in Manhattan. The drill will include actors and mannequins dressed as if they have been injured, ambulances arriving to the scene and departing with 'injured patients,' a decontamination tent, and staff dressed in decontamination gear. Staff will be treating patients and loading them into and out of ambulances. This will take place at the driveway on West 12th Street between 7th Avenue and Greenwich Avenue.    The drill is scheduled to begin at 11:00 AM and end at approximately 2:00 PM. With the exception of the ambulances arriving and leaving, all of the drill will take place on-site at the HealthPlex.  The loading bay and driveway for the HealthPlex are visible from the street.

notification_title: Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert - Marino Biordi - W/M/81 (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 5/21/14 at 2:30 AM. The New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for Marino Biordi, male, white, 81 years of age, from West Hempstead, NY. Mr. Biordi suffers from dementia and insulin dependent diabetes. He is described as 5'5', 180 lbs., with white hair and hazel eyes. He was last seen driving a 2001 Toyota Tacoma with New York registration GLY-5471 in West Hempstead, NY at 1:00 PM on Tuesday May 20. Mr. Biordi was wearing a light gray short sleeve shirt, dark gray pants, a News12 baseball cap and construction boots. He may appear lost or confused and may be in need of medical attention. A photo is attached. If you see Mr. Biordi, please call the NY State Police at 1-914-277-3651 or 9-1-1.

email_body: Missing Child Alert issued 5/18/14 at 1:48 PM.  The New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services has just issued a Missing Child Alert for the disappearance of Eliceo Cortez, a 14 year old male Hispanic child with autism. He was last seen in the area of Shore Parkway and Voorhies Avenue in Brooklyn on Friday 5/16/14 at approximately 2:30pm. Eliceo has burn marks on his hands and was wearing blue jeans, a black t-shirt, black high top Converse sneakers and a gray hooded sweatshirt. He is 6'1', 135lbs with brown eyes and black hair. Eliceo is known to frequent the Coney Island area. A photo is attached. If seen, please call 9-1-1.

notification_title: Flyover, Parachute Jump, & Film Shoot over Hudson River on 5/17/14 (MN)
email_body: Notification issued 5/16/14 at 4:00 PM. The Red Bull Air Force Dive Team will conduct a film shoot (weather permitting) over the Hudson River near Governors Island and Battery Park City, Manhattan on Saturday, May 17th, between 6 AM and 9 AM.  If postponed due to inclement weather, this activity will be held on Sunday, May 18th, during the same time frame. The event will consist of five (5) members of the dive team exiting one (1) Cessna 208 aircraft (photo attached) at an altitude of approximately 7,500 feet, and landing on a barge situated on the Hudson River (just north of Battery Park Citys North Cove Marina), while being filmed by an AS355 Helicopter (photo attached). The U.S. Coast Guard will provide a safety zone in the river for this activity.    The sender included the following attachment:   https://phx-attachments.sendwordnow.com/Attachments.aspx?token=59d3f94b-c867-48e9-b226-19ff1b1d3e46.

NYPD has issued a Silver Alert for the disappearance of Benigno Gonzalez, male, Hispanic, 75 years of age, from Tiebout Avenue and East 184th Street in the Bronx. Mr. Gonzalez is 5'7' and weighs 160 pounds. Mr. Gonzalez is described as bald with a medium complexion and was last seen wearing a black Yankee baseball hat, yellow t-shirt, black pants, and brown shoes. He wears glasses. Mr. Gonzalez was last seen at his residence at approximately 2:00 PM on 5/13/14 and was reportedly going to a hardware store on Kingsbridge Road in the Bronx. A photo of Mr. Gonzalez is attached. If you see Mr. Gonzalez or have any information regarding his whereabouts, please call 911.

Mr. Canatini suffers from schizophrenia and depression, and is described as light skinned, with black hair, and a salt and pepper goatee. Mr. Canatini's left leg has been amputated below the knee and he uses a wheelchair. He was last seen on 5/13/14 at 1:45 PM inside Tony's Restaurant located at 1 City Island Avenue in The Bronx. He was wearing a navy blue sweater and long pants. A photo is attached. If you see Mr. Canatini, please call 9-1-1. notification_title: Department of Sanitation Bulky Debris Removal Guidelines - 5/8/14 (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 5/8/14 at 6:30 PM. The NYC Dept. of Sanitation (DSNY) has been removing non-commercial waste from homeowners engaged in small repairs due to last week's flooding. Homeowners undertaking large demolition/reconstruction projects must arrange for their own dumpster by contacting a private rubbish removal service.    Small quantities of construction/demolition debris will continue to be picked up by DSNY on scheduled collection days, provided it is properly bundled. Wood may not be more than four feet long and must be tied up securely. DSNY crews will pick up a maximum of ten bulky items per home.    Bulky construction debris generated by hired contractors or fee-for-service personnel on home repair or renovation projects is considered commercial waste and it is the responsibility of the contractor to arrange for appropriate private disposal.    For additional information on DSNY refuse collection, please call 311 or visit http://www.nyc.gov/sanitation.

notification_title: Report Storm and Flood Damage to 311 (CW) - 5/1/14
email_body: Notification issued 5/1/14 at 12:30 PM. The New York City Office of Emergency Management encourages New Yorkers affected by yesterdays storm to report damage to their homes and businesses to 311. This data will be collected, mapped, and used to assess the damage in areas affected by the April 30 rainstorm and subsequent flooding. The City must meet certain damage thresholds to qualify for federal disaster assistance programs. Information reported to 311, either by phone or online (nyc.gov/311), about damage to homes and businesses will not be used for any purpose other than assisting OEM in developing a more accurate assessment of the impact from the storm and flooding.

On Monday, April 28, the filming of a TV show will involve a simulated explosion on private property near 29th Street between 47th Avenue and 49th Avenue in  Long Island City, Queens. The stunt will occur once between 10 AM and 12 PM. FDNY will be on site.

notification_title: Planned Weekend Road Closures in ZIP Code 11201: 4/26 to 4/27 (BK)
email_body: Notification issued 4/24/14 at 7:50 PM. In support of the Urban Post-Disaster Housing Prototype project sponsored by the NYC Office of Emergency Management, a number of minor road closures will be in effect this weekend. Red Cross Place, Cadman Plaza East, and a small section of Adams Street near the High Street subway station will be closed from Saturday, April 26th at 6:00 AM until Sunday, April 27th at 7:00 PM. Consider alternate routes and be aware of parking restrictions in the area. For additional information, please visit http://www.nyc.gov/whatifnyc.

Notification issued 4/24/14 at 6:50 PM. Emergency personnel are on the scene of a three alarm brush fire near the West Shore Expressway and Wild Ave in Staten Island. Expect smoke and traffic delays in the area.

notification_title: NYPD Activity near the Staten Island Mall (SI)
email_body: Notification issued 4/24/14 at 6:05 PM. Due to law enforcement activity near the Staten Island Mall, expect traffic delays and an increased presence of emergency personnel at Marsh Ave and Ring Road in Staten Island.

Notification issued 4/24/14 at 3:00 PM. As part of a Community Emergency Response Team (CERT) training class, there will be a controlled fire outside of 101-01 Rockaway Boulevard in Queens tonight from 6:30 PM to 9:30 PM. Expect to see FDNY and NYPD personnel in action. To learn more about CERT, visit http://www.NYC.gov/CERT.

notification_title: School Relocation - Legacy School to Health Professions & Human Svs School (MN)
email_body: Notification issued 4/24/14 at 1:00 PM. Due to a building condition (no water) staff and students of Legacy School for Integrated Studies located at 34 West 14th Street have relocated to Health Professions and Human Services located at 345 East 15th St. They will be dismissed from Health Professions.

Notification issued 4/23/14 at 11:38 PM. Following an earlier suspension, G train service has resumed in both directions between Church Avenue in Brooklyn and Court Square in Queens. Expect residual delays.

Notification issued 4/23/14 at 10:20 PM. Due to police department activity, G trains are currently suspended in both directions between Church Avenue in BK and Court Square in Queens. Consider alternate routes.

Notification issued 4/23/14 at 6:35 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Red Flag Warning for New York City and surrounding areas from 9:00 AM to 8:00 PM tomorrow, 4/24/14. A Red Flag Warning means a combination of dry brush and gusty wind conditions support fire danger. Exercise extra caution when using outdoor gas and charcoal grills. In addition, smokers should never carelessly discard cigarettes. Immediately report a brush fire to 911. For more information, visit http://1.usa.gov/1hpDJB1 or see the attached FDNY/OEM press release.

Notification issued 4/23/14 at 3:00 PM. There is also no D train service between Atlantic Avenue in Brooklyn and 2nd Avenue in Manhattan. Expect delays and consider alternate routes.

On Wednesday, April 23, the filming of a TV series will involve special effects with smoke billowing from the roof and 4th floor of a building on Review Ave between 37th Street and Laurel Hill Boulevard, Queens. The sequence will take place between 10 AM - 3 PM; no flames will be involved. FDNY and NYPD will be on site.

Notification issued 4/22/14 at 2:00 AM. NYPD has issued a Silver Alert for the disappearance of May Goldberg, female, Asian, 59 years of age, from West 69th Street and Central Park West in Manhattan. Ms. Goldberg suffers from Alzheimer's and is described as 5'6' tall, 115 lbs., with a thin build. She was last seen at her residence on West 69th Street in Manhattan at 12:30 PM on Monday, 4/21. She was wearing a light colored jacket with a hood, a black shirt, and black and white checkered pants at the time of her disappearance. A photo is attached; if you see Ms. Goldberg, please call 9-1-1.  The sender included the following attachment:   https://phx-attachments.sendwordnow.com/Attachments.aspx?token=80a91531-34b8-41b7-82d7-b5aabed1c04e

notification_title: NYS Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert - Donald Deandrea Sr. (CW)
email_body: Notification issued on 4/20/14 at 5:25 PM. At the request of the Rye Brook Police Department, a New York State Missing Vulnerable Adult notification has been issued relating to the disappearance of Donald Deandrea, male, white, age 76, from Rye Brook on April 10, 2014. He was last seen on Woodland Avenue in Rye Brook at 9:00 am and was operating a 2007 blue Nissan Sentra 4 door with NY registration FET - 9192 and is believed to possibly be heading to the NYC area. He is known to frequent parks, shopping centers, and the Play Land boardwalk area. He may been in need of medical attention. Mr. Deandrea suffers from Alzheimer's. If seen, please call Rye Brook Police Dept at 914-937-1020 or 911.  The sender included the following attachment:   https://phx-attachments.sendwordnow.com/Attachments.aspx?token=3e296a45-b1e1-44ae-81d8-3c799e88e61e

notification_title: NY State Missing Vulnerable Adult - Thomas O'Brien (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 4/18/14 at 9:30 PM. The NY State Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for Thomas O'Brien, male, white, 80 years old, from Nassau County, NY. Mr. O'Brien suffers from Alzheimer's, and is described as 6' tall, 200 lbs., with a hunched posture, wearing blue jeans, with a brown belt and black sneakers. Mr. O'Brien was operating a gray 2013 Honda CRV New York registration CSC-2672 and is known to frequent the Plainview Shopping Center, but may be in the NYC area. He may be in need of immediate medical attention. A photo is attached; if you see Mr. O'Brien, please call the Nassau County Police Dept. at 516-573-7347 or 9-1-1.    The sender included the following attachment:   https://phx-attachments.sendwordnow.com/Attachments.aspx?token=324e6a63-26a5-4345-a2e5-5217e9b6aaae.

notification_title: U.S. Small Business Administration Disaster Loan Outreach Center (DLOC) in East Harlem Closing (MN)
email_body: Notification issued 4/17/14 at 1:00 PM. US Small Business Administration (SBA) Disaster Loan Outreach Center at 108 E 116 St, MN, will close permanently at 6PM today. Those affected by the 3/12 building explosion still requiring loan assistance may call (800)659-2955, email disastercustomerservice@sba.gov, apply online at https://disasterloan.sba.gov/ela, or www.sba.gov. People who are deaf or hard-of-hearing may call (800)877-8339.    El Centro de Asistencia de Préstamos por Desastre de la Administración de la Pequeña Empres (SBA) ubicado en 108 E 116 St, MN cerrará definitivamente a las 6.00pm de hoy. Las personas afectadas por la explosión en el edificio del 12 de marzo que aún requieran asistencia pueden llamar al (800)659-2955, enviar un mensaje de correo electrónico a disastercustomerservice@sba.gov, presentar una solicitud en línea en https://disasterloan.sba.gov/ela, o visitar el sitio www.sba.gov. Las personas sordas o con problemas de audición pueden llamar al (800)877-8339.

notification_title: U.S. Small Business Administration Disaster Loan Outreach Center (DLOC) Open in East Harlem (MN)
email_body: Notification issued 4/10/14 at 2:50 PM. The US Small Business Administration has opened a Disaster Loan Outreach Center at 108 East 116 St, MN, to assist residents/businesses impacted by the March 12 building explosion with navigating the loan process. Open 4/10 until 4/17. Hours: Mon-Fri (9AM-6PM), Sat (9AM-1PM), Sun (Closed)    Notificación emitida el 10 de abril de 2014 a las 3.00pm. Representantes de la Agencia Federal para el Desarrollo de la Pequeña Empresa de los Estados Unidos abrieron un Centro de Asistencia de Préstamos por Desastre en 108 East 116th Street en Manhattan para ayudar a los residentes y a las empresas afectados por la explosión en el edificio del 12 de marzo a completar solicitudes y cursar el proceso para obtener un préstamo. El centro estará abierto a partir de hoy jueves, 10 de abril hasta el jueves, 17 de abril. El horario de atención será de 9.00am a 6.00pm los días de semana y de 9.00am a 1.00pm el sábado. El centro estará cerrado el domingo, 13 de abril.

notification_title: NYS Vulnerable Adult Alert - Israel Jardinez M/H/24 (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 4/9/14 at 12:40 AM. A New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services Missing Vulnerable Adult has been issued for Israel Jardinez, male, Hispanic, age 24. He was last seen on East 102nd Street in the area of Mount Sinai Hospital in Manhattan on Monday April 7 at 5:45 PM. Mr. Jardinez was last seen wearing a black jacket with a 'Mi-Raza' logo, tan pants, and a black and white hoody. Notification issued on 4/3/14 at 7:45 PM. The Dept of Health & Mental Hygiene reports an ongoing measles outbreak in NYC, involving Northern Manhattan, the Lower East Side and the South Bronx. Twenty-five cases of measles have been confirmed since February, consisting of 12 children & 13 adults so far.    Measles is a highly contagious infection caused by a virus. Symptoms include a rash involving your whole body & high fever, as well as cough, red eyes, & runny nose lasting 5-6 days. The illness typically begins with a rash on the face & moves down the body, may include the palms of the hands & soles of the feet. Measles can spread easily through the air to unprotected individuals. If you suspect you have measles, call your medical provider before seeking medical attention to avoid exposing others.    Make sure your children have been vaccinated against measles. The first vaccine should be at 12 months old. Learn more: http://www.nyc.gov/html/doh/html/diseases/immmea.shtml

email_body: Notification issued 3/16/14 at 1:30 PM. The Mayor's Fund to Advance New York City is accepting contributions to assist the individuals, families, and businesses affected by the building collapse that occurred at 116th Street and Park Avenue in Manhattan on Wednesday, 3/12. Those wishing to contribute or gain additional information about the Mayors Fund may visit http://www.NYC.gov/fund or call 311. Las personas que deseen colaborar u obtener más información sobre el Fondo de la Alcaldía pueden visitar http://www.NYC.gov/fund o llamar al 311.

notification_title: Resident Service Center Relocation for 3/15 & 3/16 - 1580 Park Ave (MN) (Bilingual)

For more info, please see the attached flyer.    Aviso publicado 14/3/14  a las 4:30 PM. En respuesta al edificio desplomado ubicado en 116th St. y Park Ave, Manhattan, el Mier 3/12, NYC OEM reubicará el Centro de Servicio al Residente a La Marqueta ubicada en 1580 Park Ave., Manhattan, de 9 AM a 5 PM mañana Sab 3/15 y Dom 3/16. Notification issued on 2/22/14 at 12:40 PM. The Department of Parks & Recreation (DPR) and an independent contractor will conduct an aerial survey of the deer population over various parks in The Bronx from today, Saturday, February 22, to Saturday, March 1 between the hours of 6PM-1AM, to include Pelham Bay, Van Cortlandt, and Riverdale. The survey will consist of one (1) single-engine aircraft utilizing an infrared camera to measure the temperature difference between the deer and the surrounding environment. The aircraft will originate from and return to Morristown Airport (NJ), and will conduct the survey at an altitude of approximately 1,000 feet, travelling from the eastern portion of the borough westbound. The survey will ideally be conducted in one night, weather permitting.

notification_title: Department of Buildings Snow and Ice Removal Advisory (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 2/19/14 at 2:25 PM. Due to warmer temperatures expected in the NYC area today, Wednesday, February 19, 2014 through the upcoming weekend, the Dept. of Buildings is reminding all property owners to safely remove ice and snow from roofs, overhangs and awnings. Water from melting snow that collects on roofs can present a threat to the structural integrity of a building if the accumulated weight becomes too great.     Rain and warmer temperatures can increase the threat of ice dislodging and falling from buildings. Icicles could form and pose a threat to public safety if not promptly removed. Property owners have a legal responsibility to consider the safety of their buildings, and this obligation includes removing ice that may come loose during warm weather.    Please call 311 to report non-compliant conditions or 911 to report emergencies at construction sites or buildings. Please see the attached document for additional instructions and information. bit.ly/1e7X3B7

The survey will consist of one (1) single-engine aircraft utilizing an infrared camera to measure the temperature difference between the deer and the surrounding environment. notification_title: Alternate Side Parking Suspension until Saturday, 2/15 (CW)
email_body: Notification issued on 2/12/14 at 6:15 PM. The New York City Department of Transportation, in conjunction with the Department of Sanitation, today announced that Alternate Side Parking Regulations will be suspended citywide on Thursday, Feb. 13, Friday, Feb. 14, and Saturday Feb. 15 to facilitate storm response and snow removal. There are no Alternate Side Parking Regulations in effect on Sundays, and as previously announced, Alternate Side Parking Regulations will also be suspended on Monday, Feb. 17 for Washington's Birthday/Presidents Day. Payment at parking meters will remain in effect throughout the City.

notification_title: OEM Hazardous Travel Advisory/Winter Storm Warning - 2/13 & 2/14 (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 2/12/14 at 5:40 PM. The New York City Office of Emergency Management (OEM) has issued a Hazardous Travel Advisory for Thu, 2/13, and Fri, 2/14. The National Weather Service has forecast a total of 8 to 12 inches of heavy, wet snow through Fri morning. A Winter Storm Warning will be in effect from midnight tonight until 6 AM Fri. The Dept. of Buildings is reminding property owners to de-ice public areas and safely remove snow from roofs, overhangs, and awnings. The buildup of wet snow and rain can present a threat to the structural integrity of a building. Property owners have a legal responsibility to maintain their properties in a safe condition. If ice and snow removal is not possible, property owners should rope off the unsafe area. For more information, please visit http://www.nyc.gov/severeweather & see the attached advisory.

notification_title: Resumed - Transit Disruption - 1, 2, & 3 Trains (BX, BK, MN)
email_body: Notification issued 2/11/14 at 1:40 PM. Following a previous suspension, 1, 2, and 3 train service has resumed in both directions between 96th Street and Chambers Street in Manhattan. Normal 2 train service has also resumed between 149th Street in the Bronx and Nevins Street in Brooklyn. Customers are advised to use the A, B, C, & E trains to relieve congestion. Expect extensive residual delays.

Notification issued 2/11/14 at 11:45 AM. Due to weather conditions, the Department of Parks & Recreation (DPR) and an independent contractor may continue to conduct an aerial survey of the deer population over various parks on Staten Island and in The Bronx Today, 2/11 and Wednesday, 2/12 at 6 PM, to include Van Cortlandt, Riverdale, Bronx River, Pelham Bay, Fresh Kills, Sawmill Creek, Sweetbay Magnolia Preserve, Clove Lakes, Ocean Breeze, Mariners Marsh, Wolfes Pond, Great Kills, Greenbelt, Blue Heron, Long Pond, Arden Heights, and Conference House. The survey will consist of one (1) single-engine aircraft utilizing an infrared camera to measure the temperature difference between the deer and the surrounding environment. The aircraft will originate from and return to Linden Airport (NJ), and will conduct the survey at an altitude of approximately 1,000 feet, travelling from the eastern portion of the borough westbound.

Notification issued 2/11/14 at 11:00 AM. Due to signal problems 1, 2, and 3 trains are now suspended in both directions between 96th Street and Chambers Street in Manhattan. In addition, 2 trains remain running via the 5 line from 149th Street in the Bronx and Nevins Street in Brooklyn. Expect delays and consider alternate routes. See http://www.mta.info for details.

Notification issued 2/11/14 at 10:35 AM. Due to signal problems, the 1 train is currently suspended in both directions between South Ferry and 137th Street in Manhattan. In addition, 2 trains are running via the 5 line between 149th Street in Manhattan and Nevins Street in Brooklyn. Consider alternate routes and expect extensive delays. See http://www.mta.info for details.

notification_title: Hazardous Travel Advisory/Alternate Side Parking Suspension - 2/5/14 (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 2/4/14 at 2:15 PM. The New York City Office of Emergency Management (OEM) has issued a Hazardous Travel Advisory for Wednesday, February 5. The National Weather Service has forecast 2 to 4 inches of snow and accumulation through Wednesday afternoon; Northern Manhattan and the Bronx will see accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Moderate to heavy snow is expected late Tuesday evening into Wednesday morning before changing to a wintry mix of sleet and freezing rain during the day. Up to 1/4 inch of ice may accumulate before the sleet and freezing rain converts to all rain late Wednesday afternoon. Temperatures will be in the 30s. The plow tracker will be available tomorrow at 6:00 AM at nyc.gov/severeweather. Alternate Side Parking Regulations will also be suspended citywide on Wednesday, February 5, to facilitate winter weather preparations and snow removal. Parking meters will remain in effect throughout the City. For more information, please see the attached advisory.

notification_title: UPDATE: Planned Military Aircraft Exercises over Hudson River Postponed - 1/30 (BX)
email_body: Notification issued on 1/28/14 at 7:00 PM. Update to earlier aircraft flyover notification: The U.S. Air Force has postponed the exercises originally scheduled to be conducted over the Hudson River in the Bronx and Lower Westchester on Wednesday, January 29th at 4:30am in preparation for Super Bowl XLVIII.  The exercise will now occur on Thursday, January 30th at 4:30am, and will consist of two (2) F-16 aircraft, one (1) Citation 550 aircraft and one (1) UH-60 helicopter (see attached) over the river at an altitude between approximately 5,000 and 7,000 feet.  While aircraft will not be able to be seen from the ground, they may be heard in affected areas.  The exercise is expected to last for approximately one (1) hour, as the aircraft will conclude their exercises at Farmingdale Airport (LI).    The sender included the following attachment:  https://phx-attachments.sendwordnow.com/Attachments.aspx?token=8bf022e0-b0a6-4338-848a-4101efb142d2

notification_title: Planned Military Aircraft Exercises over Hudson River - 1/29 (BX)
email_body: Notification issued on 1/28/14 at 12:00 PM. The U.S. Air Force will be conducting exercises over the Hudson River in the Bronx and Lower Westchester on Wednesday, January 29th at 4:30am in preparation for Super Bowl XLVIII.  The exercise will consist of two (2) F-16 aircraft, one (1) Citation 550 aircraft and one (1) UH-60 helicopter (see attached) over the river at an altitude between approximately 5,000 and 7,000 feet.  While aircraft will not be able to be seen from the ground, they may be heard in affected areas.  The exercise is expected to last for approximately one (1) hour, as the aircraft will conclude their exercises at Farmingdale Airport (LI).

Ms. Chambers suffers from Alzheimer's and was last seen wearing a black hat, a black coat, and blue pants in the vicinity of Flatbush Avenue and Church Avenue in Brooklyn. Ms. Chambers also wears a medical bracelet on her left wrist. A photo of the missing is attached. If you see Ms. Chambers, please call 9-1-1. notification_title: Road Closures - Super Bowl Boulevard - 1/26/14 to 2/2/14 (MN)
email_body: Notification issued 1/25/14 at 11:00 AM. In support of Super Bowl XLVIII (48), New York City is hosting 'Super Bowl Boulevard,' a week-long closure of Broadway between West 34th Street and West 47th Street in Manhattan, from Sunday 1/26 to Sunday 2/2. All cross streets will remain open for the duration of this event with the exception of West 41st Street between 6th Avenue and 7th Avenue, which will be closed daily from 9 AM to midnight. Expect detours and an increased presence of emergency personnel in the area.  Travelers to/from Times Square should consider alternate routes and use of public transportation. For more information/maps, visit: http://www.nycgo.com/articles/super-bowl-boulevard.

notification_title: Planned Military Flyover of Yankee Stadium (BX) - 1/26/14
email_body: Notification issued on 1/24/14 at 3:00 PM. The National Hockey League has coordinated a military flyover of Yankee Stadium in The Bronx on Sunday, January 26th at 1:00 PM in advance of the outdoor hockey game (New York Rangers vs. New Jersey Devils). The flyover will consist of two (2) L-39 aircraft (see attached photo) passing over the stadium via the Long Island Sound at an altitude of approximately 1,500 feet.  Aircraft will depart from and return to Lehigh Valley International Airport in Allentown, PA. The aircraft will maintain communications with LaGuardia Airport throughout the activity.    The sender included the following attachment:  https://phx-attachments.sendwordnow.com/Attachments.aspx?token=ef6f2145-59cd-4838-8c40-05237ea82722.

Notification issued 1/21/14 at 5:55 PM. The Metropolitan Transportation Authority (MTA) announced today that its regional railroads  Metro-North and the Long Island Rail Road  are reducing service after 8 PM tonight as snow accumulations make operating trains difficult. This is aimed at preventing trains from becoming stranded in accumulated snow, and to allow personnel to concentrate resources on trains that will continue to operate. The LIRR will reduce service on a branch-by-branch basis, consistent with its policy to curtail or suspend service if snow accumulations reach 10-13 inches. During rush hour, Metro-North will run a regular outbound evening rush hour schedule; however, service will be reduced after 8 PM. Customers who must travel should leave as early as possible and monitor http://www.mta.info for service status updates.

notification_title: NYC DOE Press Release: After School and PSAL Activities Cancelled Today, 1/21/14 (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 1/21/14 at 1:00 PM. From New York City Department of Education: Due to anticipated inclement weather conditions, after school programs and PSAL activities are cancelled today, Tuesday, January 21, 2014.  No other changes to the school schedule are being made at this time. Since severe cold weather and snow are expected to make roads slippery, we urge New Yorkers to exercise caution when traveling to and from schools. Safety is a top priority for the Department.

Notification issued 1/21/14 at 12:18 PM. Alternate side parking (street cleaning) regulations will remain suspended Wednesday, January 22, 2014, to facilitate snow removal. All other regulations, including parking meters, remain in effect.

Notification issued 1/21/14 at 9:47 AM. The NYC Office of Emergency Management (OEM) has issued a Hazardous Travel Advisory for today (Tuesday) and Wednesday due to anticipated weather conditions that will result in wet, slick sidewalks. Roadways could quickly turn icy. The National Weather Service has forecasted 8 to 12 inches of snow accumulation through Wednesday. Dangerously cold temperatures expected through Friday. Residents should drive slowly, monitor weather and traffic, use major streets or highways, and keep the name and number of at least one local towing service. Pedestrians should avoid slippery surfaces, dress in layers, and maintain a heightened awareness of cars, especially when crossing intersections. Please review the complete Hazardous Travel Advisory attached for additional details about the impending storm and precautions to take.

notification_title: FDNY Street Alarm Box Outage - 9-1-1 Tapping Protocol (MN)
email_body: Alert issued 1/14/14 at 5:30 PM. Due to the infrastructure failure affecting all Manhattan street alarm boxes, people who are deaf or hard-of-hearing should use the '9-1-1 Tapping Protocol,' from a land line (dial 9-1-1, wait four seconds, then repeatedly single-tap on mouthpiece of telephone for Police assistance; repeatedly double-tap for Fire/Medical assistance). For more info please visit: http://www.nyc.gov/html/mopd/downloads/pdf/emergency.pdf.

Alert issued 1/14/14 at 4:00 PM. Due to an infrastructure failure, all street fire alarm boxes in Manhattan are currently out of service. Verizon is currently working to repair the problem. Until further notice, please dial 9-1-1 to report all emergencies.

notification_title: NYC OEM Extreme Cold Weather Notice (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 1/6/14 at 8:10 PM. As temperatures are expected to drop well below freezing tonight & tomorrow, the NYC OEM reminds all New Yorkers that prolonged exposure to extreme cold weather can be deadly. The NWS is forecasting bitterly cold wind chills tonight, with overnight low temperatures between 5-8 degrees & wind chills of -15 degrees. Cold temperatures will continue on Tue with a high of 10 degrees & wind chills near -10 degrees. Overnight temperatures on Tue night will near 5 degrees with wind chills of -10 degrees. Temperatures will remain below freezing until Thurs, 1/9. Vulnerable populations, such as seniors & infants, are most at risk during extreme weather events. Check on friends, family and neighbors if you think they need help getting to a warm place. The NYC DOHMH encourages everyone to stay indoors as much as possible during this time period, & if your home lacks heat, get to a warm, safe place immediately. Report loss of heat or hot water to 311.

Notification issued on 1/6/14 at 4:35PM. With extreme cold conditions forecast to impact the Northeast, Amtrak will operate a modified schedule on the Northeast Corridor between Washington and Boston, as well as the Empire Line between New York City and Albany on Tuesday, Jan. 7, 2014.  For more information, visit http://www.amtrak.com/service-alerts-and-notices

Mrs. Antoine was last seen at her residence on December 31, 2013 at approximately 1:00 PM. She is described as 5'5' tall, 140 pounds, with black hair, and was last seen wearing a green sweater, a blue hat, black shoes, and carrying a black bag. She speaks French Creole and reportedly went missing while traveling to visit family in White Plains via public transportation. Two photos of the missing are attached. If you see Mrs. Antoine, please call 911.

notification_title: Freezing Temperature Awareness / Check on Your Neighbors (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 1/2/14 at 10:35 PM. The National Weather Service is forecasting dangerously cold temperatures and wind chills tonight through Saturday morning. These conditions are dangerous to health and can worsen pre-existing medical conditions. Limit your time outdoors and dress in layers. Be sure to check on neighbors, particularly the elderly and medically frail. Report loss of heat/hot water, and un-domiciled individuals in need of sheltering and/or assistance by calling 3-1-1.    Avoid carbon monoxide poisoning by clearing snow from exhaust pipes before starting car engines, avoid running cars in enclosed spaces, and clear snow from the vents of combustion appliances. Also, remove flammable items such as clothing from heat sources and space heaters. Never heat your home with a stove or oven, and do not use kerosene or oil-burning heaters indoors. For more information visit http://www.nyc.gov/severeweather.    For more information, please see the attached press release.

Notification issued on 1/1/14 at 10:15 PM. Con Edison is responding to a power outage in ZIP codes 10304 and 10305 in Staten Island. To report a loss of electric service, contact Con Edison at 1-800-75-CONED(26633) or online at http://www.coned.com.

notification_title: Winter Weather Warning / Hazardous Travel Advisory / Alt. Side Parking Rules Suspended (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 1/1/14 at 8:00 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Winter Storm Warning citywide from 6:00 PM Thu, Jan. 2 to 1:00 PM Fri Jan. 3. The current forecast calls for 6-8 inches of snow accompanied by strong winds. The NYC Office of Emergency Management (OEM) today issued a Hazardous Travel Advisory for Thu and Fri due to anticipated weather conditions that will result in wet, slick sidewalks; roadways could quickly turn icy. Residents should drive slowly, monitor weather and traffic, use major streets or highways, and keep the name and number of at least one local towing service. Pedestrians should avoid slippery surfaces, dress in layers, and maintain a heightened awareness of cars, especially when crossing intersections. Please note that the NYC Dept of Transportation, in conjunction with the Dept of Sanitation, will suspended Alternate Side Parking Regulations citywide tomorrow, Thu, Jan. 2, 2014, to facilitate snow preparations.

Silver Alert issued 1/1/14 at 1:00AM. NYPD has issued a Silver Alert for the disappearance of Miguel Martinez, male, Hispanic, 90 years of age, from Woodbine Street and Cypress Avenue in Queens. Mr. Martinez is described as 5' tall, 140 lbs., with grey hair, last seen on 12/31/13 at 11:30 AM at 67th Avenue and Queens Boulevard in Queens. Mr. Martinez is wearing a yellow polo, yellow plaid shorts, and black sandals. He suffers from schizophrenia and Alzheimers. A photo is attached. If you see Mr. Martinez, please call 9-1-1. notification_title: Ed Koch Queensboro Bridge Permanent Lane Closure (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 12/24/13 at 4:15 PM. The New York City Department of Transportation (DOT) and New York City Police Department (NYPD) today announced that the single lane of Queens-bound outer roadway of the Ed Koch Queensboro Bridge will be closed to vehicular traffic from 9 PM through 6 AM each day, reducing the potential for speeding and other unsafe nighttime driving when the lane is underused, while providing sufficient capacity for traffic volumes on the inner and upper roadways at all times of the day. Taking effect at 9 PM on Monday, December 30, the nightly closure follows a review of existing safety measures, traffic volumes and travel speeds following the recent deadly crash at the Queens end of the outer roadway. For more information, please see the attached notice or visit http://www.nyc.gov/dot.     The sender included the following attachment:  https://phx-attachments.sendwordnow.com/Attachments.aspx?token=d4c5d0b3-edcf-4700-b842-c17e34aab44f.

notification_title: Update - Delays on the George Washington Bridge 12/20 to 12/23 (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 12/20/13 at 9:35 PM. Update: The Port Authority of New York & New Jersey will close three of the four upper level lanes of the George Washington Bridge during the following dates & times: eastbound from 10 PM tonight until 10 AM tomorrow 12/21, in BOTH directions from 10 PM Saturday night 12/21 through 10 AM Sunday 12/22, and westbound from 9 PM Sunday night 12/22 through 5 AM Monday 12/23. Motorists traveling across the Hudson River in either direction during these times should consider alternate routes such as the Lincoln or Holland Tunnel, or use the lower level of the George Washington Bridge. Significant delays are expected during all weekend closures.

notification_title: NY State Missing Vulnerable Adult - Horst Heiner M/W/86 (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 12/20/13 at 5:40 PM. NY State Police have issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for Horst Heiner, male, white, 86 years of age, from Nassau County, NY. He has early onset dementia and may be in need of immediate medical attention. He was last seen leaving a dentist appointment today at 10:30 AM, driving a 2006 gray Honda Odyssey with New York registration CCS3063. He is described as 5'7' tall, 160 lbs., with gray hair, last seen wearing tan pants, a tan jacket, a tan shirt, and black sneakers. Mr. Heiner may have traveled to Amityville, New York. A photo is attached. If you see Mr. Heiner, please call the Nassau County Police Department at (516) 573-7347 or 9-1-1.    The sender included the following attachment:  https://phx-attachments.sendwordnow.com/Attachments.aspx?token=9f1e40fd-8e7a-4c55-af07-13ea02e0dc6d

notification_title: Travel Advisory/Alternate Side Parking Suspension for 12/14/13 (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 12/13/13 at 6:00 PM. The New York City Office of Emergency Management (OEM) today issued a Hazardous Travel Advisory for Saturday, 12/14. The National Weather Service has forecast 4 to 6 inches of snow accumulation, expected to begin midday Saturday and change to rain in the late evening as the temperature rises. Rain will taper off overnight Saturday into Sunday, with a lingering shower possible Sunday morning, and freezing temperatures returning Sunday night. The Department of Sanitation has also issued a Snow Alert for Saturday at 8 AM. The plow tracker will be available tomorrow at http://www.nyc.gov/severeweather. The New York City Department of Transportation, in conjunction with the Department of Sanitation, has suspended Alternate Side Parking Regulations citywide tomorrow, to facilitate snow removal. Payment at parking meters will remain in effect. OEM encourages New Yorkers to take the precautions if traveling. For more information see the attached notice.

notification_title: Blue Angels Aircraft Fly-Over - 12/13/13 (BK, MN, SI)
email_body: Notification issued on 12/12/13 at 2:20 PM. Tomorrow, Friday, 12/13/13, seven F/A-18 Hornet aircraft piloted by the U.S. Navy Blue Angels flight demonstration squadron will fly over the Hudson River to take promotional photos in front of One World Trade Center. Six aircraft will fly in formation and one will take photos. The flight will depart from Teterboro Airport in New Jersey at approximately 1:15 PM and will consist of three passes over the Hudson River heading south, then north, and south again at a height of approximately 1,000 feet. A photo of the aircraft flying in formation is attached.    The sender included the following attachment:  https://phx-attachments.sendwordnow.com/Attachments.aspx?token=194309e6-420d-4101-b6f3-8412b0ad097e

Notification issued 12/10/13 at 5:45 PM. The New York City Office of Emergency Management (OEM) today issued a Travel Advisory for the Tuesday evening and Wednesday morning rushes. The National Weather Service forecasts freezing temperatures this evening; wet, slick sidewalks and roadways could quickly turn icy. Overnight temperatures will drop into the teens. Wednesday highs are not expected to go above the mid to low 20s. Temperatures are expected to remain below freezing until Saturday 12/14. OEM encourages New Yorkers to drive slowly, monitor weather and traffic reports, use major streets or highways, and keep the name and number of at least one local towing service. Pedestrians should avoid slippery surfaces, dress in layers, and maintain a heightened awareness of cars, especially when crossing intersections.

notification_title: Missing Child Alert - Nijaey Hilton, F/B/5 (CW)
email_body: Alert issued on 12/4/13 at 11:52 AM. A New York State Missing Child Alert has been issued for the disappearance of Nijaey Hilton, age 5, from Manhattan. Nijaey was last seen leaving her residence with her uncle, Ramel Robinson, on Tuesday, 12/3/13, at approximately 10:30 PM. Ramel Robinson is a 29-year-old male from Jamaica, Queens. The two may have left the location in a vehicle, but their destination is unknown. Nijaey was last seen wearing a grey school uniform consisting of grey stockings, a peach-colored sweater, a white blouse and a blue jacket with brown fur on the collar. Anyone with information regarding this missing child is asked to call the NYPD's Crime Stoppers Hotline at 800-577-TIPS. The public can also submit their tips by logging onto the Crime Stoppers website at www.NYPDCRIMESTOPPERS.com or texting their tips to 274637(CRIMES) then entering TIP577. Press release/photo: http://bit.ly/INwTvX

Silver Alert issued on 11/24/13 at 2:30 PM. NYPD has issued a Silver Alert for the disappearance of Enrique Santana-Rios, male, Hispanic, 82 years old, from 14th Street and 4th Avenue in Brooklyn. Mr. Santana-Rios was last seen in his residence yesterday, Saturday, 11/23/13, at approximately 9:30 PM. He is described as 5'6' tall, 145 pounds, with white hair, and was last seen wearing a black jacket, tan pants, a black baseball cap, glasses, and black sneakers. Mr. Santana-Rios suffers from Alzheimer's. A photo is attached. If you see Mr. Santana-Rios or have any information regarding his whereabouts, please call 9-1-1.

Notification issued 11/23/13 at 6:00 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Red Flag Warning for NYC and surrounding areas from 10 AM to 6 PM tomorrow, 11/24/13. A Red Flag Warning means a combination of dry brush and gusty wind conditions support fire danger. Exercise extra caution when using outdoor gas and charcoal grills. In addition, smokers should never carelessly discard cigarettes. Immediately report a brush fire to 911. For more information, visit http://www.erh.noaa.gov/er/okx/.

notification_title: Scheduled Patient Relocation - Roosevelt Island to Harlem (MN)
email_body: Notification issued 11/23/13 at 4:00 PM. There will be a planned relocation of patients from Coler-Goldwater Hospital on Roosevelt Island to the new Henry J. Carter Specialty Hospital and Nursing Facility at Park Avenue and East 122nd Street in Manhattan. The transfer will take place on Sunday, November 24, 2013 from 4:00 AM to 6:00 PM and on Monday, November 25, 2013 from 8:00 AM to 7:00 PM. During these times, residents can expect increased ambulance traffic. NYPD and Roosevelt Island Public Safety will be assisting with traffic management. There may be minor traffic delays in the area.

notification_title: Planned Closure of MN-Bound BK Bridge - 11/23/13 to 11/25/13 (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 11/22/13 at 12:48 PM. For more information, please visit http://www.nyc.gov/html/dot/html/motorist/wkndtraf.shtml

Alert issued 11/21/13 at 4:39 AM. NYPD has issued a Silver Alert for the disappearance of Susana Fischer, female, white, 82 years of age, from 71st Road and 136th Street in Queens. Ms. Fischer is described as 5' tall, 100 lbs., with brown eyes and gray curly hair. She was last seen on Wednesday, November 20th at 8:30 AM. She was wearing a black overcoat with a fur trimmed hood, a blue knit cap, gray sneakers, black skirt and carrying a beige purse and a black cane with a green design on it. Ms. Fischer suffers from dementia, schizophrenia and Parkinson's disease. A photo is attached. If you see Ms. Fischer, please call 9-1-1. email_body: Notification issued 11/16/13 at 3:55 PM. NYPD has issued a Missing Senior Notification for Arturo Ortiz, male, Hispanic, 71 years old, from East 139th St and Cypress Ave in The Bronx. Mr. Ortiz was last seen on 11/15/13 at midnight near Madison Square Garden in Manhattan. He is described as 5'7' tall, 170 lbs., with brown eyes, salt and pepper hair, wearing black pants and a black jacket. A photo is attached. The exercise will be conducted between the hours of 6:00 AM and 10:00 AM. notification_title: Planned Closure of the MN-Bound BK Bridge - 11/9/13 to 11/11/13 (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 11/8/13 at 12:00 PM. Starting at 7:00PM on Friday November 8 until 6 AM Monday November 11, the Brooklyn Bridge will be closed to inbound/westbound traffic. Motorists proceeding inbound/northbound from south Brooklyn via the Belt Parkway and Gowanus Expressway should use 3rd Avenue/Hamilton Avenue into the toll facility Hugh L. Carey (formerly Brooklyn Battery) Tunnel as the best route into lower Manhattan. Motorists proceeding inbound/westbound from Queens/Long Island should consider the Williamsburg Bridge, or the toll facilities at the Robert F Kennedy Bridge or Queens Midtown Tunnel, for best route into Manhattan. Throughout this closure the Manhattan Bridge will accommodate 5 lanes of traffic inbound/westbound and two lanes outbound/eastbound. For more information please visit http://www.nyc.gov/dot.

notification_title: NY State Missing Vulnerable Adult - Brian Cronin M/W/31 (CW)
email_body: Alert issued 11/7/13 at 9:10 PM. A NY State DCJS Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert has been issued for Brian Cronin, male, white, age 31, 6'1' 260 lbs, from Southeast, New York. Mr. Cronin is schizophrenic, bi-polar and suicidal. He was last seen at the Putnam Hospital Center in Southeast, New York on November 7, 2013 at 3:30 PM. He has a wolf tattoo on his right shoulder and was wearing a dark zip up hoodie with a green and orange logo, dark blue sweat pants with a white stripe and dark blue sneakers. A photo is attached. If you have any information regarding this alert, please contact the Putnam County Sheriff's office at 845-225-4300 or call 9-1-1.    The sender included the following attachment:  https://phx-attachments.sendwordnow.com/Attachments.aspx?token=41d474b5-3853-4c27-a251-8f2caee46db6

notification_title: Road Closures for 2013 ING NYC Marathon - 11/3/13 (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 11/1/13 at 3:00 PM. Numerous bridge and street closures will be in effect citywide from 12:00 AM to 7:00 PM on Sunday, 11/3/13, in support of the 2013 ING New York City Marathon, including the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge. For further information visit: http://www.ingnycmarathon.org/entrantinfo/essentials.htm#en-closures. Also see the attached map of the event route and full list of road closures. For help finding an alternate route, call 511 or visit http://www.511NY.org. For other marathon-related roadway closures throughout the city, call the NYC hotline at 311.    The sender included the following attachments:  https://phx-attachments.sendwordnow.com/Attachments.aspx?token=c9e1fb81-9e07-496d-8877-6888ada2bcc7  https://phx-attachments.sendwordnow.com/Attachments.aspx?token=f8163b37-a0c7-4c2f-8972-b6aee4dc1d81

notification_title: Missing Child Alert - Robert Richard - M/B/14 (CW)
email_body: Alert issued 10/30/13 at 10:40 PM. Yonkers Police Department has issued a Missing Child Alert for the disappearance of Robert Richard, male, black, 14 years old, with autism, from Yonkers, NY. He was last seen on Abeel Street in Yonkers at approximately 4:20 PM today. Robert may be riding a blue mountain bike and is known to frequent 231st Street in the Bronx. He is described as 5'07' tall, 170 pounds, with black hair and brown eyes. Robert was last seen wearing a green jacket and blue jeans. He is known to frequent McDonalds, IHOP, and KFC. Robert may be in need of medical attention. The official notification from the New York State Missing Persons Clearinghouse is attached. If you see Robert, please call 1-914-377-7900 or 9-1-1.

Crews are working to resolve the issue and restore service. Passengers who have paid but choose not to travel due to this service disruption can receive a refund or a voucher for future travel. Some reservations booked online can be modified or canceled on Amtrak.com or by using the free Amtrak mobile app. To be notified of major service disruptions resulting in delays of 60 minutes or more to multiple trains on the Northeast Corridor, follow @AmtrakNEC on Twitter. Passengers are encouraged to call 800-USA-RAIL or visit Amtrak.com/alerts for service alerts and passenger notices. Schedule information and train status updates are available at the Amtrak.com home page.

notification_title: Planned Closure of MN-Bound BK Bridge 10/26/13 - 10/28/13 (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 10/25/13 at 4:00 PM. As part of the ongoing New York City Department of Transportation (DOT) project to rehabilitate the Brooklyn Bridge, a full closure of the Manhattan-bound lanes of the bridge will be required this weekend, from 12:01 AM Saturday, 10/26 until 6:00 AM Monday, 10/28. During this 54-hour closure, all Manhattan-bound traffic will be redirected to alternate crossings, including the Manhattan Bridge, Williamsburg Bridge and the Brooklyn-Battery Tunnel, an MTA-tolled facility. Brooklyn-bound traffic will continue normally. The span's pedestrian path, bike path and pedestrian staircase at Frankfort Street in Manhattan will also remain open. As with recent, related closures of the bridge during this project, motorists are urged to avoid the area if possible and consider alternate routes. For more information, please see the attached document of visit http://www.nyc.gov/dot.

Please note that the launch will only take place on approximately three (3) or four (4) days during the allowable window (two hours/day during daylight hours).  The balloon will be flown at an altitude of approximately 950 feet and is approximately the size of a common weather balloon.

email_body: Notification issued 10/11/13 at 11:14 AM. From 12:01 AM Saturday, 10/12 until 6 AM Monday, 10/14 the Brooklyn Bridge will be closed to inbound/westbound traffic. Motorists proceeding inbound/northbound from south Brooklyn via the Belt Pkwy and Gowanus Expwy should use 3rd Ave/Hamilton Ave into the toll facility Hugh L. Carey (formerly Brooklyn Battery) Tunnel as the best route into lower Manhattan. Motorists proceeding inbound/westbound from Queens/Long Island should consider the Williamsburg Bridge, or the toll facilities at the Robert F Kennedy Bridge or Queens Midtown Tunnel, for the best route into Manhattan. Additionally, the northbound/eastbound  Brooklyn Queens Expwy will be closed between Hamilton Ave and Cadman Plaza West during limited overnight hours on Saturday 10/12, Sunday 10/13, and Monday 10/14. For more details, please visit http://ow.ly/pILbt

notification_title: Update for 10/5/13 - Metro-North Railroad New Haven Line Restoration (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 10/5/13 at 3:30 PM. MTA Metro-North Railroad announced today that full train service on the New Haven Line will resume Monday morning, October 7, following successful tests of a new electrical substation in Mount Vernon. For the remainder of this weekend, Metro-North will provide about 70% of normal New Haven Line service. For more information, please visit http://www.mta.info.

Notification issued 10/5/13 at 12:00 PM. Multiple street closures will be in effect citywide on Sunday, October 6th, 2013, from 7:30 AM to 6:30 PM, in support of the 2013 MS Bike Tour, including sections of Holland Tunnel (MN), George Washington Bridge (MN), Battery Park Underpass to the northbound FDR Drive/Harlem River Drive (MN), Henry Hudson Parkway (MN/BX) and Mosholu Parkway (BX). For more information, please visit http://bikenyn.nationalmssociety.org/site/TR?fr_id=21176&pg=entry or see attached route map.

notification_title: PA-NYNJ Drill on the George Washington Br - 10/5 to 10/6 (MN, BX)
email_body: Notification issued 10/5/13 at 10:00 AM. From 9 PM tonight, Saturday, 10/5/13 until 7 AM tomorrow, Sunday, 10/6/13, Port Authority of NY & NJ will conduct a full scale exercise on the George Washington Bridge simulating a fuel tanker explosion with multiple motor vehicle accidents. A large number of emergency vehicles from NJ and NYC will also be present. A full closure of the lower level of the GWB will be required in both directions during this time. However, the upper level will remain fully open in both directions during the exercise.

There will be hourly train service from all New Haven Line stations in both directions all day on Saturday and Sunday, with the exception of Metro-North's Direct New Haven Line service to the Meadowlands. Full service may be restored by Monday morning, 10/7. See full service details at http://bit.ly/S5Cxrf.

Notification issued 10/1/13 at 8:35 PM. Metro-North will operate additional trains on the New Haven Line starting Wednesday, October 2, due to an increase in power capacity to Con Edison's temporary substations. With this new schedule in place, Metro-North's capacity on the line rises to 65% of regular train service. See specific schedules at http://bit.ly/eGUVR, and service details at http://bit.ly/S5Cxrf. The interim limited solution provided by the temporary substations still does not provide full power capacity, and as a result, Metro-North still cannot operate full train service.

Mr. Rosenthal was last seen wearing red sweatpants, a black coat, and white sneakers with no socks at approximately 3:45 PM today, 9/30/13, near Court Street and Pierrepont Street in Brooklyn. He is described as 5'5' tall, 160 lbs, with gray hair and a thin build. Mr. Rosenthal wears a medical bracelet and suffers from dementia. A photo is attached. If you see Mr. Rosenthal, please call 9-1-1.

notification_title: AMBER Alert Cancellation - Avanta Perez M/H/5 (CW)
email_body: Alert issued 9/27/13 at 8:50 PM. The NY State Police have cancelled the AMBER Alert for Avanta Perez, male, Hispanic, 5 years old. For more information, please visit http://amber.ny.gov.

AMBER Alert issued 9/27/13 at 8:05 PM. NY State Police have issued an Amber Alert for the confirmed abduction of Avanta Perez, a 5 year old Hispanic male from Cortlandt, NY. Avanta Perez is described as 3'8' tall, 50 lbs., with short brown hair and brown eyes, last wearing khaki pants and an aqua shirt. The suspect, Amanda Perez, is a Hispanic female, approximately 23 years old, 5'5' tall, 135 lbs., with long brown hair and brown eyes, last seen wearing black pants, red flowered shirt and a black sweater. She is driving a gray 4-door sedan Honda Civic with NY license number DRT8361. The vehicle was last seen traveling on Route 9, possibly near the Bear Mountain area. The suspect was distraught and has threatened to harm the child and herself. A photo is attached. If either are seen, please call(866) NYS - AMBER or 9-1-1. For updates visit http://amber.ny.gov.

notification_title: Hugh L. Carey Tunnel Closure - Tunnels to Towers Run 9/29/13 (CW)
email_body: Notification issued on 9/27/13 at 12:15 PM. The Hugh L. Carey (formerly Brooklyn-Battery) Tunnel will be closed for several hours on Sunday, Sept., 29 for the annual Stephen Siller Tunnel to Towers Run. One tube will be closed 10 p.m. Sat., Sept. 28 through 3 p.m. on Sunday.  The remaining tube will carry one lane of traffic in each direction until 8 a.m., Sunday when both tubes will close for the event. Motorists are advised to use an alternate route.  For details, visit http://bit.ly/1fdjefM

The aircraft will fly south over the Hudson River for approximately 15 minutes and depart to the west back to Sky Manor Airport. Please see attached photos for aircrafts.

Avoid strenuous activity. People without air conditioning, older adults, and people with chronic health conditions are most at risk. New York City has opened cooling centers. Visit http://www.nyc.gov/oem or call 311 for cooling center locations and hours.

Notification issued 9/11/13 at 12:22 PM. The New York State Department of Environmental Conservation has issued an Air Quality Health Advisory for New York City until 11:00 PM tonight. Active children, adults, and people with lung disease, such as asthma, should reduce prolonged or heavy exertion outdoors. For more air quality information visit http://www.dec.ny.gov/

notification_title: Commemorative Flight over Statue of Liberty - Sunday 9/1/2013
email_body: Notification issued on 8/31/13 at 12:00 PM. The Air Power Museum in Farmingdale, NY, will conduct a commemorative honor flight (weather permitting) over the Statue of Liberty (Hudson River) tomorrow, on Sunday, September 1st at 1:00pm.  The honor flight will consist of six (6) historic aircraft--three (3) B-25's, one (1) P40, one (1) P47, and one (1) P51 (see attached photos)--circling over the Statue of Liberty twice.  Two (2) T6 aircraft (see attached photo) will accompany the group to photograph the activity.  The aircraft will depart from/return to Republic Airport in Farmingdale, NY. You may see low flying aircraft in the area. Please see attached photos.

notification_title: Planned Closure of the MN-Bound BK Bridge 8/24/13 to 8/25/13 (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 8/23/13 at 12:00 PM. As part of the ongoing New York City Department of Transportation (DOT) project to rehabilitate the Brooklyn Bridge, a full closure of the Manhattan-bound lanes of the bridge will be required for 36 consecutive hours this weekend, from 12:01 AM Saturday, 8/24 until 12:00 PM Sunday, 8/25. During this closure, all Manhattan-bound traffic will be redirected to alternate crossings, including the Manhattan Bridge, Williamsburg Bridge and the Brooklyn-Battery Tunnel, an MTA-tolled facility. For more information, please visit http://www.nyc.gov/dot or see the attached notice.

To reduce mosquito activity and the risk of West Nile virus, the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene (DOHMH) will spray pesticide from trucks in parts of Queens between 8:15 PM tonight, 8/5/13 and 6:00 AM the following morning, weather permitting. In case of inclement weather, application will be delayed until tomorrow, 8/6/13 during the same hours. Spray areas will include parts of Auburndale, College Point, Flushing, Linden Hills, Malba, Murray Hills and Whitestone. For sprayings, DOHMH will use a very low concentration of a synthetic pesticide, which when properly used, poses no significant risks to human health; however, DOHMH recommends minimizing direct exposure, especially for people with asthma or other respiratory conditions. For more information and maps of spray areas, please see the attached document or visit http://www.nyc.gov/html/doh/html/environmental/wnv-spray.shtml

notification_title: DOHMH Heat Warning & Request for New Yorkers to Assist (CW)
email_body: Alert issued 7/18/13 at 8:35 PM. Due to this week's dangerous and continuing heat wave, the Health Department is asking New Yorkers to assist persons at risk for the effects of heat illness. These risks increase with each passing day and the intensifying heat. City agencies and nonprofit service providers are visiting the homes of vulnerable persons, and the Health Department is asking New Yorkers to assist this effort by checking on vulnerable relatives, friends, and neighbors, and to get them into a cool place or to medical attention if they are showing signs of heat illness. Signs include hot, dry skin OR cold, clammy skin; confusion or disorientation; nausea and vomiting; trouble breathing; rapid heartbeat; weakness and dizziness. For more information, please see the attached press release.    The sender included the following attachment:  https://phx-attachments.sendwordnow.com/Attachments.aspx?token=1c989b7d-d355-4682-90f0-63438bf48b6e

notification_title: AMBER Alert Update - Mario Danner (M/H/7 months)
email_body: Alert issued 7/17/13 at 4:15 AM. Update regarding earlier AMBER Alert issued for confirmed abducted child, Mario Danner (male, Hispanic, 7 months old). Suspect Marina Lopez, a Hispanic female approximately 25 years old with brown hair and brown eyes standing 5'6' tall and weighing 130 pounds, may be driving a tan, four-door, 1995 Lexus ES300 with New York license plate GEX1377. The suspect was last seen wearing a pink t-shirt and floral print shorts traveling on foot, possibly toward Shore Front Parkway in Rockaway, NY. Anyone with any information on this abduction is asked to call the New York City Police Department at (866) NYS-AMBER or dial 911 to provide information on a report or sighting. For updated information, visit http://amber.ny.gov.

Alert issued 7/16/13 at 11:00 PM. The New York State Police have issued an AMBER Alert for the confirmed child abduction of Mario Danner, a Hispanic male, approximately 7 months old with black hair and brown eyes. He is approximately 20 inches long and weighs about 25 pounds. Mario was last seen wearing a gray t-shirt and black shorts at 2090 7th Avenue in Manhattan.  Mario is believed to have been abducted by Marina Lopez, a Hispanic female. Lopez is approximately 25 years old with brown hair and brown eyes. She is approximately 5 feet 6 inches tall and weighs about 130 pounds. The suspect was last seen wearing pink t-shirt, floral shorts.   The suspect is the child's non-custodial mother, who is bi-polar and has had recent outbreaks of violence. Anyone with any information on this abduction is asked to call the New York City Police Department at (866)NYS-AMBER or dial 911 to provide information on a report or sighting.   For the most up to date information, visit http://amber.ny.gov.

notification_title: Heat Advisory and Cooling Centers - 7/14 to 7/18 (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 7/13/13 at 5:15 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Heat Advisory for New York City from noon on Sunday 7/14 until midnight Monday night, 7/15. In addition, the heat index is expected to be near or above 95 degrees through Thursday, 7/18. These conditions are dangerous to health. Avoid strenuous activity. People without air conditioning, older adults, and people with chronic health conditions are most at risk. New York City will open cooling centers beginning tomorrow, Sunday 7/14 through Thursday 7/18. For more information on avoiding heat illness, please see the attached press release. Tomorrow, visit http://www.nyc.gov/oem or call 311 for cooling center locations and hours.

Notification issued 7/13/13 at 6:00 PM. There will be a fireworks display tomorrow, 7/14 at the Hudson River Barge by the Intrepid at approximately 9:50 PM. In case of inclement weather, the rain date will be Monday, 7/15.

The southbound lanes of the Henry Hudson Bridge will remain open; however, motorists should expect delays and consider alternate routes during this event. For more information, please see the attached press release or visit http://www.nyctri.com.

Notification issued 7/8/13 at 7:15 PM. Brookhaven National Laboratory with NYPD will begin installing air sampling equipment Tuesday morning as part of a study called Subway-Surface Air Flow Exchange. Air sampling will be conducted in parts of the Bronx, Brooklyn, Queens, Staten Island and in Manhattan. In addition, researchers will disperse low concentrations of harmless gases known as perfluorocarbons at several subway and street-level locations in Manhattan for 30 minutes only during the morning. Data from the study will help first responders to better understand how airborne contaminants can travel through the system and enable them to develop emergency responses based on the results. Please visit http://www.bnl.gov/s-safe/ for more information.

Notification issued 7/8/13 at 6:30 PM. On July 9 - 11, 2013 the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene (DOHMH) will aerially apply larvicide to key mosquito breeding areas in non-residential areas (mainly marshes and other large wetlands) of Staten Island, Queens and The Bronx to reduce the number of mosquitoes and the risk of West Nile virus. Application will be between 6AM and 7PM. In the event of inclement weather, larviciding may occur during the same hours on 7/10-7/12. A DOHMH helicopter will be used for these events. For more information: http://www.nyc.gov/html/doh/html/environmental/wnv-spray.shtml or: http://ow.ly/mHaUg

notification_title: Solar-Powered Aircraft Flight near Statue of Liberty Sat 7/6 - Sun 7/7 (BK, MN, QN, SI)
email_body: Notification issued 7/5/13 at 5:00 PM. Weather permitting, a solar powered aircraft, operated by Solar Impulse, will conduct an overnight flight from Dulles Airport in Washington, D.C. to JFK Airport, NYC this weekend. Part of this flight involves passing the Statue of Liberty for a photo shoot, accompanied by a helicopter. The aircraft is expected to arrive at the Statue of Liberty at about 11:45 PM on Saturday evening, July 6, 2013, take photos for approximately one hour, and then land at JFK Airport in Queens at 2:00 AM Sunday morning, July 7, 2013. The aircraft operates at a very slow speed of about 25 knots (29 mph). A photo of the aircraft is attached.    The sender included the following attachment:  https://phx-attachments.sendwordnow.com/Attachments.aspx?token=b4128612-0a4c-4edc-b9e0-0971d9d20da3     Or: http://bit.ly/12rymur

notification_title: FDNY Full Scale Exercise at Citi Field - 6/27/13 (QN)
email_body: Notification issued 6/27/13 at 4:15 PM. Tonight from 8:00 PM to 11:00 PM, the FDNY will conduct a full-scale exercise at Citi Field, located at 123-01 Roosevelt Avenue in Queens. Expect a heightened presence of emergency personnel in the area. This is only a drill.

Notification issued 6/26/13 at 5:35 PM. Tonight between 7:00 PM and 10:00 PM, the FDNY, in conjunction with Columbia University will conduct a Full Scale Exercise at the Manhattanville Project, at West 129th Street and Broadway in Manhattan. Expect a heightened presence of emergency personnel in the area. This is only a drill.

Alert issued 6/25/13 at 6:05 PM. Due to problems with electrical equipment, Con Edison has reduced voltage in some Brooklyn neighborhoods, including Flatbush, Prospect Lefferts Gardens, Prospect Heights, Canarsie, Flatlands, Mill Basin, Old Mill Basin, Bergen Beach and Georgetown. Con Edison has asked customers in these areas to curtail use of non-essential appliances. In addition, Con Edison has reduced voltage in Coney Island, Seagate, Brighton Beach, Manhattan Beach and Sheepshead Bay, but the company has not asked customers in these areas to conserve electricity at this time. If you lose electricity, call ConEd 1-800-75-CONED(26633). Please see attached press release for more information.    The sender included the following attachment:  https://phx-attachments.sendwordnow.com/Attachments.aspx?token=c9ac8c6a-3026-4b20-aa4c-0b4aa3eca4d6

Notification issued on 6/25/13 5:00 PM. LIPA is responding to a power outage in the Far Rockaway section of Queens. To report a loss of electric service, contact LIPA at 800-490-0075 or online at http://www.lipower.org/stormcenter/report.html.

Notification issued on 6/25/13 at 8:00 AM. The National Weather Service has issued a Heat Advisory for New York City until 6PM tonight. These conditions are dangerous to health. Avoid strenuous activity. People without air conditioning, older adults, and people with chronic health conditions are most at risk. Cooling centers will be open. For locations, hours, and more information on avoiding heat illness, visit http://www.nyc.gov/oem or call 311. In addition, the New York State Department of Environmental Conservation has issued an Air Quality Health Advisory for New York City until 11:00 PM. Active children, adults, and people with lung disease, such as asthma, should reduce prolonged or heavy exertion outdoors. For more information, visit http://www.dec.ny.gov/cfmx/extapps/aqi/aqi_forecast.cfm?CFID=783270&CFTOKEN=81338190&jsessionid=UFnIyHeNvQe7zuUU0zvXrHm

notification_title: FDNY & NYPD Drills on Roosevelt Is Tram - 6/25/13 & 6/26/13 (MN)
email_body: Notification issued 6/24/13 at 2:30 PM. Emergency personnel will conduct a drill on a Roosevelt Island Tram cabin tomorrow, 6/25/13, from 2 AM to 5 AM, and twice on Wednesday 6/26/13, from 2 AM to 5 AM, and again from 10 AM to 2 PM. As part of these exercises, FDNY or NYPD personnel may climb on top of, or rappel down a suspended tram cabin. Regular tram service will not be disrupted during drills.

The new Zones 1 through 6  which will replace Zones A, B, and C  include an additional 600,000 New Yorkers not included within the boundaries of the former zones. All New Yorkers should visit the Hurricane Evacuation Zone Finder at www.nyc.gov/hurricanezones or call 311 find out if their homes or businesses fall within the boundaries of a new City hurricane evacuation zone. email_body: Notification issued on 6/10/13 at 6:00 PM. The Department of Health will be conducting aerial larviciding via a low-flying helicopter to help prevent West Nile Virus tomorrow, 6/11 through 6/13 from 6:00 AM to 7:00 PM daily in the following zip codes: 10303, 10311, 10314, 10306, 10308, 10309, 11362, 11363, 11354, 11356, 11357, 11691, 11692, 10464, 10475. While three days are allotted for this activity, the application may be completed in less time. In the event of inclement weather, spraying may occur during the same hours thru 6/14. For more information, visit http://on.nyc.gov/106KbdY or call 311.

Due to a track condition, northbound D trains are temporarily terminating at West 4th Street. Southbound D trains are operating via the A line from 59th Street to West 4th Street, then on the F line to 2nd Avenue. Allow additional travel time. For details, visit http://www.mta.info/

Notification issued 6/8/13 at 2:30 AM. Following an earlier suspension, 3 train service has been restored between 96th Street and 148th Street in Manhattan. 1, 2, and 3 trains are operating with residual delays. http://www.mta.info

notification_title: 3 Train Suspended from 96th Street to 148th Street (MN)
email_body: Notification issued 6/7/13 at 11:05 PM. Due to flooding, the 3 train has been suspended between 96th Street and 148th Street in Manhattan. A shuttle bus is available between the 135th Street and 148th Street subway stations.

notification_title: Road Closure - Harlem River Drive between 125th Street and Dyckman Street (MN)
email_body: Notification issued 6/7/13 at 10:40 PM. Due to extensive flooding on Harlem River Drive between East 125th Street and Dyckman Street in Manhattan, expect heavy traffic in the area and consider alternate routes.

Notification issued 6/7/13 at 9:00 PM. Con Edison is responding to a power outage in The Bronx, zip codes 10464, 10469, and 10475 . To report loss of electric service, contact Con Edison at 1-800-75-CONED(26633) or online at http://www.coned.com.

Notification issued on 6/7/13 at 4:20 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Flash Flood Warning citywide until 7:15 PM. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other drainage areas and low lying spots. Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. Move to higher ground. For the latest information visit: http://www.weather.gov/nyc.

Notification issued 6/7/13 at 1:34 PM. Due to construction and the anticipation of flooding, the Cooper Avenue underpass will be closed between 74th Street and 69th Road in Queens. Please use alternate routes.

notification_title: Planned Implosion on Governors Island (BK, MN, SI)
email_body: Notification issued 6/7/13 at 10:00 AM. At 7:30 AM on Sunday, 6/9/13, a planned implosion of a building will be conducted on Governors Island. The implosion may be visible and audible from parts of Manhattan, Brooklyn, Staten Island, and New Jersey. FDNY, NYPD, and OEM will be on scene. The Department of Environmental Protection will also utilize portable air samplers in the area. For more information, please see the attached photo and press release.

Notification issued 6/6/13 at 8:30 PM. The NYC Office of Emergency Management has issued a Hazardous Travel Advisory for late this evening, 6/6, through early Saturday morning, 6/8. According to the National Weather Service, moderate to heavy rain is approaching NYC this evening ahead of the remnants of Tropical Storm Andrea. New Yorkers are urged to take precautions while traveling during this period. For more information, please see the attached press release or visit: http://www.erh.noaa.gov/er/okx/

notification_title: Road Closure/Traffic Delays due to Sink Hole (BK)
email_body: Notification issued 6/4/13 at 9:20 PM. Due to emergency street repairs, expect extensive traffic delays near Atlantic Ave and Bedford Ave in Brooklyn.

notification_title: FDNY & NYPD Drills on Roosevelt Island Tram (MN)
email_body: Notification issued 6/4/13 at 4:10 PM. Emergency personnel will conduct drills on a Roosevelt Island Tram cabin every Wednesday for the next five weeks beginning tomorrow 6/5/13, through 6/26/13, from 10 AM to 2 PM, and from 2 AM to 5 AM. As part of these training exercises, FDNY or NYPD personnel may climb on top of, or rappel down a suspended tram cabin. Tram service will not be disrupted during drills.

Notification issued 6/4/13 at 1:31 PM. Following an earlier incident, LIRR service has been restored between Mineola and Hicksville stations with residual delays. For updates: http://new.mta.info/lirr

Notification issued 6/4/13 at 12:13 PM. LIRR service is suspended in both directions between Mineola and Hicksville stations. The LIRR is establishing alternate service to/from the Ronkonkoma & Port Jefferson branches with a diesel shuttle train that will operate between Babylon and Hicksville, with train transfers at Hicksville to/from the Ronk. & Pt. Jeff. Branches. For updates: http://new.mta.info/lirr

notification_title: DEC Air Quality Health Advisory - Update (CW)
email_body: Notification issued on 5/31/2013 at 3:25 PM. The New York State Department of Environmental Conservation has issued Air Quality Health Advisories for New York City until 11 PM today, 5/31, and from 11 AM to 11 PM tomorrow, 6/1. Active children and adults, and people with respiratory problems, such as asthma, should reduce prolonged or heavy exertion outdoors. For more information, visit the National Weather Service at http://www.1.usa.gov/16w10Sq or the Department of Environmental Conservation at http://www.dec.ny.gov/cfmx/extapps/aqi/aqi_forecast.cfm

Notification issued 5/31/13 at 12:30 PM. Tomorrow, June 1 and Sunday, June 2, the filming of a movie will stage the aftermath of a simulated explosion with smoke effects on 43rd Street between 8th and 9th Avenues in Manhattan. The stunt will happen throughout the day from 8am to 8pm. NYPD and FDNY will be on site.

Notification issued on 5/31/2013 at 11:49 AM. The New York State Department of Environmental Conservation has issued an Air Quality Health Advisory for New York City until 11 PM today. Active children, adults, and people with lung disease, such as asthma, should reduce prolonged or heavy exertion outdoors. For more information visit the National Weather Service at http://1.usa.gov/16w10Sq or the Department of Environmental Conservation at http://www.dec.ny.gov/cfmx/extapps/aqi/aqi_forecast.cfm

Ms. Ruvolo is described as being 5'3' tall and weighing 140 lbs. She was last seen on May 30th at 5:00 PM wearing a light blue shirt and black pants. Ms. Ruvolo suffers from dementia and depression. A photo is attached; if you see this individual, please call 9-1-1.

email_body: Notification issued 5/22/13 at 4:30 PM. The New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Vulnerable Adult Alert for the disappearance of Paul Stanco, male, white, age 81, from Nassau County, NY. Mr. Stanco is described as 5'9' tall, 210 lbs., with white hair and hazel eyes, last seen wearing a red plaid long sleeve shirt, grey pants, and black shoes. notification_title: Metro-North Service Update due to Train Collision (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 5/18/13 at 1:00 AM. Due to the train collision in Bridgeport, CT, Metro-North train service on Saturday, May 18 remains suspended between South Norwalk and New Haven until further notice. Reduced, hourly service will operate between South Norwalk Station and Grand Central Terminal. Regular service will operate between Stamford and Grand Central Terminal. Regular service will be in effect on the New Canaan and Danbury Branches. Bus service will be in effect between Waterbury and Bridgeport with no train connections. Yankee game day service will be in effect between Stamford and Yankees-E. 153rd Street Station. For updated information, please visit http://ww.mta.info

notification_title: Planned Closure of the MN-Bound BK Bridge (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 4/26/13 at 12:00 PM. As part of the New York City Department of Transportation (DOT) project to rehabilitate the Brooklyn Bridge ramps and approaches, a full closure of the Manhattan-bound lanes of the bridge will be required this weekend, from 12:01 AM Saturday, April 27 to 6 AM Monday, April 29. During this 54-hour closure, all Manhattan-bound traffic will be redirected to alternate crossings, including the Manhattan Bridge, Williamsburg Bridge and the Brooklyn-Battery Tunnel, an MTA-tolled facility. For more information please visit http://www.nyc.gov/dot.

Notification issued 4/26/13 at 1:57 AM. Following a prior closure, the exit ramp from the eastbound Nassau Expressway onto the northbound Van Wyck Expressway in Queens has been reopened. Expect residual delays.
