notification_title: Increased Risk of Brush Fires - Citywide
email_body: Notification issued 4/3/13 at 10:00 AM. The NWS has issued a Red Flag Warning for NYC and surrounding areas. A Red Flag Warning means a combination of dry brush and gusty wind conditions support fire danger. Exercise extra caution when using outdoor gas and charcoal grills. In addition, smokers should never carelessly discard cigarettes. Immediately report a brush fire to 911. For more information, visit http://www.erh.noaa.gov/er/okx/.

Notification issued 03/12/2013 at 12:15 PM. FDNY will be training on a Roosevelt Island Tram cabin every Wednesday for the next 7 weeks, beginning March 13th, 2013 through April 24th, 2013 from 10 AM to 2 PM.    As part of the training exercise, FDNY personnel may be climbing on top of, or rappelling down from a suspended Tram cabin.    Tram service will not be disrupted.

Notification issued 03/12/2013 at 8:00 AM. The H.M.S. Edinburgh, a British Naval Destroyer, will conduct three ceremonial gun salutes during a welcome ceremony at Pier 7 (Port Authority Pier) in Brooklyn today, March 12th between 7:30 PM  8:00 PM. The gun salutes will consist of three (3) separate groupings of two-round bursts that will be fired during that time period.     In addition, The H.M.S. Edinburgh will arrive into port at approximately 10:00 AM today, and will depart on Sunday, March 17th at approximately 2:00 PM. During these days and times (weather permitting), the ship will be accompanied by a Lynx helicopter (see attached photo) taking photos of the ships movements.

The public is urged to avoid unnecessary travel, expect possible disruptions to public transportation, and stock up on potential supplies, including medicine. Alternate Side Parking is suspended citywide through Sunday, 2/10. For the full statement, please visit: http://t.co/3UbqzvDQ.

Notification issued 2/7/13 at 4:15 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Blizzard Warning for New York City from 6:00 AM Friday, 2/8 to 1 PM Saturday, 2/9. For more information visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

notification_title: Planned Closure of MN-Bound BK Bridge (BK & MN)
email_body: Notification issued 1/11/13 at 8:15 PM. This weekend, the Brooklyn Bridge will be fully closed to Manhattan-bound traffic for 54 consecutive hours. The closure begins at 12:01 AM on Saturday, 1/12/13, through 6:00 AM Monday, 1/14/13. Brooklyn-bound traffic will be maintained, which will access the bridge from Pearl St or Centre St using a contra-flow configuration. There will be additional access via the Park Row ramp from Frankfort St. This ramp will be available only from 6:00 AM Saturday, 1/12/13 until 1:00 AM Sunday, 1/13/13, and from 9:00 AM to 11:00 PM on Sunday, 1/13/13.

notification_title: MTA LIRR Full AM/PM Rush Hour Service to Resume (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 12/8/12 at 6:10 PM. The MTA Long Island Rail Road (LIRR) will operate full morning and evening rush hour service beginning Monday, December 10, as a result of Amtrak restoring the signal system capacity in one of its two flood-damaged East River tunnels. This will mark the first full service rush hour for the LIRR since Hurricane Sandy hit six weeks ago. The LIRR's off-peak service continues to operate on a regular schedule throughout the LIRR system.

notification_title: Odd-Even License Plate System for Gasoline Purchases Rescinded (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 11/23/12 at 3:40 PM. The odd-even license plate system for gasoline purchases will be rescinded as of 6:00 AM tomorrow, Saturday, 11/24/12. The City had originally established the odd-even license plate system on Friday, 11/9/12, to reduce wait times at gas stations and then allow the regional fuel supply to recover from damage caused by Hurricane Sandy. Currently, more than 85 percent of NYC gas stations are operational, and the available supply of gasoline is expected to increase. For more information, please visit: http://www.nyc.gov/portal/site/nycgov/menuitem.c0935b9a57bb4ef3daf2f1c701c789a0/index.jsp?pageID=mayor_press_release&catID=1194&doc_name=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.nyc.gov%2Fhtml%2Fom%2Fhtml%2F2012b%2Fpr439-12.html&cc=unused1978&rc=1194&ndi=1

Notification issued on 11/23/2012 at 12:00 PM: Starting on Monday, November 26th, the Great Kills Ferry is expected to run for eight weeks as storm recovery efforts continue, and will include six trips leaving a newly-constructed landing at Great Kills between 6:00 am and 9:00 am, bound for Pier 11 at Wall Street and continuing on to 35th Street, and six return departures in the afternoon, between noon to 6:15 pm. For more info, please visit http://www.nyc.gov/dot

email_body: Notification issued 11/20/12 at 2:50 PM. Emergency personnel are on the scene of a one alarm fire near Liberty St and Greenwich St, Manhattan. Expect possible traffic delays in the area.
Alert Issued 11/18/12 at 12:20 PM. The New York State Police have cancelled the AMBER Alert for Nahzir & Mlyliah Edwards.

Alert issued 11/18/12 at 9:25 AM. An AMBER Alert has been issued for a confirmed child abduction. Nahzir Edwards, 5 years old and Mlyliah Edwards, 2 years old have been abducted from Barber Avenue, in the Bronx. Nahzir Edwards is a Black male,approx 5 years old with black hair and brown eyes. Nahzir was last seen wearing a black sweater and blue pants. Child was not wearing shoes. Mlyliah Edwards is a Black female, approx 2 years old with black hair and brown eyes. Mlyliah was last seen wearing white shorts and a black sweater. Child was not wearing shoes.The suspect is Fitz Edwards, a Black male, approx 29 years old with braided,black hair and brown eyes. He is approx 6 feet tall. The suspect was last seen wearing a dark jacket. Suspect is slim build. Suspect is believed to be armed with a handgun. The suspect is expected to be traveling in a grey 4-door sedan 2005 Honda Accord with NY license plate number EWV6599. If the child or suspect are seen please contact 911

notification_title: Both Tubes of Hugh L. Carey Tunnel to Reopen in Both Directions (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 11/16/12 at 5:20 PM. Governor Andrew M. Cuomo announced today that both tubes of the Hugh L. Carey Tunnel, formerly known as the Brooklyn-Battery Tunnel, will reopen to traffic in both directions around the clock beginning at 6 AM on Monday, 11/19/12. Trucks are still barred from using the tunnel until further notice.

Silver Alert issued 11/16/12 at 7:10 AM. NYPD has issued a Silver Alert for the disappearance of Vilma Bowen, 71 year old, black female. She was last seen 11/14/12 at approximately 12:00 PM in the vicinity of New York Avenue and Foster Avenue, in Brooklyn. Ms. Bowen is described as 5'0', 135 lbs., medium complexion, brown eyes, grey hair, and was last seen wearing grey sweatpants, red windbreaker, and white sneakers. Ms. Bowen suffers from Alzheimer's. If you see Ms. Bowen, call 9-1-1.

notification_title: UPDATE: Alternate Side Parking Regulation Suspensions (BK)
email_body: Notification issued 11/16/12 at 3:00 AM. Effective immediately, alternate side parking regulations are reinstated in portions of Brooklyn Community Board 6. Regulations are reinstated east of, but not including, Hamilton Avenue. Previously announced suspensions continue until further notice. For more information and updates, please visit http://www.nyc.gov/dot.

notification_title: UPDATE: Alternate Side Parking Regulation Suspensions (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 11/14/12 at 5:00 PM. As of tomorrow, Thu 11/15/12, Alternate Side Parking (street cleaning) regulations will be suspended indefinitely in Brooklyn Community Boards 6 and 18, joining previously-announced suspensions in Brooklyn Community Boards 13 and 15, and Queens Community Board 14. The additional suspensions includes sections of Red Hook, Carroll Gardens, Cobble Hill, Park Slope, Gowanus, Boerum Hill, Bergen Beach, Canarsie, Mill Basin, Flatlands, Marine Park, Georgetown and Mill Island. The previously announced suspensions include Brighton Beach, Coney Island, Gravesend, Seagate, Sheepshead Bay, Manhattan Beach, Gerritsen Beach, Broad Channel, Breezy Point and the Rockaways. These localized exemptions will facilitate storm recovery in areas with the most extensive damage; street cleaning regulations in other areas of the city are reinstated as of today, 11/14/12. For more information and updates, please visit http://www.nyc.gov/dot, or see the attached maps.

Notification issued 11/13/12 at 6:20 PM. The New York City Department of Transportation announced that Alternate Side Parking regulations will be in effect in most of the city on Wednesday, November 14. It remains suspended indefinitely in Brooklyn Community Boards 13 and 15 and Queens Community Board 14 to allow for continued storm cleanup. These Community Boards include Brighton Beach, Coney Island, Gerritsen Beach, Gravesend, Manhattan Beach, the Rockaways and Sheepshead Bay. For more information/maps, please visit http://www.nyc.gov/dot.

notification_title: NYC Gas Rationing Regulations & Service Map (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 11/8/12 at 8:30 PM. The Mayor has established a temporary Odd-Even License Plate System for gasoline purchases in NYC. Starting at 6:00 AM tomorrow, Friday 11/9/12, and continuing until further notice, passenger automobiles with license plates ending in an even number or zero shall only purchase fuel in NYC on even numbered days of the month. Passenger automobiles with license plates ending in an odd number shall only purchase fuel in NYC on odd numbered days of the month. License plates not ending in a number shall be deemed an odd number license plate. For more information and updates visit http://www.nyc.gov. A Comprehensive Service Map is also available at http://www.google.org/crisismap/2012-sandy-nyc. The map includes gas station locations, shelters, warming centers, and food distribution sites.

He was last seen 11/6/12 at 4PM while sheltered in Brooklyn Tech High School, 29 Fort Greene Place, in Brooklyn. Mr. Thomas is described as 5'9', 140 lbs, having brown eyes with curly black hair and was last seen wearing a dark grey hooded jacket, tan khaki pants with red/black sneakers. Mr. Thomas is diabetic and suffers from schizophrenic claustrophobia. If you see Mr. Thomas, call 9-1-1. http://bit.ly/YZDBBw

Notification issued 11/6/12 at 9:20 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a High Wind Warning for 2 PM tomorrow, 11/7 through 4 AM Thursday, 11/8. Cold weather, rain and high wind gusts are expected. All NYC parks and beaches will be closed from 12 PM tomorrow, 11/7 until 12 PM Thursday, 11/8. The National Weather Service has issued a Coastal Flood Warning for NYC during the high tide cycles Wednesday afternoon through Thursday morning. For the most up to date NYC area weather forecasts, visit http://weather.gov/nyc. If you live in a low-lying or a flood prone area, an area already impacted by the recent hurricane, or have concerns about flooding, consider staying with friends or family outside affected areas or in a NYC evacuation shelter. Shelters in NYC are currently open. Locate the nearest shelter by visiting http://on.nyc.gov/SlpGEx. If you need assistance with transportation, call 311 for help. All evacuation centers have at least one wheelchair accessible entrance.

Notification issued 11/3/2012 at 9:50 PM. Per the City's Department of Health and the Department of Environmental Protection New York City's tap water remains safe, however Breezy Point's distribution system is privately managed and operated, and will not affect the rest of the City's drinking water. Breezy Point is isolated by back flow prevention devices and has not negatively impacted the City Water Supply. Water is being restored, where it can, in Breezy Point for the express purpose of firefighting and fire suppression. Because of what is assumed to be extensive damage to the water pipes in Breezy Point, the water is not drinkable, even after boiling. The City will be testing the water to determine the extent of the problem, but for now it's important that residents of Breezy Point not drink the water.

Notification issued 10/31/2012 at 7:15 PM. Due to flooding and power related shutdowns caused by Hurricane Sandy, wastewater treatment plants and pumping stations have discharged untreated wastewater into New York City waterways. The New York City Department of Health & Mental Hygiene advises that direct contact with the Hudson River, East River, New York Harbor, Jamaica Bay and the Kill Van Kull for recreational activities such as swimming, canoeing, kayaking, windsurfing, or any other water activity that would entail possible direct contact with the water should be avoided until further notice.     The Department of Environmental Protection is responding to the impacts caused by Hurricane Sandy on its wastewater treatment facilities and will monitor water quality conditions through testing to verify when these water bodies are safe for recreational uses. Notification issued 10/28/12 at 6:00 PM. Due to the impending storm, the following regional transit service disruptions will take effect until further notice: the Staten Island Ferry will operate until 8 PM tonight from St. George Terminal, SI, and until 8:30 PM from Whitehall Terminal, MN, tonight, after which service will be suspended. Some NY Waterway routes will be disrupted; East River Ferry service is suspended through tomorrow, 10/29 (http://www.nywaterway.com). NJ Transit has implemented a gradual system-wide shutdown of all bus, rail, light rail and Access Link service starting at 4 PM today (http://www.njtransit.com). All PATH train service and stations shut down at 12:01 AM Monday, 10/29 (http://www.panynj.gov/path). Amtrak will cancel Northeast Corridor service north of NYC starting at 7 PM tonight, and nearly all service on the eastern seaboard on Monday, 10/29, including Acela Express, Northeast Regional, Keystone and Shuttle trains (http://www.amtrak.com).

Alert issued 10/28/12 at 11:45 AM. New York City has ordered a MANDATORY EVACUATION of Zone A, the Rockaways, Hamilton Beach, and City Island. If you live in these areas you are required to leave ASAP but no later than tonight 10/28/12. To determine if you live in New York City evacuation Zone A and/or to find an evacuation center, please go to nyc.gov and click on the Hurricane Evacuation Zone Finder or contact 311

Notification issued 10/28/12 at 10:35 AM. Due to expected severe weather conditions, all MTA subway, and commuter rails suspended citywide as of Sunday, 10/28/12 at 7:00 PM. MTA bus service will be suspended as of Sunday, 10/28/12 at 9PM. Currently, there is no estimated time for service restoration. For updates visit: http://www.mta.info

notification_title: Storm Update: Shelters Open 10/28/12 at 9 AM (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 10/27/2012 at 9:15 PM. There is no evacuation order for New York City at this time; however, if you live in a low-lying area and have concerns about flooding or prolonged power loss, consider staying with friends or family outside the affected area. If you cannot stay with family or friends, shelters will be available in public schools around the city and will open at 9 AM tomorrow, 10/28. To find out what zone you live in and the location of your nearest shelter visit the OEM Evacuation Zone Finder at http://gis.nyc.gov/oem/he/index.html. If you cannot reach a shelter by yourself, call 311 for help with transportation. All evacuation centers have at least one wheelchair accessible entrance. Additionally, all NYC parks are closing at 5 PM tomorrow, 10/28. Learn more about preparing for coastal storms with the attached OEM Ready New York: Hurricanes and New York City Guide.

notification_title: OEM Encourages New Yorkers to Prepare for Severe Weather (CW)
email_body: Notification issued 10/27/2012 at 8:20 PM. The New York City Office of Emergency Management is closely monitoring the impending storm and wants to remind all New Yorkers to make sure their emergency plans are up to date and ready to go. For the latest information on the weather and emergency preparedness visit http://www.nyc.gov/severeweather. Encourage your friends and family to receive the latest information by signing up for Notify NYC at http://www.nyc.gov/notifynyc.

Notification issued 10/22/12 at 3:55 PM. This is an update for the Paerdegat Basin oil spill. The Boating Advisory has been lifted for the Paerdegat Basin. The New York State Department of Health continues to advise the public to avoid eating any fish or crabs from Paerdegat Basin or 200 yards from the mouth of Paerdegat Basin (in a small portion of Jamaica Bay) until further notice. The public is also reminded that all New York City waters are closed to shell fishing (harvest of clams, mussels, oysters or scallops). For additional information please visit: http://www.dec.ny.gov/press/86369.html

email_body: Alert issued 10/5/12 at 7:05 PM. The New York State Police Farmingdale have cancelled the AMBER Alert for Robert Rodriguez.

notification_title: AMBER Alert - 9 y/o Hispanic Male (Farmingdale, NY)
email_body: Alert issued 10/5/12 at 6:45 PM. The New York State Police have issued an AMBER Alert for the confirmed child abduction of Robert Rodriguez, a 9 year old white male. He is 4' tall, 50 lbs., with brown hair and green eyes. The child has autism. He was last seen in Farmingdale, NY. The suspect is a white male, 31 years old, 5'9', 180 lbs. For the most up to date information, visit http://amber.ny.gov. If you have any information, please dial 911.

notification_title: Closures of the Manhattan Bound Brooklyn Bridge (BK)
email_body: Notification issued 10/5/12 at 12:00 PM. As part of the New York City Department of Transportation (DOT) project to rehabilitate the Brooklyn Bridge ramps and approaches, a full closure of the Manhattan-bound lanes of the bridge will be required for two full weekends. From 11:59 PM Friday, October 5 to 6:00 AM Monday, October 8, and again from 11:59 PM Friday, October 12 to 6:00 AM Monday, October 15. During these two 54-hour closures, all Manhattan-bound traffic will be redirected to alternate crossings, including the Manhattan Bridge, Williamsburg Bridge, and the Brooklyn-Battery Tunnel, an MTA-tolled facility. For more information please visit www.nyc.gov/dot.

notification_title: BK-Battery Tunnel Closure for FDNY Stephen Siller Tunnel to Towers Run 9/29-9/30/12
email_body: Notification issued 9/29/12 at 11:00 AM. The Brooklyn-Battery Tunnel will be closed to all traffic late Saturday, 9/29 into Sunday, 9/30, during the annual FDNY Stephen Siller Tunnel to Towers Run, commemorating the FDNY firefighters run through the tunnel to the World Trade Center on 9/11/01. The Manhattan-bound tube will be closed from 11 PM on Saturday, 9/29 through 3 PM on Sunday, 9/30. The Brooklyn-bound tube will be closed from 8 AM until 1 PM on Sunday, 9/30. Motorists are advised to use alternate routes during this event.

Alert issued 9/5/2012 6:50 PM. The City of Newburgh Police has issued an AMBER Alert for confirmed child abduction of an unknown 5 year old female. She was last seen at South Jr High School, 33 Monument Street, around 3:50pm today, being grabbed and forced into a black/dark pick-up truck with possible green writing on it. She is described as black, 3 feet tall with long black hair. She was last seen wearing a short sleeve bright pink shirt. The suspects are described as two Hispanic males, one with long black hair with a black shirt and black baseball cap. The second suspect is light skinned. For the most up to date information, please visit http://amber.ny.gov. If you have any information, please dial 9-1-1.

notification_title: Air Force Week - Water Rescue/Helicopter Demo - 8/19/12
email_body: Notification issued 8/19/12 at 10:00 AM. Today at 2:45 PM, following the Air Force Week Opening Ceremony, the New York Air National Guards 106th Rescue Wing will conduct an open-water rescue demonstration with one (1) HH-60 helicopter adjacent to Pier 86 (the Intrepid). The demonstration will include Pararescue specialists simulating an open-water search-and-rescue effort. The helicopter will depart from the Downtown Heliport in Manhattan. Please find a photo of an HH-60 helicopter attached.

Notification issued 8/19/12 at 9:00 AM. In conjunction with the Opening Ceremony of Air Force Week, the U.S. Air Force Aerial Demonstration Team, the Thunderbirds - in seven (7) F-16D Falcon jets - will conduct a flyover of the Hudson River and the Intrepid Sea, Air & Space Museum today between 12:45 PM and 1:10 PM. The aircraft will depart from south of the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge. Please find a photo of F-16D aircraft attached.

Dear Notify NYC Subscriber:     Thank you for your continued enrollment in New York Citys emergency notification system! In an effort to offer enhancements to our subscribers, well be migrating to a new notification provider during the next few months. The content you receive from Notify NYC will remain the same but the messages may appear different.    E-mail Address  Emails may come from either NotifyNYC@NotifyNYC.net or swnalert@sendwordnow.com, please make sure both of these email addresses are on your safe sender list. Please do NOT reply to these email addresses, they are not monitored.    Text Messages   Text messages may come from short code 29276 or from NotifyNYC@NotifyNYC.net.     Phone Calls  Phone calls will continue to come from (212) 639-9675.    Should you have any questions or concerns, do not hesitate to contact the Office of Emergency Managements Public Warning Team at NotifyNYC@oem.nyc.gov.     Thank you,    New York City Office of Emergency Management

notification_title: Missing Senior Notification - Gene Johnson M/B/78
email_body: Notification issued on 8/3/2012 at 6:50 AM. The NYPD has issued a Missing Senior Notification for Gene Johnson, black male, age 78. He was last seen inside a Chase bank located at 9601 Foster Avenue in Brooklyn on 8/2/2012 at approximately 12:00 PM. He is described as being 6'1', 180 lbs., with brown eyes and black hair. He was last seen wearing grey khaki pants, navy blue and grey long sleeve button down shirt, black shoes and a black leather cap. He is in good physical but poor mental health. If you see Mr. Johnson, please contact 1-800-577-8477    The sender included the following attachment:  https://attachments.sendwordnow.com/Attachments.aspx?token=7c65de16-3714-41ed-8933-a25743366a2

Dear Notify NYC Subscriber:  Thank you for your continued enrollment in New York Citys emergency notification system.  Over the next few months the City will be making a series of enhancements to the Notify NYC program in order to provide you more relevant and localized information near where you live, work, and go to school. In preparation for those changes, the Registration Portal  where you can view/modify your account settings  will be updated this evening, May 3, 2012.  When registering addresses in the future, you will need to provide a valid physical address OR a valid intersection. After the update is completed, you may notice some changes the next time you log into your account. What changes you see, if any, will depend upon how you entered your address information into the system when you originally registered.  If youve already registered a valid street address:  Any valid street address already in the system will not be changed; you should not see any modification to your notification addresse

In addition, smokers should never carelessly discard cigarettes. Immediately report a brush fire to 911. For more information, visit http://www.erh.noaa.gov/er/okx/.

notification_title: Bridge Lifts Extended at Marine Parkway-Gil Hodges (QN)
email_body: Notification issued 03/24/12 at 12:07 PM. Due to a restoration project in Jamaica Bay, multiple, daily bridge lifts of the Marine Parkway-Gil Hodges Memorial Bridge that began January 26th will be extended through April. The lifts will take place around-the-clock and require full closure of the bridge to traffic. It takes roughly 15 minutes to raise and lower the bridge. Motorists are advised to use Cross Bay Veterans Memorial Bridge as an alternate route. Driving will be difficult, especially in high profile vehicles and on elevated roads and bridges. For the latest weather information visit: http://www.weather.gov/nyc
